The place is super small, but since most people take their food to go during the lunch rush it doesn't matter much.

Nice, friendly staff too.
author: Captain B.

description: Very solid gyro combo with fries and can of soda for $13 at lunch.  Plenty of food and I don't even need much dinner later!  Better than the other Mediterranean options around SOMA i've tried.
author: Mike J.

description: Fast food with generous portions and a convenient location.  Friendly staff too.
author: Matt U.

description:
Fast 'n' fresh. That's why I like Ayola. 

Don't come here expecting to sit and dine and have a leisurely lunch -- this place is strictly counter service and getouttahere, so have a spot in mind to fill your face pre-visit. 

The falafel platter was one of, if not the, best to-go lunch I've had in SoMa, and that's saying something. The price was right, the ingredients fresh and the aftermath was a full tummy, but not gut-busted -- just refueled and ready for the rest of the day. 

There's a ton of great options on the menu, and truth be told we were all thrilled with our meals, especially the scrumptious sauces, so be adventurous and have fun with your lunch. Yay for Ayola!
author: Hilary H.

description:
This place was whatever - why are there such good reviews for Ayola?

Came here on a recommendation from a friend and she's usually accurate but I was disappointed. Almost 10 bucks for fries and a chicken shawarma sandwich - no bueno. It didn't have enough chicken and the flavor was bland. The fries were regular fries, don't see what the big deal is... don't come if you don't have to - I was not a fan and this was on the pricey-er side and not very delicious. 

Oh I also got the dessert to share between me and my friend - pistachio baklava... it was okay, probably not worth the 2.50 I paid for... darn it :/
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Ayola is Smule's go-to restaurant when we crave Mediterranean food. Ayola has consistently and punctually delivered great food to our office to feed 40+ hungry people.

Their menu is filled with awesome pita sandwiches, salads, and various sides. I love their Troy Salad (gyros meat on a Greek salad). It comes with tons of long, thin strips of gyros meat that pack a ton of flavor. Even though the meat can be drier than usual gyros meat, I actually don't mind that; I eagerly devour the salad, usually with a side order of hummus.

For very large orders, we place them the evening before the meal. The delivery guy is super friendly and even helps unpack and lay out our order on the table. Our orders cover their entire menu (it's all so good), and there are never any leftovers!
author: Mark C.

description: Quite an unpleasant experience. The menu said they add onions, tomatoes, cucumber & lettuce to all their sandwiches. But we found no cucumber & onions in out Falafel sandwich. On confronting the server, he was rude and just said that they assumed people liked it without veggies. And the overall taste was quite mediocre
author: Vineel S.

description: Had a chicken gyro and it was okay...used two spicy sauces..
author: Denise C.

description:
My favorite SOMA lunch spot when I'm in a rush. The food comes fast and both the traditional and Chicken Gyros are solid. Things taste fresh and their hot sauce is the right balance of spicy and smokey to mix with the traditional creamy flavors of a gyro. Get there before noon or else you'll be waiting in a long line though. 

The staff is focused on getting you in and out the door fast, so don't expect service. Then again, that focus on turnover in the line is what makes Ayola a great quick bite amidst the lunch rush.
author: Will S.

description:
I'm just not a fan. 

The fries are perfect but I've tasted better. Maybe it's the seasoning?

I had a chicken gyro and I just didn't like the meat. The wrap, lettuce, sauce was great! So I just ate around it.

Note: Green Peace people work like a block away from there and they will stop you for a monthly donation.
author: Ida H.

description:
Had the lamb/beef gyro with hummus, tahini and some of their hot sauce.  Delicious.  The house-made hot sauce is awesome.

The fries were decent but nothing special, not sure why people rave about them.

I'll definitely be going back next time I'm craving a gyro or might even try one of their salads.
author: Dan I.

description:
This is a great quick lunch option. The group of five of us were in and out in the height of the lunch rush within 10 minutes.

The staff at Ayola were courteous while getting the job done and everyone moving through quickly.

So why the three stars? I ordered the chicken shawarma sandwich, and it most definitely was not the shaved meat goodness that I usually accompany with shawarma. It was more like chunks of chicken in tzatziki sauce. The sandwich was OK, but again, not what I was expecting, and others in my party that ordered the same thing agreed. 

I also ordered dolma, and I did enjoy those. The rice and spices were packed well in the grape leaves -- not the limp, falling apart rolled treats that I am sometimes given to eat. 

So, to summarize, four to five stars for service and two to three for food.
author: Emily H.

description: I work right across the way from New Montgomery and I was looking for something Semi-Healthy and so I decided to go for this place. Specifically a Chicken Gyro and Ohhh Emm Gee I am so glad that I did! I ordered online to avoid the lines so right when I got there it was ready for me to pick up. I suggest doing that for lunch time because it gets a bit crazy in there.  It is right next to working girl. Sooo about my chicken gyro... it was Yummmmazing! The chicken was so soft and sliced perfectly, the lettuce was nice and fresh, the taziki (don't know how to spell it) was soon good, i suggest getting some hot sauce tho, I had mine with sriracha and man oh man it was perf! The Pita bread was nice and soft... it gets a tad messy eating this so make sure to grab some napkins!
author: Mariethonnie M.

description:
I came here for lunch and order the Chicken gyros...wow it was good! I ordered the small size but it was definitely plenty to keep me full til dinner. Also turned my gyro into a combo and got the french fries and a drink. The fries were yummy also actually, almost reminded me of BK fries (back when they were good). 
Service here was quick overall, was out in less than 10 min and easy to order and take to go. 
My gyros was tasty, there was alot of lettuce piled in but the chicken was good. I'd return again if in the area and was craving gyros! Easy under $10 lunch.
author: Miss H K.

description: I've been to Ayola a few times now for multiple flavors of gyro, and on one occasion for the chicken shawarma sandwich.  Extremely tasty, and generous portions no matter which size you choose.  What's perhaps most unfortunate is that the featured photo for Ayola isn't their delicious fries.  They're amazing!  Do yourself a solid and add them to your order.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Josh B.

description:
Talk about a hole in the wall, I had a hard time finding it at first because it's really small.  But the food is great.

Normally, I think of gyros as pretty heavy food, but Ayola felt surprisingly light.  I had the chicken gyro, and there was a lot of meat packed into that thing, and the perfect balance of veggies and taziaki sauce.  It also had some herbs (almost like dillweed?) which gave it an interesting kick.

I'll be coming back for sure!
author: Andy V.

description:
I have to say this food was worthy of it's 4-star upkeep.  The service was a bit unfriendly but genuine and thorough.  I was in and out in a matter of 5 mins and it seemed hardly true when they called my name and I was behind a long list of people who came before me.  The cooks move quick and the food seems to be cooked to perfection. 

Now let me finish these fries. :)
author: Kevin J.

description:
My favorite lunch spot in the Financial District!  We fondly call it "The Greek" around the office, and I look forward to go here on the days that I don't bring a lunch.

I've had their gyros before, and yes they're good, but my #1 thing that I always get is their Sparta Salad. The chicken is so moist, and flavorful and it's bedded on top of mixed greens, feta, cucumbers, and tomatoes. I love their special red sauce (I usually get 4 containers), and I drown it all over my salad. They also give 4-5 pieces of warm pita bread, and it's so fluffy and brings me back to my honeymoon in Greece. I also love their Troy Salad (basically the same thing as the Sparta but with gyro meat), but it's too heavy for an afternoon lunch and I am left with a food baby and a deep food coma. 

Service is speedy and their salads are priced at only $9, which in FiDi standards is cheap. I love this place!
author: Victoria B.

description:
I came here during my lunch break. The original intent was to go to chipotle next door, but we ended up here. I ordered the eggplant one combo meal. It's like 10.xx

The order took a super long time, and everybody was waiting a long time. There was only 1 order before us, which came out really fast. Then after that, it was just slow. There was a small crowd just waiting for food (15 minutes).

When I got my order, my friend who ordered after me waited another 5 minutes to get his... I started munching on fries, which were super delicious. They were hot and fresh, so maybe this is why we waited so long... fresh fries. Seriously. Amazing fries!
I grabbed some hot sauces and after my friend got his order, we went back to eat in class. The eggplant thing that I got was actually really really good. The hot sauce isn't super spicy, and it has some sourness to it. Pretty good.

It's not that cheap though. 

If you get the fries and drink combo, it's +3. If you get just fries its +2.75.

Overall, I enjoyed my meal.

Pros: 
- Delicious food!
- hot sauce

Cons:
- Wait time (even when there weren't that many people).
- No napkins included in to-go order.
- Somewhat expensive for what you get.

I'm torn, because while it's really good, I'm not 100% convinced the price per value is worth it.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I work about a mile from this place so it ended up being a 2 mile hike to grab lunch today... The reviews were solid so I was like what the hell and headed out for my journey.

I got the 9 inch gyro and to their credit it was 9 inches... but pretty skinny. The gyro meat was quite dry but still pretty yummy if you load it up with the sauce. Because the gyro was so skinny, each bite I was overwhelmed by the amount of bread. I'm used to having the gyros where the meat overflows from the bread but at ayola it was basically the complete opposite. 

Recommend: Avoid the gyro unless you want a mouthful of bread
author: Matthew L.

description:
3.5 stars

Hole in the wall.  It was opened on a Saturday when we were in the neighborhood and decided to give it a try.  Had the lamb gyro, pretty good - what made it better was their hot sauce, super delicious.  

Gentleman behind counter (owner) was super friendly.
author: Gloria H.

description:
First - this gyro isn't cheap. It's a pricey lunch - a small chicken gyro with a side of fries was $10! 

Second - It was delicious. The gyro was tasty, fresh and moist - I was quite happy. I got it without cucumbers and they overdosed on the lettuce a bit, but, now I know "less lettuce" next time. The fries are delicious crispy unhealthy bites... I had to refrain from eating the entire bag. 

And, if you order a gyro you are in and out faster than the other folks I noticed, so there is your speed tip. 

Good stuff!
author: Sarah S.

description:
This is a great cheap, fast, and filling lunch for the downtown work lunch crowd!

There may be a line out the door for their lunch rush but they are super quick about taking orders and getting your food to you quick!

I love their combo platter as it has a little bit of everything. The gyros are pretty filling and I usually get the chicken or the falaffel.

Don't forget to add and order of their delicious fries and grab plenty of their spicy red sauce! Yum!
author: Christine W.

description: The fries here are incredible. They also have excellent gyros. Don't forget to grab some of their sauce, too!
author: Taylor H.

description: In town visiting  and staying at the W. Wanted something a little lighter and not just a run of the mill cafe salad. Read the reviews and gave it a shot, Sparta salad was perfect and with warm pita bread. My only regret was that I didn't grab some hummus for it... But there's always tomorrow
author: Robyn M.

description:
Yet another decent, but not amazing FiDi establishment. I got the gyro plate, and the meat was a bit drier than I would have liked. 

Nothing really amazed me in the mix, and the pita tasted very manufactury, if that's possible. 

I probably should have tried the fries, but I figured that the plate would be more than enough for me. The dressing for the salad is really thick and sour. They put it on the side, which might have been because I took it to go, but it wasn't the traditional dressing that I'm used to with Greek food. 

Will definitely continue my search for more impressive Mediterranean food spot in FiDi.
author: Annie S.

description: Oh yum. I came here for lunch right before the place got crowded (a little before noon?), and I ordered a 7 inch gyro. It came out pretty fast and mmmmmm I liked it! I wish the gyro had more food inside and came with a lot of tzatziki sauce in it though. I'm definitely coming back for lunch, but next time I'll get a 9 inch with extra tzatziki sauce and hot sauce!
author: Annie S.

description: I went here at least 2 times a week when the SF Paramedic Association was around the corner on Mission.  The gyro is so good, it has all the usual stuff: salad, sauce,meat.  But the meat is so savory and melt in the mouth awesome.  I would sometimes get one at lunch, then get one to go to eat at home later.   Oh ya... the fries are the S&&T!
author: Jennifer D.

description:
Came here for lunch, the place looks run down inside. All the seats are ripped and it just looked unclean. The food was mediocre. We tried the gyros and it was nothing special. Their fries were pretty good. 

While I was there, a lady came in to return her food because she found a hair. It was weird seeing the employees try to figure out where the hair came from. None of them had hair nets on or hats, so that explains the hair..

I wouldn't come back to this place.
author: Rosary N.

description: To me the tatziki is not tatziki it´s the dressing version. At a place with greek food I expect real greek tatziki which is the thick yoghurt, real cucumber in it and more garlic. The gyro to me didn´t taste much as it normally does. The fries where very good.
author: Hanna A.

description:
Had the chicken shawerma and it was just ok. Again, these greek places do not compare to NYC. I asked for spicy and it was not at all.

Chicken was pretty good quality and bread was fresh. Just wish there were more  veggies and hot sauce.
author: Karen S.

description:
Probably the best place to grab a quick to-go lunch within a few block area. Certainly your best option on this block of New Montgomery in particular. Ayola is ridiculously fast, and the gyros, falafel and fries are all better than average.

By the way, I didn't love the fries at first -- I didn't think they lived up to the hype from all of my co-workers -- but they've grown on me since and I crave them.
author: Chris T.

description: The chicken shawarma is made up of bland chunks of dry white chicken meat. This is NOT shawarma, which is spiced and roasted on a spit. The "best fries in town" are from the freezer and dusted with black pepper. I don't taste anything different about them. Gyros are processed meat, not homemade. 4-5 star reviews?
author: B. L.

description:
Their Lamb/Beef Gyro is pretty damn good. It's not Phenomenal. It can be a little bland for some, but add some hot sauce and you'll be fine. But, it's good enough to be the center of a combo meal. Their combo includes a fries and a drink. Those fries are amazing! 

They're the perfect combination between crispy exterior and soft center. Personally, I love those types of fries. They aren't the fat fries like eating a bunch of soft potatoes mush and aren't the skinny McDonald's fries. 

Damn, I'm hungry for Ayola fries again...
author: Jonathan T.

description: OmGosh so good! Always super filling. I love the fries but I can never finish both, so I share a meal with a coworker. Since it is pricy, it's better that way anyways. I ordered online in advance and I still had to wait when I arrived. That would be my only complaint about the location. However, don't let that discourage you that the food isn't amazingly delicious and give it a try at least once. I keep going back but I just don't order online because it didn't save me any time.
author: Allison B.

description:
Came here for lunch today.  There was a bit of a line, but no worries, looks like the staff knows how to move the lunch rush pretty efficiently.  I went ahead and ordered my lamb/beef gyro - $7.07.  Took about five minutes for my order to be ready, grabbed some hot sauce and headed out into the nice sun to eat my lunch.

The gyro itself was just alright.  For $7.07 SF dollars, I'd say I got a good amount of food, it was quite tasty, but definitely could be better, possibly more yogurt sauce next time?  The meat wasn't too dry, but not very juicy either. And as for the hot sauce, not as hot as I hoped it to be, but it was a nice addition to my gyro.  

I've definitely heard good things about other items on the menu (falafel, chicken shwarma), so I could see myself heading back to Ayola.
author: Cindy L.

description:
Okay, unlike other reviewers, I have not tried their fries... though I am sure they are awesome!

I am on the quest for the best Chicken Shawerma. There's is served on a bed of salad instead of rice - YES! I LOVE how quickly they move through the lunch line and serve up "to go" meals quickly. They have to, given how small their place is.   I thought the baba ganoush and hummus were  very tasty and appreciate that they warm up the pita bread, but don't leave it hard.  I've also had their falafel wrap (the cashier misheard my order), but it was pretty good, so I can't complain.
author: Bernadette W.

description: Solid.   Fast in and fast out.   The shawarma is tasty and the spicy sauce is just awesome.    Fries are nice and thick.    I'd come back here every week if I was working in the area.
author: Albert W.

description: I'm not ashamed to say that I come here a few times a month #noregrets. This is hands down my favorite place to grab lunch in the Fidi. I always get the chicken shawarma with a side of fries and sauce. Thank GOD I do not live near this place or else my pants would be busting out of the seams!
author: Samantha S.

description: Typical lunch stop. Quick, no frills. Decent gyros - nothing spectacular.
author: Howe L.

description:
Quite mediocre food. I am surprised this place has such a high rating. I did not get any food poisoning, but was quite disappointed with the train-station-level quality. 

For almost $10, I got a salad which would cost something like $6 in overpriced mid-town Manhattan.. It is not organic, the tuna "salad" turned out to be just canned tuna, no promised salad. The greek salad consisted of pale salad leafs, 2 olives and 2 cherry tomatoes (I counted) for the whole plate with lots and lots of feta cheese.... As I said, train-station-quality. 

The nearby Chipotle has a much better deal, not to mention a number of new places in the hood. Would never be back, wish I could get my money back. 

It is OK for places like this to exist, but the rating should be appropriate to the quality, so that people dont get too disappointed.
author: Lynn H.

description: My go-to place for lunch.  Excellent lentil soup and fantastic french fries.  Everything else is solid--but not special.
author: Susan T.

description:
I came here for lunch with my friend. The place was like a hole in the wall, I would've missed it if I haven't looked at the cross streets beforehand. They have two small tables and four bar seats; its set up is more for to-go orders rather than dine in. I wasn't sure if it was the place, but I don't recall Greek food smelling a certain way. I couldn't tell if I took a whiff of pretty bad B.O. or what, but that was my first interaction with the store as I walked in. No bueno. 

I ordered the gyro lunch special. Ten bucks will get you a can of soda or a bottle of water, a 7 inch pita sandwich with lamb and beef gyro meat with lettuce, chopped tomatoes, and tzatziki sauce, and also an order of fries. I wanted to try their fries anyway, since I've heard good things about them and have tried them before when coworkers brought back leftovers. So the value pretty much goes to the drink, you can order your pita sandwich and fries at regular price and get the drink for a quarter.

Food was pretty alright. I got my food 5 minutes after ordering, which is extremely good for a financial district lunch. The pita was very fluffy and fresh. My sandwich contained 3 large pieces of gyros, the meat wasn't that superb though, a bit on the drier side and not much taste. I love it when my gyros is oh so aromatic from the lamb and the spices. I wish I had more sauce, I love tzatziki sauce! The fries were good because they're kinda healthy, not the deep fried style, and they had crushed black pepper sprinkled all over it. Overall, I can only take so many pieces of thick cut fries, I got sick of the starchy texture after I was halfway done with my fries. The entire meal was too filling for me though. Maybe I shouldn't have ordered my fries.

Overall, food was like a 4, I'm giving it a 3 because of that weird smell in the very beginning.
author: Connie C.

description: Love the Sparta salad! The roasted chicken is delicious! Good portion size for a salad. It comes with warmed pita bread. There always a lineup during lunch, but the line moves pretty fast.
author: Kai Y.

description:
Just grabbed a gyros from this joint and found it to be a nice place to quickly pickup lunch. I was teetering on 3 and 4, but ultimately decided on giving the place a 4 because of the cleanliness and efficiency, as well as the bang for your buck.

I ordered the 9 inch lamb gyros and they definitely do not skimp on the lamb. I had a nice portion of lamb in every bite. On numerous occasions, I found myself eating a gyros (or a burrito), and the last couple bites lack the substantive meat I ordered.  At Ayola, I was pleasantly surprised to be biting into a big chunk of lamb right up to the very end. The spicy sauce they have at the counter gives it a nice kick and keeps the gyros flavorful and moist. The fries were ok, typical salt and peppered potato wedges. I'll likely skip on the fries and drink combo next time. Definitely recommend if you work in the area and need a quick bite to eat.
author: Cody M.

description: Small place with just one or two tables. The Falafel wrap is awesome for lunch! Don't have to wait long.
author: Nikhil D.

description:
I love their fries! I'm normally a skinny fry type of person and steer clear of thick fries but these are right in the middle and seasoned perfectly. 

I get a value meal which includes a drink, gyro, and fries.  Great bang for your buck. Be sure to also grab some of their spicy dipping sauce =)
author: Jessica D.

description:
Sorry, i'm a little biased when it comes to Mediterranean restaurant food, because I always compare every one that I happen to try, to my personal favorite - East Side Pockets out in Providence, RI. Those guys are truly the best and you absolutely cannot top their sauce.

With that shameless promo being said, Ayola does a pretty good job of measuring up. I came in for late lunch and went out fulfilled. Had the regular Falafel, that included lamb. I asked for the McD treatment - fries and coke. cheesy? Yes, okay...

The order came out to a reasonable 10.50 in my mind. I was pumped about eating some lamb. The food came out in minutes and there were a number of people ordering. Great service! When I got down to scarfing down the falafel, it was slightly on the dry side but that's okay the flavor was still there. It felt like it needed some of that good ol' East Side Pocket sauce. Sorry! I would still come here anyway. 

The one thing you have to know about this place is the taste of their fries. It was as if you were to order fries from Burger King and asked them to make them physically larger. That potato is so moist on the inside and it's just perfectly crisped on the outside. Nice touch to the side meal.
author: Michael C.

description:
Had the chicken shawarma for lunch yesterday. Decent food, but there was very little that was actually Greek about it. It was as if somebody just folded a chicken sandwich into a pita, dropped a yogurt sauce on it and called it good. The girl at the counter never smiled. She asked me if I wanted spicy and I said yes, it wasn't. No perceptible marinade on the meat or flavor in the sauce. Based on the reviews, maybe I should move on to the lamb platter?

Again...decent...but a lack of flavor that I don't expect from Greek food.
author: Marcus D.

description: A quick place to grab a gyro but unfortunately something there gave me a serve allergic reaction so now I am a bit weary to coming back here again. The gyro was excellent and service was very quick they just crank out their food like a machine.
author: Vanessa S.

description: Great lunch place! As a visitor from out of town, it was great! The food was fresh and tasty!!
author: Michelle S.

description: Consistently good gyros and fries. This is my go to spot in the city when im craving a gyro.  Just wish they were open later!
author: Nazanin R.

description:
I ordered the 9" gyro with fries. Total came out to be almost $13. Kinda expensive for a lunch. The gyro itself was delicious. They put a lot of meat in it which is a plus. It tasted even better with the hot sauce they had at the counter. 
I knocked off a star for their service. The lady taking my order wasn't friendly and a bit rude.
author: Genie Y.

description: I really like this place, a LOT.  Food is super flavorful, service is nice and fast, and prices are reasonable.  I've tried the gyro, chicken schwarma, and the tory salad.  Oh, and the fries (naughty!).  My go to lunch option is the gyro meal deal.  Only complaint - when I get back to my office and unwrap my gyro, tzatziki sauce ends up all over my desk (I think they could be more careful when slathering on the sauce).
author: Stacey S.

description: Great gyros and fry combo. Not aMAZing but definitely solid. One of my go-to places when I was working closer to it.
author: Esther S.

description:
Having been to greece for our honeymoon, we know what the original gyros taste like. This place is the way to go for Mediterranean food. We enjoyed amazing hummus, tabbouleh, gyros, fresh tasty bread. You have to try it if you haven't yet! 

I simply loved it and how fast they where to get our food ready !
author: The K.

description:
I came here a few times as the folks at my old company loved this place and touted it as authentic (methinks not). I had the falafel here as well as the chicken salad, fries and gyro. The fries are fine, the falafel is dry, the gyro is smothered in yogurt sauce that tastes far too much like mayo and the chicken salad is a lot of lettuce. The only thing I liked was the spicy sauce here.
If you want a good gyro, kefta, shwarma or falafel, check out Oasis on Drumm - now that's delicious!
author: Maria G.

description: Good stuff! I just got the plain 7" gyro wrap for lunch. Nothing too special but solid. The hot sauce on the side is a nice addition. The tabouleh was really good and fresh, and also went well on the gyro. It did get a little messy, but not much can be done about that. Got here right before noon and didn't have to wait, though the line did start growing as we were eating. Not much space to sit down, especially if you do come here a bit later.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
I've been going here for awhile.  It's decent.  Prices have been going up, and I get that.  But it seems like the gyros have been shrinking.  The menu states 7 inches and 9 inches gyros.  Looking at what I got today, it's really shrinking.  I just measured, and it's 5 inches.  Yeah, not going here again.

Not sure what they actually make.  They don't make the wraps, fried are frozen, and I doubt the make is make there.  Maybe they make the hot sauce.  Looks like they just put pre-made stuff together.  Other places actually make their gyro meat.
author: Hugo Y.

description:
I came here for lunch today, and had the chicken shawarma wrap. Chicken had a great flavor, and the wrap bread itself was just the right mix of soft and chewy. I can't wait to come back and try their gyro.

Fries, ordered at the suggestion of the friend I was with, were great, too.
author: Eric F.

description:
There I was, a good little Yelp loyalist, all ready to grab a 4-star sandwich from a carefully plotted route to a pre-ordained destination. And then, in the vein of The Beatles, I saw her standing there.

I'm a sucker for good graphics, and Ayola called to me with just the right font, saying just the right words: "Gyro - Falafel - Hummus." I usually deliberate the optimal menu item, but the Hortopita was my match made in pita heaven, and I ordered a 7-inch with no hesitation.

In London, I have to debate capitulating to using local term "aubergine," or stick to my American roots with "eggplant." I've never heard of a "horto," but I think it translates to "cold yet heart-warming, sweet and savory eggplant slices." Add crunchy romaine and a toasty pita, and I've got a lunch item to write London about. "Aubergine" this!
author: Alice S.

description: Super fast, super good, and good value.  What more could you want.  I am a sucker for the complimentary house spicy red pepper sauce.  Everything on the menu is solid.  Throw a dart and be happy.
author: Bob K.

description:
Pretty Good Falafel.
The place itself  leaves much to be desired and the service is hit or miss. My advice, get takeout and try the house hot sauce.
author: Adrienne G.

description: I eat here once a week, and can't get enough of their chicken gyro. It is good in a wrap on on a salad with their homemade balsamic vinaigrette. It is priced accordingly, and serves very quick food. They also have a good variety of options if you want tzatziki or hummus to go with your salad or gyro. The fries are fresh, hot and crisp, and have a pretty unique but delicious seasoning on them.
author: Michael J.

description: Good Greek food close to Moscone Convention Center. The gyros and shwarmas are good. Fun to sit at the window and watch the good views on New Montgomery St.
author: Peter K.

description: Tried the gyro which was okay, not awesome. I'm a fan of the eggplant salad and the lentil soup. 4 stars is definitely too much for this place but I would give it 3.5.
author: Lea G.

description:
Decent gyros.  People talk like the fries are the best ever - they are decent, but they're just regular fries.

The real reason I go is that this place is a machine.  It always seems to be crowded, but you never have to wait too long.  Not quite sure how they bang out the food so quickly, but they do.

Go with the gyro sandwich!  Hummus ain't bad either - the combo platter with the hummus and dolma is decent.  Falafels are eh~.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
While is Ayola is a solid, though unhealthy, lunch option, I almost never actually crave it. They have a tasty, if a little greasy, gyro wrap and pretty delicious fries. They will actually put fries IN the wrap if you ask but in my experience they only put a few which is disappointing. You're better off ordering a side of fries and putting them inside yourself. 

If you go early enough to miss the long lines they are always pretty fast which is good, plus their semi-spicy red sauce stuff is addicting! They have little containers of it next to where you order, don't forget to grab one (or three) on your way out!
author: Ely L.

description:
I come here more for the convenience than to satisfy actual cravings. If I need a quick lunch, this is where I go. Don't be discouraged if you see a long line; they move people in and out really quickly.

The gyros and shawarma are both good, and make sure to get the hot sauce by the counter too. The fries are pretty good, but I just usually choose not to get them; fries are never a healthy choice anyways!
author: Nikhil S.

description: Nothing special. Serves the purpose of hunger satisfaction.
author: Zeni B.

description: I appreciated that they were open until 7:30 PM, but I didn't think the chicken schwarma was very good. It was under-seasoned to me, both in the marinade and the amount of garlic in the sandwich. Additionally, some of the other ingredients were not particularly fresh. After hearing the raves about the hot sauce, I had it added, but it ended up only in a corner of the pita and was just ok. The falafels were a bit better but not as good as Sunrise Deli. I would go elsewhere.
author: Lisa K.

description:
This place is alright! Stopped by here for a quick lunch because I wasn't craving sandwiches. Even though there was a line, it only took 5 minutes to order and get my food.

I got the gyros platter, and it was totally satisfying if not overly memorable. The ingredients were very fresh, the Greek salad dressing was good, and the hot sauce is  the bomb diggity (not spicy at all though). My only complaint was the gyros meat was cold- this whole plate would've been amazing if it were warm.

This is a total hole in the wall with very little seating. It's a good option as a quick lunch option, and that's a-OK by me.
author: Linh L.

description:
I think it's a solid 3.5!

We mostly order delivery, but have done take out also.
Some of our go-tos are:
- Sparta Salad (roasted chicken)
- Troy Salad (gyro meat)
- Combo platters
The good is that they are all priced for under $10, which I feel like is becoming a rarity in SF. Their hummus, dolmas, and falafels are actually pretty tasty and the meat is ALWAYS juicy, no complaints at all there. They also tend to give extra pita bread, which is always well-received to dip into their yummo hummo.

Service is friendly but I'm taking away the half star because order accuracy can be inconsistent. We've had forgotten sides from time to time and they can run late... the saddest days are when they forget fries, because I'm a sucker for hot and crispy fries. They are not the closest to our office, so it normally ends up with a refund rather than having them come back an hour later with a side of fries. That's ok, not enough of a deterrent!
author: Jade T.

description:
Come here for the fries and their special hot sauce, which isn't very hot at all but it's unique and you HAVE to have it. Idk what it is about their fries because to be honest, it's kind of plain but I'm always craving it!!

I always order the same thing, chicken shawarma (no tomato) and fries. They put out their special sauce freely near the cashier so you can take however many (I would stock up on this if I could but I'm too embarrassed so I only take 1). Trust, you NEED the sauce for the shawarma and for their fries. I think they're kind of pricey here but most Mediterranean places are so it's not a big deal.
author: V L.

description:
I live for their Sparta salad and french fries.

The Sparta salad comes with a bunch of chicken, and pita bread. Grab some of their spicy red sauce to dip the pita into. Only gripe is that the olives in the salad are not pitted.

The fries are thick cut, and salted pretty well.

The place can get pretty packed just after noon, so if you can make it in right on the hour, you should be fine.

Tip: Every time I've gone closer to their closing time, they just load my salad with extra chicken.
author: Shawn B.

description: Friendly cashier and speedy service. I've had the Chicken Shawarma and both Gyros, and they're pretty great. If you're feeling extra hungry, it's well worth the upgrade to a large size, or a purchase of their fries.
author: Enoch L.

description: This is a solid 4 star lunch spot in FiDi. Skip the salads and platters and get the "pita sandwich". I'd recommend the gyro. The fries are made fresh but lack a bit of flavor, but nothing some sauce can't change :) There will most likely be a wait if you decide to go during rush hour, but don't worry, the line goes by pretty quick!
author: Jessica L.

description:
falafel wrap was good - the falafel itself was crispy and flavorful, though i have to say i have had better wraps. nevertheless, the fries deserve five stars! GO GET YOU SOME FRIES!

great service! :)
author: Julia H.

description: The lamb and beef gyro wrap, and the gyro salad both hit the spot. I'd get the hot sauce on the gyro too, yum.  I came here a lot when I worked nearby. Usually pretty short lunch line that moves fast.
author: Jordan Q.

description:
If you work around the area and are in the mood for some quick, easy, tasteful Mediterranean food, this is probably your best bet. All around solid Gyro and fries. My only complaint is that it's a bit on the expensive side, as a 9inch Gyro with Fries will cost you $11.  Expensive no? 

TIP: Gyros come in 7inch and 9inch varieties.  If you're hungry you're going to need the bigger size.
author: Austin R.

description:
Only $7.25 for a huge chicken shawarma?!  I'm there... and it was DELICIOUS!  And for only $2.50 extra you get fries and soda !  Will definitely be back!

Otherwise a sold four stars, but minus one star for (a) no good inside seating, (b) the cashier not pronouncing 'gyros' correctly, and (c) ignoring my request to go light on the tzatziki sauce.  

Best bet is to pick up food and walk a 1.5 blocks down mission to the Yerba Buena park.
author: Greg B.

description:
Whoah.  Ayola like a case study in good operational management, and the food's good to boot.

Fan in on the left or right, ask for a "7 inch gyro," wait in the middle, grab your wrap and run.  In and out in three minutes (longer if you're in a group).  Don't forgot to get hot sauce on the counter -- it looks like it might be a premium sale, but it's free.

The lamb and beef gyro I had was nice and light -- just the right amount of meat, and not a lot in the way of sloppy sauce or messy greens.
author: Bill H.

description:
Chicken Shwarma Large & Spicy once a week. 

Loaded with chunks of tasty chicken breast. Crave!

'Nuff said.
author: James L.

description:
Uhh . . . Gyros !!! . . . in case you haven't heard . . . but there are already dozens of other reviews and Tips on Yelp that mention this.

Ayola is a Greek & Mediterranean place that I come to from time-to-time, usually to grab a Gyro to go.  This is pretty much just an over-the-counter spot, with only a couple of chairs tucked in a corner, so plan on carrying out your order . . . back to your desk, or perhaps find a bench or sunny spot to chow down.

I'm going with 3 stars because, personally, I find their gyros fairly middle of the road . . . nothing special . . . however, I keep coming back because there really aren't too many other nearby places that sell gyros in this area.  Convenient location, for me.  

Service is pretty quick.  Food is just Ok.  If you go for a gyro, try it with their french fries which are above average and make a tasty accompaniment.  Still, overall, this is just a 3 star grab 'n go lunch spot.
author: Joel E.

description:
So, I'm fairly certain that if I were to ever fulfill my lifelong dream of visiting the Mediterranean, I would gain some major poundage. 

Lunch at Ayola confirmed this. (Btw, I have zero idea as to what constitutes as authentic or even correctly prepared Mediterranean food, but I do know what puts a savory party in my mouth.) 

Tho beating the lunch crowd, my party of three still had nowhere to park our hungry selves; Ayola seats 3-4 small parties & the cashier apologetically offered to let us eat pretty much at the register. Respectfully declining, we took our gyros to-go & "borrowed" an outdoor Chipotle table next door.

$19 bought 2 falafel sandwiches (mine w/ hummus on the side) & 1 chicken shawerma. I was glad I only ordered a small sandwich (5 inch) because that bad boy was super stuffed. I couldn't get enough of the hot sauce--it not only had heat, it had flavor. The falafel was crispy on the outside (but slightly gritty on the inside), they were generous w/ the cucumber/tomatoes & the pita did not get soggy easily. Loved it! 

I walked away from my meal full, fat & happily patting my tummy (aka food baby.)
author: Fancypants X.

description:
When you're stuck in a meating* about an hour longer than your appetite appreciates, the anticipation of a gyro can be almost unbearable. I couldn't stop thinking about how the meat is perfectly crispy, but still so wonderfully juicy. When the heat of the freshly carved slices of meat is cooled by a hint of tzatziki and the grease is balanced by fresh vegetables. My pants suddenly feel tight just thinking about it. 

Unfortunately, Ayola's gyro shattered my lamb/beef meatfest dreams. I haven't been this disappointed since Caddyshack II.  

Perhaps I've been spoiled by the fantastic Mediterranean food I've been eating in NYC lately, but I was felt as though I was drowning in mediocrity. Admittedly, our order was very large, but when I finally bit into the (very decent) pita, the meat was cold, and soaked in overly mayo-tasting white sauce, which in turn rendered the vegetables soggy, and the whole thing a mushy mess. 

I suppose I should look on the bright side; so...at least I didn't make the mistake of ordering the mealy falafel.

In truth, the only standouts at Ayola are the service (able to serve huge parties in a single bound) and the fries, which are seasoned healthily and pair nicely with the tomato/basil-esque hot sauce. 
___________

*This is a Freudian typo I'm not bothering to correct.
author: Peter D.

description: There are a few places in San Francisco that are amazing Greek/Mediterranean and I was hoping that Ayola was one of them based on the reviews and what friends have said but unfortunately it fell a bit short for me.   I got the chicken shawarma and while it was good it lacked a bit of the punch I was hoping for (and I asked for spicy sauce) and by the end of the meal it was completely falling apart.  If I'm in a pinch for this type of food I'd try it again since it's close to where I live otherwise I'll stick with my go tos.
author: Blake B.

description:
I love this place!  I usually get the chicken gyro.  Great value for your lunch, and even though the meal is pretty big I want more as soon as I'm done just cause it tastes so good.

And the staff at the register are super nice and friendly.
author: Leon Z.

description: Meh. As someone with a huge craving for good Greek food at the moment, I can say Ayola definitely does *NOT* satisfy. For the 9" gyros: the meat and pita were dry, and the whole thing was topped with mediocre shredded lettuce that I mostly ended up throwing away. With tzatziki being one of my favourite things in Greek food, I was disappointed to see a barely noticeable layer of it spread across the pita, and tbh I couldn't taste it at all while eating the wrap/sandwich. I can't remember what my friend ordered but he was equally disappointed, and only finished the meal out of hunger.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
Quick friendly service.  Fantastic falafel sandwich!  The hummus is just how i like it.

Definitely coming back here again!
author: Char B.

description: I got the Troy salad and that meat was dry. I would not come back again. Meat is a big part of the food and it should be juicy and well marinated. Also, their hot sauce isn't even hot and isn't like the typical hot sauce you would find at a place like this. I have been searching for a Mediterranean restaurant as good as Halal Guys in NYC but no place around here has been anywhere near the same level of tastiness. The search continues...
author: Lisa W.

description:
I wanted to try this Greek place for a while as it was close to my work.. so I did today.. 

The service was pretty Quick and efficient. however I think I would give them a 3.5 stars for taste.. it is ok .. I could try it again if i had limited options.. but considering it is SF we are talking about.. I would maybe skip it.. but this should not stop you from trying it...
author: Sid G.

description: I got the 9-inch gyro and a side spanakopita. The gyro was delicious and very filling. The spanakopita was a little drier than I usually like, but still good. The food was cheap and super fast too - great for a quick lunch!
author: Amanda L.

description: I've been two or three times, and I really like the fries and the spicy fry sauce here. Gyros are delicious if a little coma-inducing, but it is a pita filled with meat and yogurt, so that's not a huge surprise! Gets a little crowded and uncomfortable during the lunch rush, and I had to strain to hear whether my order had been called.
author: Laura H.

description:
This little hole in the wall is easy to overlook, but very much worth keeping an eye out for. 

For $6, you can get yourself a good sized Gyro. And for $2 extra (I think), you can get an even bigger one. And guess what, they are actually very good. They include fresh veggies and tzatziki sauce, although do I wish that they added a bit more of it. What I really like is the red spicy sauce that they also provide. My friend described it as "their own idea of ketchup." Well I can say it's way better than ketchup. And even though the fries are very good on their own, dunking them in this made them even better. 

The place is pretty small, and so it's hard to get a table. I wouldn't recommend coming here with the intention of eating here. If you get a table, lucky you, but don't count on it. 

I would happily come here again!
author: Mariko F.

description:
A great spot to grab a quick bite to eat. You're in and out in about 5 minutes.

I got the Chicken Shawarma with the fries (duh). The chicken was so tender, flavorful and juicy. The hot sauce with it made it even more fantastic. The fries are perfectly crispy, seasoned just right, and you can eat them forever.

I love coming here for lunch, and I am never disappointed.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Today I tried the falafel wrap here - It was a 5 star! I loved loved the falafels - crispy on the outside and soft inside. Even the pita bread was soft compared to other restaurants.

Minus one star - as the staff was not really friendly, and I need to try more stuff here to give an overall star rating. 

Should be updating this review soon!
author: Parminder Nayyar C.

description:
I work in downtown so I used to frequent this place for lunch.. even though they have a low health score. I'm pretty squeamish about that stuff. Anything less than 90 makes me worry, but I thought "Hey, this place looks clean and has decent food so why not?" And plus, I'm too lazy to go more than a block away from my office. But I definitely learned my lesson. 

After a month of coming here 1-2 times a week, I order their sparta salad for the first time. After taking a couple bites, I lifted up my fork and what was attached to it? A piece of WHITE hair and it wasn't even a short strand. I kept lifting my fork and that piece of hair just kept getting longer and longer. Absolutely disgusting. Shouldn't all employees be required to wear hair nets or tie back long hair? I'm not sure which employee it belonged to, but I stopped eating here after that. 

And that was the last time I ever went to Ayola.

Try the other location if you must.
author: Kari G.

description:
GYRO, GYRO, GYRO, GYRO!!!! I never thought of myself as a Gyro fan but after coming to Ayola, I've discovered the obsession in me. They make a lamb and beef gyro that is to DIE FOR! Last month, I was probably here every single day for lunch and I can still eat more :D 
On top of their amazing Gyro, they also make the best fries in the city. If you are looking for AMAZING fries, look no more, go to Ayola!
Only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because I wish they had more seatings so that I don't have to eat the food at the office all the time :(
author: Vickie Z.

description:
I'm scared of mediterranean food, but honestly, you walk by this place and you're just drawn to it. The smell is in the air, and it smelllss deeeeeelicious! I decided to try it! The Gyro was so good, i opted out of the lamb, i get scared of lamb. The sauce is amazing, i used it also as a dipping sauce for the fries. 

I think my favorite here is the fries! THEIR FRIES ARE SOO GOOD. maybe because im still skeptical about mediterranean food, but i still will recommend! $10 for a gyro and fries, thats about how much everything will cost you here in FiDi.
author: Margarita M.

description: This place was pretty highly rated. I wasn't as impressed. Not sure where the disconnect is. Excellent hot sauce,  delicious hummus.  I do appreciate their selection of exotic diet sodas.  Pretty lackluster chicken shwarma.  Gyro was acceptable.
author: Kai P.

description: Good bang for your buck. Meat is well marinated and portions are generous for the price. There's a bit of a line during lunch but they move quick. I tried the Troy Salad and must say, it was cheaper and better tasting than the recent ones I've had lately around the Financial District. Meat was a tinge dry but still tasty.
author: Julie L.

description:
I was pottering about downtown this afternoon, went into a couple sandwich shops, left a couple sandwich shops and stumbled into Ayola.

Shawarma was the call, extra spicy of course and it was fairly pleasing.

Yes, I have had better whether in London, Istanbul, Paris or other far flung cities but if you're in San Francisco and in need of a Shawarma, you could do a lot worse than Ayola.
author: Jay D.

description:
The Greek Salad wrap is deceptively messy, but so darn good.  Despite the massive grease stain it left on my jeans, when a runaway tomato landed on my thigh - it was almost worth it.  Almost - because they're my favorite jeans. 

You can't go wrong with the fries here either. Freshly made, thick and with just the right amount of salt.

Though this place gets busy around lunch and there isn't much room to sit, the staff are exceptionally friendly and quick.

I remember coming to Ayola when it just opened, and it's nice to see it's still going strong.  Still going strong and still adding things to their menu. Nice.
author: Jessica T.

description:
This is by far the best Mediterranean place in the Bay!!!  Their gyros and fries are ridiculously delicious! The company I work for caters from them often and when they do, it really makes my day! 

To top it off, they have the best customer service!
author: Suki B.

description:
Food is more than OK and much better than Locali Mediterranean.

Ayola, yum
Service A+
Schwarma will get me back again and again

It's easy to see the staff is well managed and they actually like working here, which goes a long way for me. I like supporting business that is responsible on multiple levels.

Very Solid 4 STARS.
author: Steve S.

description:
This is a review for Ayola Catering. 

We order catering from Ayola for our office at least once a month. It's THE office favorite. Their pita sandwiches are really  yummy, their fries are always hot and crisp, and their sides (tabouleh salad, hummus, falafel, dolmas) are always on point and fresh tasting. Ayola also ALWAYS delivers on time. The best!

(also, be SURE to get their hot sauce on the side.. so good!)
author: Casey M.

description:
While the food is certainly deserving of at least four stars, the serving portions left something to be desired. To upgrade to a meal one would pay three dollars for a palm of fries and a 12oz can of soda. This pricing schema left me disappointed and confused once the food was in front of me.

But going back to the food, I would say that the gyro would be satisfying enough for someone with a craving. Other than that, it was rather generic. Indeed, the rumbling in my tummy was muted; but the rumbling in my heart was not.
author: Jaison T.

description:
Decent gyros, the fries are weird though, curtis liked them, I didn't.


Hadi's has better gyros, wish they were closer.
author: Michael E.

description: Great service and be sure to spring for the gyro drink and fry combo. The guy at the front, Antonio, was cool too and also made great suggestions as well. It's busy during lunch but clears up a bit during dinner.
author: Heung-Ki Y.

description:
I'm sorry, but I have some serious issues with this place. What on earth do you put in that spicy sauce? Every time I get a gyro from Ayola, I take like 10 of these, hoarding them at my desk, and drenching my body in it's deliciousness. People think I'm weird enough, I don't need this damn sauce taking over my life.

In all reality, you really can't go wrong with Ayola. If you can afford to become addicted to their sauce, then definitely go here...and grab me some of that red sauce for me!

Cheers.
author: Sean R.

description:
Not a bad lunch spot!

It's tiny and they don't use AC, so you'll want to awkwardly wait outside and try to hear your number being called after you order.

7" Chicken schwarma & fries were $10.05 w/ tax. The folks at Ayola take CC's and are very sweet. Seems like a family-run joint. 

The fries are heavily seasoned with cracked pepper, which made them taste like kettle chips. I wasn't a fan. The schwarma was perfect though. Fresh, soft pita, thick slices of chicken, romaine lettuce, tsatziki and plenty of spices. 

*Skip the fries and just get a 9" schwarma or gyro instead of a 7".

Pro tip: you can order ahead through this very Yelp page.
author: K M.

description:
I ended up at Ayola today for a spontaneous take-out lunch... my company buddies and I picked up a gyros platter, 9" gyros, and Corfu Salad (the one with boiled calamari) and took it to-go to enjoy it outside (first at the MOMA atrium and then we were kicked out of there, at the nearby Yerba Buena Park. 

The lunch was super fun because of the company but the food itself was pretty impressive as well... I scarfed down my salad and side of pita bread and spicy pickled veggies.  The boys that accompanied me cleaned their plates too.  

Ayola seems to have their system down to a science - service was extremely quick, reasonably priced, and pretty damn delicious too.  Portion sizes are moderate to large.  I'd for sure return to this place often if I lived and/or worked in the area... instead, I'll likely keep it in mind for future visits to this fine city!
author: Gabi M.

description:
Tasty Gryo Pita's!  

A small, quick stop, grab and go place, the gyro pita is tasty and delicious...enough said!
author: Terence N.

description:
The fries are like crack. The fries plus the mysteriously delicious red sauce and I am satisfied to the utmost. I seriously cannot rave about these enough. They're perfectly seasoned (with pepper!) and are also like $2. What a steal.

The only other thing I've had is the lamb gyros, which is okay. I don't think anything will beat the taste of cheap, greasy rotating rotisserie lamb thing from hole-in-the-wall joints from Europe, but Ayola does have fresh lettuce and tomatoes inside the gyros, which is really refreshing and doesn't make you feel that terrible about what you're consuming. The small size (around $6) is filling enough for a quick lunch.

Service is always pretty fast and the workers at this location are nice. I'd say it's one of the better mediterranean places around. 3 stars for just the gyros alone, but 3.5 for the fries haha.
author: Shira C.

description:
This place is definitely a solid 4 stars. Not the best takeout Mediterranean I've had, but it's still pretty DAMN good. 

It's pretty standard in terms of typical SF takeout - quick, cheap and virtually no seating available. It's ok,  just grab your food and eat at the Yerba Buena Gardens.

I had the Gyro combo - gyro, fries and a drink - all for under $10. Not a bad deal for good food. I'd have to say its one of tastiest Gyros I've had. Not to mention the fries were really good, too.

My husband got the falafel plate -everything on the plate was solid. The Baba Ghanoush stood out. I've never ever ever had good Baba Ghanoush until I came here. The Baba Ghanoush had this NICE smoky flavor to it that added what was needed to what is essentially just pureed eggplant. It was deelish!

I highly recommend this place if you want good take out and you're in the mood for Mediterranean. I haven't tried everything on the menu but I have a feeling that everything is pretty good.
author: Ceana K.

description:
"Sparrrtaaaaaa!"  That's what your stomach will be yelling as you gobble down the Sparta Salad (add lotza hot sauce).

Healthy.  Reasonably priced.  Quick (ready in 5 mins).  Great staff.
author: Scott W.

description:
Chicken 7" schwarma is A-OK!  I work half a block away from here and it's a good alternative to the millions of salad/sandwich/soup spots on the same block.  They have limited seating, but they have very quick service and quality food.  I usually am in and out of this place in 5 minutes and on my way back to the office to grub on this tightly wrapped chicken, veggies and yogurt sauce.  

I wish their chicken wasn't so dry! but the veggies and yogurt sauce make up for it.  The size is perfect and if you're a bit hungry, they offer a 9" or combo meal with fries and drink.  This is definitely a $10 meal so if ur trying to find cheap, this may not be your right choice.

I think it's GOOD but not as great as Oasis Grill on Drumm and Sacramento which is my only other place for comparison for this type of food.  BUT, since I don't work in that area anymore, this is a good next alternative.
author: Sandy L.

description:
One of my most reliable lunch spots. 

The name of the game in soma seems to be fast, cheap, and exciting: pick two. Ayola sticks with the fast and cheap, and they rock at it. My mind is never blown by the quick falafel or lamb gyro here, but I always walk away happy and satisfied.

Best way to mix it up here is to get the hot sauce. Delicious
author: Scott T.

description:
Ayola is a small shop. Mainly to-go but they have some seats for sitting down and eating.

== Food ==

Great gyro! Comes in two sizes: 7 and 9 inche. There's a circle of how large they are on the wall. The gyro meat is a bit dry, but the sauce makes up for that really well.

The french fries are good! There's some kind of spices they put on them that makes it taste great. Grab some fries if you're hungry. 

Love their orange sauce! This is a must have! Grab it at the counter. It's free. Goes great with the gyro or the fries.

== Service ==

Quick in and out to go style service. Order at the counter and wait for the food. 

== Overall ==

Delicious and low cost. Great for this neighborhood.
author: Steven B.

description:
My first Yelp review!  The freshness of the falafel hummus pita can not be overstated.  The falafel was delightfully crunchy, the hummus smooth, and the pita warm with a crisp.  The fries are spiced uniquely with salt and pepper, a nice surprise.  The service was fast and genuinely friendly.  Every customer who walked in was attended to immediately with the same charm.

On top of all this, the prices are unbeatable for the area.  The take out menu shows their catering prices which are more than reasonable for such quality Mediterranean food.

The pita kept me energetic for the entire day throughout my swim and workout in the evening.  That gives it the 5th star!
author: Rykart K.

description:
You'd think, with the waiting time of less than five minutes, even during peak lunch hours, that the food can't be that good, and the service will mess something up about half the time. But there's always some kind of line, for good reason: for the speed and price, the food here is quite good. And not once did I ever had an order messed up.

Yeah, the wraps are good. The salads taste decent. And then you get the fries.

The fries...the fries...those addictive fries...Not the best, but oh man, when I'm craving fries like RIGHT NOW, this is my quick fix. This is the mountain on my desk in my Scarface fantasy.

...Okay, maybe not THAT addictive. Not that I actually snort fries. Y'know. Physics and all that.
author: Hannah H.

description:
3 stars for a meh falafel

I love Falafels, it is not hard to please me i'm not one of those food critics who says food sucks when it's good. Everytime i walk past this place, which is often, i've always said to myself "i should go here one day" it smells amazing outside. Like: you are about to have the best falafel of your life amazing. The staff was nice, alittle slow but i'm patient. Woman asked if i wanted it spicy which i said yes. I find i often have to ask for food spicy because they assume everyone is American and aren't used to the spice or something and give it no flavour. 

Falafel was not spicy. It was average. *I should start asking for my food extra spicy so it actually has some distinguishable spice*

Falafel was falling apart. Not the wrap part, but the actual falafel. It was almost like ground meat instead. 

Falafel was not crispy. Falafels  are not meant to be like a vegetarian breadcrumb meatball, they're supposed to be an entirely different cuisine

High points- friendly service. They did fill my falafel wrap with alot of falafels which was very kind considering most places only put in 2, if only the actual falafel was good. Also filled with a fair amount of humus and fresh lettuce and tomatoes which was nice

3stars for an ok wrap with a sad falafel. Shwarmas would probably be alot better, but you can get chicken wraps with some sauce anywhere. It wazn't a bad experience, just a really meh one and i had high hopes for this place.
author: Brittainie B.

description:
I'm actually very impressed with Ayola. The lamb and beef gyro is fantastic, and filling.

The place is TINY, so don't plan on eating here. You're better off bringing it back to the office, or eating over in Yerba Buena.

The french fries are what keep me coming back. They're seasoned perfectly, with what I think is just plain salt and pepper. Nice and crispy, but not too greasy at all.
author: Tyler H.

description:
To the idiot counter girl who kicked us out while we were eating because it was FOUR minutes past closing time (3:04pm), you ruined our experience and we will NEVER come back.  you were so brazenly rude:  "we're closed, can you leave?"  As we were rushed out the door, i threw away the 1/3 lunch that was left.

We were willing to look past the broom and dustpan in the middle of your glorious 6-seat dining area, as well as the garbage-strewn sidewalk just outside the entrance.  The baba ghanoush was a total fail, and our order was missing the "sauce on the side" which would have been a bigger fail if we had ordered to go.
author: eshwar k.

description: Hopefully other things on the menu are better.  I got the chicken shawarma and is was very different from any other I have ever had.  First, I have never had a cold one before.  Second usually the chicken in a shawarma has some flavor.  This just seemed to be Sysco roasted chicken breast sliced.  Third the bread was tough.   Hopefully based on people's reviews he other items on the menu are better, but the shawarma was about as far from authentic as you can get.
author: John P.

description: Falafel and french fries and coke. That's my kind of combo. When I want a really decadent lunch break, I come here. Sure, it's no sunrise but you can't beat the lunch combo price ($8.75!)
author: Jon T.

description: Ayola is a great spot for lunch.  Their lamb gyros and chicken shawarma are both tasty, but it's the hot sauce that really brings the flavor.  And don't forget to order the fries - they are always cooked to perfection, with just the right amount of crunch.  Service is really speedy too.  If you work downtown, you owe it to yourself to try Ayola.
author: Bud L.

description: I have come here once or twice before, and thought it was a quick pickup, decent lunch. Yesterday, though, I had bad food poisoning and it's been going on for past 14 hours. I am not returning here again.
author: Shashu M.

description:
I got the falafel pita sandwich with french fries. Went during my lunch and the line went quickly. Just had to wait 5 minutes and my food came out in no time.

The falafel was nice, warm and fresh (which is hard to come by). Just cut the pita in half and save it for a late afternoon snack. And the fries were crispy and not oily!

Totally coming back for more!
author: R. K.

description:
Super Fast. Cheap Lunch.  Thick cut fries (always freshly fried).


Gyros: (The Medium size is a lot of food)  
The Beef/Lamb Kebob
Falaffel 


Both delicious.
author: Steven F.

description:
Something to do with the fries...they are awesome, hot, fresh, and seasoned with salt and black pepper. I got the 6 inch falaffel with the hot sauce which was really good. The hot sauce it's that hot, but it gives it just the right amount of kick. 
Service was really quick and the staff was nice. I will go here again when I'm craving a falaffel!
author: Jeanie Ann D.

description:
I love this place! I just moved to the area and work nearby, so I've been eating my way through SoMa when I have time for a lunch break. 

This place is right next to Chipotle and a much tastier option in my opinion. Plus, even though there is a line it's really quick to both order and get your food. For about $9 you can get a gyros, fries and a soda/water.  It's pretty cheap, super yummy, and the staff is very friendly. 

The gyro itself was one of the better tasting gyros I've had.  The bread was also soft, and the fries were seasoned with pepper and spices. I can already tell I'm going to be a regular at this place.
author: Jeanne M.

description:
Word on the fries and hot sauce. The fries have salt and pepper on them and when dipped in the hot sauce (which is more like a sauce that has spice to it and therefore you can use it for dipping) are delicious. AND the falafel is much better than another unnamed spot on 2nd in the hood. 

Good for if you're hungry. 

Price standard to low for the area. I got the 7" falafel, fries and a diet coke can for $10.17

True they don't include napkins, but they are available for the taking, as is ketchup and hot sauce. I didn't end up using the ketchup because the hot sauce was so good.

Also I went at a little before 12noon so it was not busy there was no line.
author: Alex S.

description: I didn't have many expectations coming into this place as I've only had 1 or 2 quality eats of Greek food. This place definitely surpassed my expectations as the gyro was well cooked and the sandwich itself was the best I've had for a Greek restaurant. I'm definitely looking forward to trying the Chicken Shawerma next time. The fries were pretty good as well, as they had a good crisp and light seasoning to them. They're not extraordinary, but they are good quality fries! Other than that, service was exceptionally fast as my group of 8+ seemed to be in and out the door within 7 to 8 minutes.
author: Patrick B.

description:
finally a place in SF that i like!!

i know sf is a hot spot for a variety of food, but since i moved here a month ago, i haven't found a place that really hit the spot.

this place did!!

the line was longish when i went (during lunchtime), but service was fast.  i loved that the owner or manager was standing behind the counter just greeting people, while two people were working the cash registers.  

i ended up buying 2 gyros (one to eat for lunch and another for dinner) because it was so good :) !!  portion was perfect for me, and price was reasonable (esp. for the city!).  you might have to get two gyros if you're a guy.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Speed - 5 stars
Service - 5 stars
Interior layout - 3 stars
Prices - 2 stars
Quality - 3 stars
Quantity/Menu Size - 2 stars

Got the Greek Salad wrap for lunch, and it was solid, unfortunately for Ayola, im now comparing them to Baladie (http://www.yelp.com/biz/baladie-gourmet-cafe-san-francisco#hrid:M7k03OeF4vp4qVFwygSzkQ), and the GSW was the closest thing to Lavash Vegie Deluxe which was SO BANK that i have to downgrade my experience. 3 stars is best i can do right now. Though  chances are - just like Arnold - I'll be back.
author: Oleg H.

description: Tried the lamb-beef gyros wrap. The tzatziki was fresh and delicious. Not the best meat I've had, but pretty good for a $7 price point.
author: Vighnesh R.

description:
Work downtown? Stop by Ayola for a fast--and I mean FAST lunch. They'll have your order bagged and ready by the time you put your credit card back in your wallet.

Try the small chicken schawarma for $7.05 with tax. Generous meat-to-pita ratio. Yummy creamy garlic sauce and lettuce. Be warned! Prepare yourself for a case of the post-lunch sleepies. It's definitely heavy enough to pack a punch and leave you full/food comatose for a few hours.
author: Teresa G.

description:
Fastest falafel in the West!!  

Seriously this place puts 'fast food' chains to shame.  

I just walk in for a falafel pita and like two seconds like I have a pretty decent version and I'm out the door.  So easy to pop in and out, you definitely have time to break free of your desk chains to get one of these.  I don't get fries, etc (fighting the battle of the bulge here) but that pita fills me up for nice and cheap.
author: Monica R.

description: $8 for a 9-inch Gyro filled with lamb, lettuce, tomato slice (yup, there was just one).  If you like your gyros basic and no-nonsense, this place gets the job done with its short lines and easy ordering.  Personally, I would have preferred my lettuce a little fresher (some leaves were yellowing) and a little bit more yogurt/ tzatziki sauce since there was very little, but that's just me.
author: Mengo Z.

description:
After reading so many great things about the chicken shawarma, I had to try it (even though I still can't pronounce it)!  It was so tasty! I'm usually not a fan of any yogurt based sauce or tzatziki, but the sauce in this wrap was amazing!! The hot sauce that comes on the side is just the right amount of heat, and was delicious!!

It was a rainy day in SF today, so I got it to go and enjoyed in my office, although because I went later in the afternoon, there was some room to sit and eat there.  I'll definitely be going back to try the fries and gyros soon!
author: ashley B.

description:
Good schwarma, but I still prefer Oasis Grill on Drumm St. 

Got a schwarma with falafel on it. But falafel was not fresh fried, even though I asked before ordering. Sometime that afternoon, but not fresh fried and hot. Also, the lavash didn't seem quite as fresh, and fell apart more than usual when eating the wrap. Both the falafel, and to some extent the lavash are better at Oasis, IMHO. Meat was tasty. The rest of the flavors were good, and they happily provided some extra tzatziki sauce, which was delicious. Good flavors and schwarma overall. Just not great, and not as good as Oasis due to the falafel.. Their fries were surprisingly tasty and extra crispy (but not overcooked) - but I can't go 5 stars at a Mediterranean place on good fries.. 

Falafel Note: Asked the woman at counter if the falafel is freshly fried when ordered (so important to the texture/crunch and freshness. I won't even order falafel if it's already cooked/friend, and just sitting in a bowl..). She assured me that though they were made earlier, they are fresh fried throughout lunch. That made it sound a little vague but ordered anyway. Didn't have same crunch as fresh fried, and were only warm, not hot, which makes a big difference for these IMHO.. 

Falafel Hint: They go in the same place as the fryer, where you pulled those delicious, hot, crunchy fries out of! Throw them in there before you feed to me! ;)
author: J M.

description:
Ayola definitely earns a lot of repeat business from me.  I haven't tried but two menu options: the felafel wrap and the fries.  Both are so good that I never seem to be able to try any of the other options.

The wrap comes with a spicy or mild option; I always get the spicy.  Felafel is warm, crispy on the outside, and flavored well.  The fries are divine!  There's typically a bit of a wait around lunch time, but service is generally speedy off-peak.
author: Ben P.

description:
Ayola is a reasonablely priced lunch spot in the financial/SOMA. A friend and I decided to give it a shot - with indoor seating and lunch under $10, why not. 

I ordered a 2 item combo platter with gyro meat and spanakopita (flaky pastry stuffed with satueed spinach.) The place is small so a friend and I sat in the corner so as not to feel the cold air or be in anyone's way. My food came out fast, the spanakopita was already pre-made - not sure if they made it that morning or the previous night - but it was soft and soggy. I usually like it to have a crisp, but the inside flavor was pretty good.

As for the gyro meat, it was really salty, so I was only able to finish about half of my meat. I didn't hate the place and salty meat might be fine for some people, so I gave it an A-OK rating, especially since their staff is so nice,  though I won't be going back.
author: Analisa S.

description:
My mom's obsessed with gyros -- she ALWAYS wants them. I think it has something to do with their honeymoon in Greece back in the paleolithic era. So that means I've gotten into many a messy lamb sammy before. And this place, while decent, didn't knock my proverbial socks off. 

It was sustenance plain and simple. The gyro was salty inside and soft outside but wasn't explosions in my mouth by any stretch. Same with the dry falafal and hot fries. It's a carb load kind of place and their hyper efficient staff makes sure you get that food really quickly in order to commence starch coma. 

Stop here for lunch when you're in a hurry... but don't look to it as a cultural mecca. Oh and get the red hot sauce. Just don't get it all over your sweater. Sigh.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Class ends around 6:30, I'm hungry, about to hop BART to go home, but I'm craving a good gyro...where to go? I stop here because of the delicious smells and the sign that says 'GYROS'...

Price is kinda reasonable (I've seen cheaper, but then again, this is in SF), fries were warm and nicely seasoned, and my gyro, although falling apart, had great flavor. Meat was tender and seasoned, had a good amount of veggies, and that tzatziki sauce was yum. Service was friendly and they were fast! It felt like I was out in five minutes.

Definitely stopping by whenever I'm in the area.
author: Ashley W.

description: Great hole in the wall spot if you have a Greek food craving!  Not much area for seating but I had the chicken gyro and it was awesome!  Chicken was moist and tender almost melted in my mouth.  Good balance of veggies and sauce.  Fries cooked how I like them too,  semi well done and crispy.  The hot sauce was great as well.  One of the better sauces I've tried, good kick, peppery, with a little sour.  Great compliment to the gyro. Loved it so much I dipped my fries in it too!  I'm gonna eat here again next time I'm in the city.
author: Leonard Y.

description:
I come here for one reason - THE FRIES!!!  I don't think I've had a better french fry than what Ayola offers.  They have some kind of special machine, I don't know maybe it's infused with crack but seriously they have the best french fries in the city.  I'm sure their other food is equally as good but I just can't stop ordering the fries every time I come here.  Their service is speedy and the employees are friendly.

Anyhow like I said...go here for the fries.  You won't be disappointed.
author: Sonya T.

description:
Wow, their lamb gyros are amazing and I don't usually like lamb!!
Nice and fast service on top of great consistent food.

Greek salad wrap 9 inch a must.
Lamb gyros double must.

Remember to add fries and a drink! Their fries are fabulous!
author: Karen L.

description: Their red sauce is MAGICAL. Tastes like a combination of hot sauce and marinara. Keep it simple and get a gyro (lamb & beef), and go for the 9 inch for only a dollar more!
author: Will Z.

description:
Great lunch spot for cheap!

The service here is fast and the ingredients are always fresh. The bread that they use is what makes this place I think. I used my $30 Gopago credit and my shawarma was ready in no time. The meals fill you up just right and won't leave you wanting to kill yourself because you just consumed your entire caloric needs in one meal. The staff is friendly and very efficient. The lines do get crazy long sometimes. This place is doing pretty well seeing as how they compete with a Chipotle right next door. Come here and you won't be disappointed.
author: Javier G.

description:
Best lamb/beef gyro I've had in the states! Can't wait to go back and try the fries everyone else is raving about.

If you're downtown for lunch and need to grab something fast or just something delicious, I definitely recommend Ayola!
author: Kathleen H.

description:
Obviously the street gyro I had in Athens will be forever superior in my mind, but at least I don't have to deal with begging street dogs and scheming gypsies!  Amazing Greek fast food for San Francisco, especially in the FiDi.  Generous portions to make you feel the Big Fat Greek Love.  

Gryo Meat: Every slice I enjoyed had a bit of spit seared exterior.  The lamb and beef mixture was well spiced and not too fatty.  Just fatty enough though to make an awesome pairing with the cooling tzatziki!  Could have been a tad warmer, but I appreciate that they didn't refry it.

Spanakopita: Extremely flaky multi-layered exterior that is not at all greasy (unlike lower grade versions that are glistening on the bottom).  The spinach inside is well sautéed so it is not bitter.  Could stand to use a bit more feta.

Falafel: I like that the outside was not hard like a rock.  Lightly crispy with a very spice rich soft interior.  Shockingly not dry like most falafels in town!

Hummus: A good grainy blended texture that is not too heavy on the tahini.  They put some sort of green pepper pesto on top that adds an awesome kick and helps break the hummus monotony!

Tzatziki: Super creamy, almost like eating cheese (in a good way)!  Thankfully they relied more on subtle dill than overwhelming garlic to dominate the flavor.

Dolmas: Usually not a favorite of mine because the leaf wrap is often too bitter.  They did a good job of balancing the flavor better, though still best for me when doused in tzatziki.

Pita: Definitely not your Safeway store bought variety that invades so many Middle Eastern joints.  The edges were somewhat crispy... either freshly made or at least freshly reheated.

Hot Sauce: It's free and I abuse it.  It's somewhere between a spicy marinara and smoky pepper sauce.  Don't gyro without out!
author: Adam B.

description:
Some of the best french fries I've ever had come from this joint, rather incongruously.

Their spicy red sauce (I want to call it ketchup, but it's like ketchup's *exotic* aunt from Iksos) is perfect over the mouth-hot fries.

The gyros?  I forget.   All I can remember are the fries.

Well priced for the financial district, adequate service.
author: Brill S.
