description: These guys are so quick! Such an advantage during the work lunch hour. That said, I'd be willing to wait in a longer line for this food. The shwarma, the gyro, you name it: delicious. And don't even get me started on those perfectly seasoned fries! SO BAD, but SO GOOD!
author: Michael M.

description: Nothing spectacular, but definitely solid Mediterranean food.  I just have a lot of pickyness when it comes to med.
author: Ilicia Maxine R.

description:
If i've been disciplined about going to the gym I love going to Ayola for lunch and getting a gyro wrap filled with french fries. Freaking delicious. There's some type of white sauce on the wrap that is also excellent.

It's got quick service and can handle the masses on a nice lunch day in SF. Make sure to get a little thing of hot sauce when you leave.
author: Jason M.

description:
This is a pretty solid place, highlighted by those addicting ass fries.  I've totally dreamed about running under the counter and stealing that deep fryer they have.  The things I'd do to that deep fryer......errrrrrr.

Aside from the french fries, this place serves some pretty good Greek/Leabanese food.  The highlights are their wraps, whether it be chicken shawarma or the gyros.  The chicken on the gyros are just a tiny tiny bit too rubbery/dry for me, but it's masked decently well.  

The wraps come in a 7" and 9" wraps and are sauced out pretty well, but the topper is the hot sauce.  The hot sauce is in a bottle near the front door.  While you are waiting for your food, go and and squeeze a bunch of hot sauce into the little take away containers.  I learned a trick from my coworkers.  Take part hot sauce, and part ketchup and mix it all up together.

Do yourself a favor and get the 7" and GET THE FRIES.  CRACK!!!!  Next time I'm working in SF, i'm going to steal that fryer, then I can be like Master P and "ma ma ma make crack like this."
author: Kyle W.

description:
A model of efficiency. The employees can throw together gyros far faster than Lucy ever did in the chocolate factory (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4wp3m1vg06Q), so the wait is never long neither to order nor receive your food.

The gyros themselves are consistently decent, a little of the white sauce (tzatziki), some lettuce, a generous helping of meat, and a warm pita. I suppose it would take some homemade ingredients to bump the rating beyond a 3, but their food is completely adequate and I'll continue to come back from time to time.

Now if I could only remember how to properly pronounce the word gyros...
author: Jeremy S.

description: As a quick to go gyro place this is my favorite spot in Soma. No frills or fancy storefront, just high quality meats, a great wrap, and overall reasonable / cheap prices!
author: Milan T.

description:
4.5 stars. Super solid and tasty Greek place. I usually get the regular or chicken gyros with fries. Im not sure what's up with their fries, but they're one of the most deelishis things I have ever had. 

They work super fast and there's never more than a 3-4 minute wait for your food. The sitting area in the place is virtually non-existent, but since there are so many other places to go and sit down and eat, it really doesn't matter. 

I love this place, and this is the first place I ate out at since going to law school, so Ayola, you shall forever remain in my mental Hall of Fame for being an awesome fast food place.
author: Dustin H.

description:
YUM.

awesome gyros, schwarmas, fries and the HOT SAUCE?

great service.

what else?
author: Sung C.

description:
I had no idea that I even tried this place before until I clicked "update review."

Same exact comments apply: the chicken in my chicken shawarma was really dry and they tried to cover that up by putting in a lot of sauce.  That caused everything to be really soggy and dripped everywhere when I ate.  Not a fan of messy lunch foods because it's difficult to eat in the office.  

The people aren't exactly the best at customer service either, so I find nothing too redeeming besides a good location and decent prices.
author: Anna T.

description:
Nothing even remotely original or creative going on here, but what you get is really good, simple food served insanely quickly at a reasonable price. Being a little gummy, the falafel is probably the weakest thing on the menu, but it's still better than average in this town. The fries get two trips through the oil--the way they should. I'm in here at least twice a week and I've never had a bad batch.

But yeah, the seating blows. They sell RC, though.
author: Nicholas J.

description: Pretty decent Greek. Packed during lunch. The Chicken Shawarma is a nice little pick-me-up, almost like a yoghurt-y chicken caesar wrap. Don't forget to grab some of that marinara hot sauce - the wrap needs it. The fries are great - right level of crispiness. Nothing screamed amazing but very solid Greek and perfect for the downtown lunch arsenal. Oh yeah, there is only a few tables and typically the place is so packed that they can't be used.
author: Grayson K.

description: Felt like a gladiator after the Macedonian salad: romain topped with grilled chicken, walnuts, feta, and sliced apple. There was a TON of chicken which was awesome, but I kept digging around for more apple.  But that pita bread though: all warm and soft and delicious and amazing--I brought some home for the family. Even at the height of the lunch rush, the wait was just over five minutes, so this place is perfect for a grab n go lunch.
author: Laura H.

description: Stopped in to just order their fries... And it was pretty good, really we'll seasoned.
author: Annie D.

description: Huge fan. I've now been there twice. And they are so nice, fast service. Had a chicken schwarma first time, and a beef/lamb gyro next time. Oh, and the spicy sauce is delicious. Highly recommend
author: Samantha Y.

description:
Super tasty. The guys at work have been raving about this place since I started, and I'm glad I finally made it over there. I had a small falafel wrap and my friend had a Greek salad wrap. Both were good. It was different than I expected, not one of those humongous wraps on lavash with tons of fillings. Instead, it's more of a salad wrapped in a warm fluffy pita. Totally ok with me, just wasn't sure what to expect. I like that you can get different sizes Will definitely be back.

Since I was meeting my friend, we had to sit inside. Super tiny, maybe enough seating for 10 max. Takeout place for sure. The line gets long, but it moves pretty quickly. They also cater, so I'm debating that for the office.
author: Brittany P.

description:
I love me some good Greek food.  Gyro's used to be my meal of choice after surfing back home.  Today I had the Gyro platter...it was so good.  The lamb was great, the salad very fresh and the hummus was awesome.  I like simple hummus and this was perfect.  

I also had an order of falafel and loved it.  The employees are kind, and service is super fast.  Great lunch place.
author: Kevin W.

description:
This place was my go-to spot for lunch (when I got too lazy to pack one) for a good six months - until I switched over to a new job. It's been a couple weeks and I miss it already! I'll definitely have to make a bit of a trek here once in a while to satisfy my craving for the chicken swarma (make it spicy!) and their seasoned fries - both are AHMAZING! Their regular gyro and chicken gyro are both good but I'd go with the chicken swarma if I had to choose. Make it a combo (fries and soda) for $2.50 more and it comes out to a little under $10. They have a limited menu but that's a good thing sometimes.

They are super efficient and can get you in and out in 5-7 minutes during their lunch rush (without being rude or making you feel rushed)! Prices are very reasonable and no credit card minimum. Space is very tight, with few seats, but there are plenty of tables and lunch areas by all the office buildings so no biggie. A MUST TRY!!
author: Ellen N.

description: The gyros I had tasted pretty decent.   However, after eating there I got very sick.  It didn't taste very good coming back up.
author: Tristan J.

description: They're fast. They're dependable. Their tabouleh is nice and rich green with parsley. Their falafel is a little dry. Their fries are good. I prefer Sunrise Deli for a better vegetarian middle eastern experience.
author: David S.

description:
The prices at the place are cheaper than that advertised online.  It's about $1-$2 cheaper which is great!  But.  Is the quality inferior?  

Where is that gorgeous girl with the green eyes and the roman nose?  She makes me want to frolic on the beach wearing a sarong and a straw hat.  I will order gyros only from her.

The gyro platter this time was plentiful but not as tasty.  The hummus was pretty gross.  Bland.  The hot sauce was a redeeming factor but I can't eat hot sauce without a spoon.  I'm disenchanted by the gyro meat.  I think I'm going to stick to the gyro wrap with french fries from now on.  It's only fair.  It's only fair to my stomach.
author: Christina C.

description:
When it comes to Greek/Mediterranean food, Absofrickinglutely! 

The first time I ordered the Gryo with Lamb & Beef with Tzatziki Sauce, small (7 Inch) for $6.25 + awesome fries for $2. Since then, I have tried the Chicken Shawarma with Roasted Chicken, Sumac ,and Tzatziki  for the same price. They are both pretty filling and good. If you are man or just really hungry, go for 9 Inches. Only I still think Oasis Grill has much better Greek/Med, but Ayola definitely for the fries. 

Tip: you might want to stand outside when you order the food, because  the soap, cologne, or perfume you put on that morning will just instantly fade away. When I got back to the office, I remember going in a crowded elevator and someone said, mmm it smells like Mcdonalds, I'm like mmm It's Ayola, yo.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
GYRO, guyroh, euro, gih ro, etc... Everyone pronounces it differently, more like incorrectly, but they should all come here to get one in the FiDi. They quickly assemble orders so that even a long line moves along quickly. Their combo deal keeps lunch under $10 and allows you to experience the crispy goodness that is their fries. 

9 inch GYRO is where I stop on the menu. It's the first item on the menu and I never need look past it. The fries are always fried on the spot and if you're not careful you'll certainly burn yourself. 

One of the very best things they offer is their hot sauce. It sort of reminds me of srirachi sauce and goes well with the gyro but really well with the fries. This is where the combination deal comes into play, providing you a cold beverage to wash down all the food with hot sauce slathered on.

Consistently a good cheap lunch option in downtown.

Wait times: short
author: Dennis L.

description:
09.27.11

Chicken shawarma with delicious hot sauce for the win!

It's tasty and good for you; so good that I may need two to feel full.

Note to self: next time, go for the large.

Delicious :)
author: Jenny L.

description: Super fast lunch, good service, delicious fries. Chicken schwarma was delicious (the small size was plenty for me for lunch). Spicy isn't that spicy. A great lunch spot!
author: Lindsay M.

description:
Really quite tasty!

I sometime crave a good gyro for lunch, but can never seem to find one that is just right and priced right.

Today I tried Ayola... It's a bit of a walk, but for $6.50, you get a 7-inch pita bread filled with delicious gyro meat, yogurt sauce, lettuce, tomatoes... and get some of the hot sauces on the way out.  

This was perfect and I'll be going back for sure!
author: Cindy C.

description:
This is my favorite falafel place and man am I lucky to work on the same block! 

I either get the falafel wrap or the greek salad and add falafel to it. Either way, their falafel is sooo good and I must have it.

I see a lot of people order meat items. I am a vegetarian so I can't comment on that. I have also heard that their fries are really good. Haven't gotten those, either, since the wrap is so filling I can't imagine having fries, too.

But really, try their falafel wrap. It comes with tomato, cucumber, lettuce, falafel, in a fresh warm pita with hummus. I get the small one and that is enough food. It is some of the cheapest food I can find in the area too (other than Subway which I try to avoid).

They are also SO QUICK. Even if there is a line I am never in there for more than like 3 minutes. Jeez. Its perfect in a hurry, and they are so efficient!

Try to hot sauce, too! Very good and a necessary edition to your sandwich.
author: Celia B.

description:
Great gyros, superman! Yeah, this is the place for an excellent gyros sandwich, especially with the fries. I have been here dozens of times and it always provides a great sandwich. I have not ranged too far down the menu because I love the gyros plate.

This is a tiny place; no real seating except 4 or 5 seats, max. Take out!
author: Brian H.

description: All i have to say is get the hot sauce and dip your lil fries in them. YES OH YES. Also the lunch meals are pretty good. the Gyro was YUMMAY
author: Yumna B.

description:
Cute little hole around the corner kind of place- great for lunch and it is actually really good!
I would definitely go there again to try their schwarma- i heard it is really good, especially w the fires.
Falafel was really gewd! it was not dry (the way it is supposed to be; not dry!:))...

The place is very small and the service is quick which you would appreciate - good for pick ups. 
Yummy!
author: C A.

description: I come here pretty frequently but I have to admit that it's more for the efficiency than for the food. Not that the food is bad - the gyros are quite tasty. The line moves incredibly quickly and it's really close to our office. Also in all of the commotion they've never made a mistake with my order.
author: Wing Y.

description:
I had high hopes based on other reviews and the good smells pouring out of the tiny shop every time I passed by. I ordered a Corfu Salad (Greek salad plus non-fried calamari). I expected there to be more tomatoes, more cucumbers, more...just....more. And with the more, better. It was a fine salad, but I wouldn't buy it again.

That said, I'm totally willing to give it another shot because people rave about it. Maybe it was just a bad day.

The good: super fast. Super good-smelling. Super nice people there.
The bad: salad was meh. Gets busy at lunch, nothing new there.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Great Gyros and falafel - but i would go there just for the fries. 

The food is reasonably  priced and the people there are nice. The line is always long though (symbolic of good restaurants in SOMA). I had the lamb gyro which had the exact right amount of tahini sauce. 

Why only four stars? Well, I grew up in  Dubai so I have had better falafels and Gyros. The best falafel I have had in the city is at Old Jerusalem so if you like Middle Eastern Food, definitely check them out.
author: Rohith S.

description: My goto gyro place when I'm wandering about SF. Fast and easy; good foods.  Good place to go for when you're low carbing it
author: Michael R.

description:
How is this place rated so high?  Is it the people that hate their jobs giving 3 stars for not having to work for an hour and then another star for the food?

I was scoping yelp out for some good lunch spots close to the office and Ayola sounded intriguing.  I love gyros and hadn't had one since the good ol' falaffel hut in Santa Cruz so I decided to check it out.

The gyro itself was lets just say lacking.  I think they substituted plain yogurt for tzitzki (spelling?) sauce.  Very few tomatoes or onions and a wrap that was too thick.  The only saving grace was the hot sauce which had to be dumped on thickly to make this thing edible.

The fries also sucked and were bland.  Overall pretty terrible, whats the deal with the mediocrity washing over the financial district when it comes to reasonably priced lunch spots?
author: Ryan J.

description:
Good price and ok food. I had the eggplant and feta wrap. The wrap was okay but nothing special. I thought it should have had more flavor, especially the egpplant. If it wasn't for the feta I would have been disappointed. Also, don't forget to grab a sauce cup you'll need it to add a kick to this wrap. I am not a meat eater so I can't judge most of their items.

Service was quick and I was in and out of there in less than five minutes so it's a great place if you are in a hurry.
author: J. S.

description:
First off mad props to this place for making the order process for a huge catering event easy peasy. I called about three days ahead and just confirmed my order the day before to make sure they were coming. The staff was incredibly accommodating with the group size, budget and event details.

Although the delivery was a few minutes late (I'm so OCD about that stuff) the food definitely made up for it! Holy crap I had never had Ayola and it will be the only Greek/Mediterranean food establishment  I'll bring to my grave. 

The vegetarian combo came with the most amazing dolmas (even my co-worker who has had a lot of dolmas said it was tops), hummus, kalamatta olives and some type of goat cheese. *Yum***The meat combo came with some crazy delicious falafel balls (crunchy on the outside, soft and warm on the inside), shaved pork/beef and chicken...and french fries! Absolutely delicious. Carnivores unite!

I don't even know what was in their greek yogurt sauce, tahini sauce or red chili sauce but *drool*

(Nobody tell but I snuck a plate home and had it for dinner. Yes, I did it with Ayola. Twice.)
author: Peter C.

description:
I went there yesterday for lunch. 

First, let me say how fast they are. All of the reviews said this, but it really amazed me. 

Also, I love Greek food. It is truly a favorite cuisine, so maybe I am a little too picky about the quality and flavor. 

I ordered the chicken schwarma and it was pretty good. The meat was tasty and well seasoned. I think it could have used more tzatziki sauce, but maybe next time I will ask for it on the side. The pita was very good- fluffy and fresh. 

I thought the "hot sauce" tasted like vinegar or soap or something. I really didn't like it all. 

But I will go back. The fries are really amazing, and I really want to try the Greek salad in a pita, with extra tzatziki.
author: Samantha F.

description:
Ayola's is a great place to stop by to quickly grab something to eat. Don't expect to find a seat during the lunch rush, so it's better to take your food somewhere else. 

I ordered a chicken gyro (a large is only $1 more) with fries and my total came out to be less than $12. They were VERY generous with the amount of chicken in my gyro. The red, spicy sauce they have available at the counter gave my gyro and fries a nice touch to it too. The fries are whatever so I'll most likely skip the combo next time.
author: Nikko D.

description:
Ate here yesterday for the first time ever...
OMG it is soo good...

I was way impressed by how friendly everyone was that works there!

I will be back for shizzle!  this place rocks!
author: Ripley B.

description: One of the best Gyros in town. I felt like I am in chicago, their fries super yummy.
author: Ray T.

description: Although I always order the same thing every visit, the food is delicious; the spice just right. Their french fries taste way better than McDonald's! I stopped going to the other place a couple doors down. The chicken just didn't seem right over there - fake chicken I call it. Ayola is great for the money too!
author: Joanna V.

description: Delicious and fast. Im coming back. The gyro is yummy and the baklava was extremely fresh!
author: Stephanie D.

description: I went here for the first time this week for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. I had the chicken shwarma plate and my friend had the regular shwarma plate. They both come with humus, tzatziki, warm pita, and a big greek salad. Really really good and great ingredients.The pickled chilis in the little containers are fantastic.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Ayola is pretty bomb.  Come hungry, the gyros will fill you up.  I had the lamb, it was delicious!  The tomatoes, lettuce, and tzatziki sauce were not overpowering in the slightest.  The pita was warm, fresh and very soft.  

Service is quick , and efficient.  There were a few people ahead of me, but I only waited about 3 minutes for my order number to be called out.  There is not much seating though (maybe three tables, at that)...so it's more of a grab and go spot.  

Definitely take one (or two) containers of the red sauce--it adds a nice kick to your meal!
author: Christina H.

description:
I'm good for lunch take-out from Ayola about once a month.  The gyros and falafel are pretty good and predictable.  They're also plenty fast now (looks like I complained about the wait in my now-ancient first visit to Ayola).

The fries are outstanding... crispy outside, soft inside, salty and just a tiny bit of spice.  I kick myself for getting them since they are both (a) $2.00 and (b) terrible for you, but I end up ordering them every time.
author: Geoff D.

description:
I love gyros and falafel... perhaps a little too much but it's quite prevalent in my memories as a teenager who cut class to go to a flea market which was the only nearby place that sold gyros. Okay, I'm rambling.

Seriously though, I love the gyros at this place as well as the falafels. They are a bit on the big side (the 7 inches always allows me to have two meals, rather than just one) and it's just so darn tasty. I also always end up stealing more fries than intended when my BF orders them.
author: Shauna S.

description:
Whether Ayola serves the best falafel sandwich this side of the burrito, I daresay I don't know. But what it's really good at is serving up good gyros and falafels at lightening speed time. Despite the long line, I was in and out with my handy 7-inch within 8 minutes. Tres bien!

If you happen to be in SOMA, craving a falafel sandwich with little time to kill, Ayola is your spot.
author: Monica S.

description:
Dear Ayola Management:

Apologies for descending upon you like a swarm of locusts on a Wednesday afternoon unannounced.  I take responsibility for not giving you a heads-up that an army of hungry lunch-goers would be clogging up the obviously streamlined, efficient mini-factory you clearly take a great amount of pride in maintaining.

Thank you for being so amazingly patient, understanding, and polite with our crew.  Thanks for being flexible in marking and packaging all of our goods together in consolidated bags.  Thanks for taking the reins of an obviously overwhelmed cashier.  And most of all, thanks for doing it with complete aplomb and a smile on your face.

Your gyros were satisfying and fresh, your fries were savory and starchy, your goods were priced ever-so-reasonably, and most impressively... your organizational ability to execute expertly on a ridiculous stream of 20+ orders at the drop of a hat was awe-inspiring.

No doubt, were I to return for a lunch experience sans army, my experience would be even more inspiring.  I look forward to that day.  In the meanwhile, I lay my gratitude at your feet.

Sincerely with a full belly,
-Kevin
author: Kevin L.

description:
THE BEST falafels can be found here!

How lucky am I .. that all I need to do is leave my desk, take the elevator down, and walk a couple of feet and bammm. Instant falafel treat!

I keep hearing the fries are amazing but I don't see it. 

Tatziki sauce is super creamy and satisfying!! Be sure to get this with your pita - which is whole wheat - score!

Eggplant salad was alright.

Great lunch spot. Clean. Quick. Friendly. Basic menu. Flexible options and value meal type deals - gyro and throw in fries and a drink.

Weird but they have a surcharge for using your debit/credit card (wouldn't have noticed but my coworker was annoyed by this extra 20 cent charge!)
author: Mia N.

description: I have only tried the gyros...they are ok..just ok, not enought sauce and the pita wrap sometimes are stiff and cardboard like..but the fries...EXCELLENT.
author: Sonia C.

description: Went to this place for lunch. There is hardly any place to dine-in here. I ordered the Falafel wrap here. The wrap was tasty but nothing that extraordinary. The hot sauce was very good though. I will definitely visit this place because it is so close to my office plus very inexpensive for that size of the wrap in city.
author: Ashok L.

description:
admittedly i only tried the falafal, but it was bland, small and over-priced.
how hard is it to make a good falafal, san francisco?
author: Tyler D.

description: A Saturday lunch with nobody in line. Hmmm, why not...ordered the chicken salad with walnuts and apples. Sounds healthy, hoping to get a great meal....not. I get maybe one cup of chicken in a hugh bed of lettuce with very little flavor, and a little plastic cup full of salad dressing buried in the lettuce. All for $9.85 out the door with no utensils or maybe even a napkin. It was a disappointing experience to say the least. I guess the regular cook was "off" today based on the past ratings of this place. Its a crap shoot, if you can get a good meal.  Personally, don't waste your time at this place if your going to put out that much dough for a bunch of lettuce with no "real" flavor....you could do better.
author: Kurt C.

description:
People who know me, know my deep passion and love for all that is Chipotle.  I have written sonnets and love poems about their burrito bowls.  It has been easy for me overlook Ayola on my way to chipotle.  

But for the first time.  I walked about a half step slower, and caught a whiff of the amazing smells that came from Ayola.  I went in and ordered a small gyro and fries.  

The service was quick, and the food was relatively inexpensive.   I got back to my office to open up my bag and noticed something that makes me very happy.  Seasoned fries.  oooooooh child.  their fries are amazing. I almost consider myself a french fry connoisseur, and as an official french fry connoisseur, I would have to say that these fries are amazing.

The gyro tasted great too, so i will definitely  be shunning my near and dear chipotle, to make more stops for this mediterranean burrito.
author: Angela C.

description: I like this little Mediterranean fast food place right down the street from my class at Academy of Arts.   I feel like every time I get there a bit before noon, there's no line, but once noon hits there's a longer line, so try to come a bit before the lunch crowd!  I can tell they freshly make and fry their falafels.  Their greek yogurt and pita bread is yummy too! Price is also perfect.  I get away with four filling falafels for less than five bucks! Yum Yum!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Stopped here during my lunch break because I heard they were the best fries in the city (according to my gf, who said she had never been here but had only "heard" from her coworkers.......). Their fries are good but I wouldn't say they're THE BEST. McDonald's has THE BEST FRIES period. Maybe if I hadn't come in with high expectations, I wouldn't have been disappointed. 

Now don't you all get butthurt, no ones saying they're not good. They are. So are their gyros. I've come back for gyros but without fries.
author: EJ S.

description:
The fries of awesomeness combined with a pretty yummy falafel wrap make for a pretty good lunch!
Theres always a big line, so I tend to skip this place, but today I found it sans any other patrons, so got to get hold of those yummy fries in just 2 minutes.. next time I think I will skip the falafel, and just order several portions of fries instead!!.. yum
author: Aditya M.

description:
I love gyros, shwarma, falafel, the whole bit, and Ayola is good, quick place for Mediterranean food in SoMa...  I had the lamb gyro which was delicious in a hot pita...I hear there's a mean hot sauce that you can get with it...  I didn't know, but I'll definitely try it next time!  This certainly wasn't the best gyro I've had - the ratio of meat to fillers (namely lettuce) was a little off (not enough meat) and there were no french fries in the pita (a great addition that some place include) - but it was certainly tasty (everyone at work was a little burpy with gyro breath that afternoon).  Generally, I'm a small pita kind of girl - a couple of skinnier gyros/shwarma sandwiches rather than one overstuffed one.  But anyway....  

9 inches is more than enough for me; it was totally and completely filling.  I really should've gone with 7 inches.  Lesson learned!
author: Wendy L.

description: Best gyros that I have found in downtown.  I love the flavor and freshness of the gyros at Ayola.  The staff is friendly, and the prices are affordable for the quality that you get.  Definitely my gyro of choice outside of North Beach.
author: Jackson W.

description: The food is alright but not worth the price. A subway sandwich is WAY bigger and filling than a Gyro. I would love to eat here more but the price just keeps me away.
author: Jade L.

description:
I'm addicted. Great food and relatively inexpensive for a work lunch.

I recommend the greek salad in a wrap, and pay extra for them to add hummus inside. Yum yum.
author: Katie N.

description: I've been here twice for lunch and I've had the Chicken and Lamb+Beef Shawarma wraps.  Both were fantastic.  They could have been a bit bigger, considering I got the large, but other than that, I could find no faults.  The chicken was well cooked and seasoned, and very flavorful.  The Lamb+beef was also excellent, very well seasoned, not overcooked.  The sauces and vegetables were all very good.  I ordered online and they had some problems when I came to pick it up each time, but it wasn't a big deal because they were very nice and made it quickly.  Overall this is one of the best values in the Fidi for lunch, and one of the better gryos/shawarma I've had in SF.
author: Yan L.

description: I went here twice because my office is a block away and the only thing I like about it is the fries. They are incredibly delicious but the gyros have made me sick each time I ate there. They aren't that big and they are bland and overpriced. I love the hot sauce they give out though. Dipping fries into that sauce is great but it's really the only thing worth getting here.
author: Dusty N.

description:
Ayola has the best gyros around, and they are very quick at getting them to you as well. Just make sure that you take a few containers of the ayola sauce, it really makes the gyro in my opinion. Beyond the gyros though, the fries are amazing; possibly the best fries I've had in the city.

Easily one of my go to lunch spots.
author: Joseph L.

description:
Once upon a time I drank too much coffee, logged into Yelp, and blathered on about the most scandalously satisfying lunch I accidentally ate since infinity plus one.  This is that time.

I was wasting away at a conference down the street when suddenly we were released into the wild to nourish ourselves.  Bewildered, we milled about on the sidewalk, blinking helplessly in the harsh sunlight.  Because my companion and I weren't familiar with the area, we executed a quick Yelp search (lunch, Greek, yum yums please) and discovered to our glee that Ayola, decently rated, was just a mere stagger away.

We were disheartened to encounter their itty bitty dining area, suitable perhaps for small children or elves, and minimal seating options.  However, we managed to claim a wee corner in which to yearn pitifully for, and then devour, our lunchly items.  The staff were friendly and patient while we scanned the menu and placed our order.  I chose the falafel wrap and fries and my companion ordered a gyro (beef? lamb? I dunno, I have amnesia) and fries.  Holy chrizzlesticks, my wrap was magnificent in its scrumptiousness!  The heavens parted upon this midday hour and plunked forth a plethora of crispy, warm, and flavorful falafel patties into an otherworldly cocoon of tomato, lettuce, tangy hummus, and soft pita.  All of which I couldn't stop ramming into my mouth-hole repeatedly and with great force.  The fries?  Sweet deity on a stick!  Tantalizingly crunchy (twice fried to perfection) and spiced with a delicate, peppery zip.  My companion also seemed to enjoy his gyro and fries but, to be honest, I was far too enraptured with my food to contemplate anything beyond the very sobering quandary before me:  how many of these luscious, saucy lunches could I realistically smuggle back in my bag?   Indeed.
author: Chelsea J.

description:
By the crush of people and the steam coming out the door this place must be good.
I waited my turn which wasn't long and ordered the combo platter.
Great fast service and decent meal for a quick lunch.
author: Lawrence T.

description: I owe my latest love of falafel to Ayola.  For years and years I just did not have a taste for falafel, but after Ayola, I am a convert.  I go to Ayola pretty regularly, whenever I am in the mood for a denser falafel that comes in a wrap, with some kick-ass hot sauce.  Delish!  The service is super quick which gets me back in my office with the door closed having some alone time with my falafel wrap all the sooner.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Since there are so many soup/sandwich places around here so glad there is a quick Greek place where you can order, get your food and be out of there in 10 minutes. 

There are 7 and 9 inch size gyros.  

Got the gyro with the beef/lamb 7 inch and it was super tasty and full of flavor.  That was more than enough for lunch. 

Would love to come back and try other stuff.
author: Anya R.

description:
I haven't eaten at Ayola #2 in over a year, but as soon I discovered that the original Ayola was only a block away from my new office, I knew I'd become a frequent customer again. Today I had the Sparta salad, hold the olives and it was just as yummy as I remember. The chicken is soft and it's WHITE MEAT!!! I love white meat! No pun intended. :P I drenched it in dressing, closed the box and shook it up. Once I opened the box, a coworker walked by my desk saying "that smells so good!" My cubemate looked over and asked me about the salad and the he headed right out to buy his own. Yep, that's how good it is! 

For $8.21 incl tax, you can't beat this meal. The customer service is awesome and they are always smiling. And they get you in and out QUICK! 

On rotation once again!
author: Jen D.

description:
This is my go-to spot for lunch.  Ayola is a hole in the wall, and its easy to pass by without noticing it.  But the food is amazing.  I've been going regularly for 3 years, and I get the same thing every time: large chicken shawarma and a side of fries.  In fact, I've never ordered anything else.  As the saying goes, if it ain't broke, don't fix it.  When they ask if you want it spicy, say yes without hesitation.  The spicy sauce comes on the side (you pick up a cup of spicy sauce from a bin right by the register).  You control the level of spiciness.  And there's no extra charge.  The shawarma is good, but its the spicy sauce that makes it great.  

I've heard a lot of coworkers say their fries are the best in town.  I'd say that's a radical overstatement, but they're satisfying enough as a side.  

Shawarma and fries for about 10 bucks.  Well worth the price.
author: Jeff S.

description:
Great lunch served with alarming efficiency.

The cashiers are shockingly nice, considering the terrifying flurry of action constantly shimmering around them - must be some sort of eye-of-the-storm thing.

The salads are pretty killer, particularly the ones with meat in 'em, particularly if dressed with a couple things of their hot sauce. Not the best hummus or baba ganoush you've ever tasted, but everything else is solid.
author: JR H.

description: Most of the reviews I feel are based on the price, not really the quality of the meals. Had the gyro/Greek salad and it was meh at best. Only a couple of strips of gyro in the salad, it was mostly just lettuce. The taziki sauce is really thick and unusual for this kind of sauce. Seems like they took it from a tub of middle eastern yogurt (labneh) and called it taziki. Anyways not a fan.
author: Bobby a.

description: Tasty falafel wrap. Nice spicy sauce. Service was not bad or unfriendly as some others have suggested. I liked that they had a cheaper 7" wrap (vs. larger 9" wrap, which is only $1 more). Next time I have a hankerin' for fries I'll try those too, as I see a return visit not too far in the future.
author: Milk and Cheese ..

description: I have been lucky enough lately to have lunch paid for by my work. I have been taking full advantage of this opportunity to travel the globe with my cuisine. This particular afternoon I was in the mood for eggplant. While eggplant is one of my personal favorites, it can be a more challenging vegetable to find on menus. I stopped in Ayola immediately after spying the eggplant salad on the menu. The restaurant smelled delicious and was very quick with my take-out order.  Unfortunately, I ended up disliking the eggplant salad because it had an odd flavor. I gobbled up the feta on top of the salad, but was severely disappointed with the odd sauce on the eggplant. It was supposed to be olive oil, but it is difficult to describe the peculiar taste that angered my taste buds. I also wish the eggplant was cooked a bit more to be softer as it was too chewy. The saving grace was their hot, grilled pita. Oh my goodness. This perfectly cooked, buttery pita almost melted in my mouth. It has the delicious chewy texture of something fresh out of the oven and was spices accentuated the pita's natural taste. I would actually be willing to try Ayola again and order one of the dips. If their pita is such a standout, then I would hope the dips would complement it in taste and quality!
author: Libby J.

description: My go-to place for Greek food in SOMA - I really enjoy the food from Ayola. The gyros are delicious, as are the salads. I'm a big fan of the Sparta Salad and the Troy Salad. Salads also come with pita bread and tzatziki sauce.
author: Katrina H.

description:
Gyro's a yummy and so was this one. Nothing special though and a little pricey for what you get. Overall, not a bad lunch though. Quick service

Very small with no where to sit, but that's alright because we usually eat in the park.
author: Joshua O.

description: fries over here tastes excellent. Much better than the options in the immediate area. I also ordered a chicken falafel. The chicken was a bit dry. If I go back, I'll definitely come here for the fries.
author: Gerard Y.

description: been here a couple of times and each time I always have gotten the troy salad. Second time I also got a side of the roasted eggplant. Awesome food and full of taste and flavor. It's a good price for the amount you get as well. Also tried the falafels once as well and its really nice and crunchy. The sauces are tasty as well. too bad they are not open on the weekends. The people there are also always so friendly.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I like the lamb gyro so much that I've never ordered anything else here. I used to get the combo with fries but that's a heavy lunch. Just a seven inch gyro is enough for a filling lunch. Waitstaff are always nice too. Don't expect a seat during peak hours - just grab and go.
author: Tony P.

description:
Gyro you're my hero!

All thanks to Yelp for helping me find this superior grab and grub spot near the office.  To tell you the truth, I didn't know that gyros could be this good unless you had the munchies...
author: Ted R.

description:
I love this Greek/Mediterranean restaurant.  Although, there is really only room for about 10 people max.  Ayola is a place where you can grab a quick lunch and be on your way.  There's usually a line of students & businesspeople, but they have great customer service & have always served me quickly!     

    My usual order is their Falafel Sandwich.  Its made with the right amount of spice, but I always ask them to make it extra spicy for me.  If a dish is made spicy, I usually want it even more spicy!!  Today, I had their Chicken Shawarma (roasted chicken, sumac & tzatziki), and I really liked it. but not as much as I love their Falafel Sandwhich though...

     They also serve:  (7 inch = $5.95 or 9 inch = $6.95)  

Gyros Sandwich (lamb & beef with tzatziki sauce) 
Chicken Gyros 
Hortopita (roasted eggplant salad & feta)
Greek Salad Wrap (Greek salad in pita).  
Their sandwiches come with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and red onions.  Their French Fries are $2 and are made with pepper & salt...Yummy!

    They also serve Greek Salads.  Plain = $5.95 and Greek Salads with roasted chicken, gyros meat, tuna, or calamari = $7.50.
And of course, they have a Combo Platter with hummus, falafel, dolmas, & eggplant salad = $7.95 and a Gyros Platter = $7.95.

    I have yet to try their Salads & Combo Platter!!  FYI - they have Nantucket Nectar Juices in a bottle (I get Half & Half)!  Oh yea, I almost forgot... they have a "Sides & Dips" Menu which consist of Eggplant Salad ($4.75), Tabuleh Salad ($3.75), Falafel (4 for $3.75), Dolmas (4 for $3.75), Spanakopita & Baklava ($1.50)... the perfect Greek sides =)

     I believe I've given you the run down on Ayola, so if you visit, let me know!!! They are authentic & delicious!
author: Amethyst Popkiss A.

description: Any fries lovers here?  I really think you will love theirs.  Don't get me wrong, the gyros are also great, but what keeps me coming back are those fries...  mmmm.
author: Rick L.

description:
I was CRAVING a dirty english donner kebab - the type you get when you fall out of the club at 4 in the morning, the cabbie kicks you out half a mile from your house for puking and then you stumble into a kebab shop....That's what I was craving.

Acknowleding the fact that the Gyro is the answer to the Donner I decided to have a Gyro wrap.  It was good. I'm not complaining, it just didn't quite hit the spot like I was hoping it would.  But I will go back and I will have it again, it really was tasty, and the chille sauce these guys have is pretty good.  A welcome change from Tabasco/Tapatio
author: Kym P.

description: Just very basic level Greek food. Felafel is dry. And they put too much lettuce in the wrap.
author: Xiaohui Y.

description: After walking by so many times in front of this "whole in the wall" I finally went in the other night as I was craving for some gyros. And they were great. The meat was seasoned great. Fresh ingredients. The bread was awesome. I should have got the bigger gyros instead of the smaller size. I also went ahead and got their hummus and to my surprise it was a big container to go. It tasted awesome. A reviewer here did say that they could "smile more" and I agree - but it was the end of the night and I'm sure they were tired. But they weren't rude or anything... I'll going back for more for sure!
author: Rob L.

description:
I love lamb so I love the restuarnts that have tasty lamb dish. 
Gyros is awesome for my tast bud! I'm really happy to find a good Greek food lunch spot near work. Service is fast and nice, thumbs up!
Ayola is good for grabing a quick lunch order to either bring back to your work lunch room or sit in the sun when it's nice and warm outside. With that being said, the space is small, there are two tables i think , and that's it.
author: angeline s.

description:
I have created a monster. I introduced my co-worker to the french fries at Ayola and she always wants to make a stop for our afternoon break. Mind you, this wouldn't be a big deal but I'm trying to get into wedding shape here!

I've only had their lamb gyro...very delicious. I've been to Greece and can say that it definitely would be authentic!
author: Janelle L.

description:
Pros: 
The food here is delicious. The gyros here are the best I've ever had so far and the fries are um um good. I'm still not sure how to pronounce the word "GYRO!" I'm not  a big fan of hot sauce but the one they have here is really good. 

Cons:
The food is kind of pricey and the service isn't that great. Not to mention it's not a good place to just have lunch and socialize because it's too small.
author: Sotheara Y.

description: I haven't found a Mediterranean place that can top this one. I mean, there is Sunrise Deli right around the corner but I believe these guys have the better falafels. Service is usually quick and the staff is friendly. Try the hot sauce for sure!
author: Jasleen K.

description:
Oh my, I forgot how much I like gyros and fries.

Until I came here.

And now it's all I can think about.

Not much seating in the place, so get here early if you want to dine here. Or be like us and sneak into some outdoor seats at Chipotle.

I don't like thick fries usually but with this place, I found it hard not to eat them.
author: Denise B.

description:
One of the best places for a delicious, healthy, and affordable lunch downtown. I think the Chicken Shawarma is a little taste of heaven on earth! 

Because tons of new places have been opening up in the 2nd street area over past few years, the downtown SF lunch culture has exploded in SOMA. As a direct result, I have slowly become a gourmet salad snob (disclaimer - it's not my fault). So when a coworker suggested we check out the Greek Salad at this place that I've walked past a countless number of times, I was a little apprehensive. That said, I thought it was an inexpensive, filling, and pretty darn good salad overall. And to be honest, it was a really nice change of pace from all those $10 downtown salads that come with "fancy dressings" and are dressed up like a drag queen on a Saturday night.

But the real love story for me began in August of 2007 when I had a craving for something delicious, healthy, and filling. But I didn't feel like having anything that was too heavy. My brain said I should try a falafel, so I popped my head back into Ayola and read the menu. Standing there I thought, "Wait, hummus and some kind of fancy sauce? That's not what I want. I need something with chicken that is light and refreshing." 

So I asked the girls behind the counter. They were extremely nice and accommodating and suggested the Chicken Shawarma. They didn't even make me feel like an idiot for not noticing it on the menu (which I really appreciated). After they explained all the ingredients to me (Grilled Chicken Breast, Cucumbers, and Tahini Sauce in a Pita), I remembered that I've had this before in the past and that it sounded perfect! Plus it was only $7 for the large 9" wrap. So I said, "No hot sauce for me please", and the order was placed...

Within minutes I was walking back to my desk and soon unwrapped this glorious masterpiece. Embarrassingly I found myself eating it like a rabid dog. The delicious mix of cucumbers, real grilled chicken, and the light tahini sauce put me in a state of ecstasy. The next day I found myself ordering the same exact thing for lunch. And today, three days later, I'm writing a review of Ayola from home because I really want another one for lunch. But because I live by Japan Town and the Fillmore theater, Ayola is a little too far away for me to travel. = (

I honestly can't wait to get back to SOMA where I work so I can taste that little bit of heaven once again. I'm also hoping I can find a comparable Mediterranean take out place in the Fillmore area today. But until I can get back to Ayola, I'll have to put on my sad puppy face.
author: George L.

description:
FINALLY!!!

I have been looking for over a year for an edible place to get Falafel. This wasn't just edible, it was very very enjoyable. The spicy sauce was amazing, the falafel was fresh and toasty, the pita was warm and chewy, and the lettuce was green. I would have just been happy with unbrown lettuce in my pita for a change, and going far beyond that has made my day.

Plus, the owner was really nice -- busy nice. Plus, the cash register gal was Hot, though not as nice as the owner.  But hot people aren't nice, so no surprise.

I'll be going here again, this is my new Falafel place, sorry Cafe Algiers
author: Cory D.

description: This place was decent, but definitely not the best. I think they actually messed up my order cause what I received looked nothing like chicken and had no hummus. So I originally asked for the chicken gyro wrap with hummus and lettuce.. and what I got was lamb/beef gyro wrap with just lettuce.... With that said, though the gyro had some flavor, it was very dry. Without the hummus, I could barely eat a bite of the wrap without drinking some water right after. The fries I thought were alright. You could tell that they were not previously frozen, but it wasn't "amazing". Though the fries was definitely better than my wrap.
author: Michelle L.

description:
The food here is very delicious, and the people are friendly.  Make sure you don't go during lunch rush hour if you want to avoid a line, and if you want to sit there and eat.
The fries are delicious, and the gyros are the best i've had.  They recently opened a second location and the food and service are equally as good!
author: Patricia Z.

description:
Ayola...yet another lunch spot. 

It's good. The gyros are big and pretty inexpensive. Things move very quickly - don't be afraid of a long line, you'll still be in and out in no time.
author: Ben B.

description:
I haven't eaten any other gyros in the city so I don't have a good base to judge from. TBH, I thought Ayola was mediocre in the gyro dept. The meat, while not dry, was cut thinly and not particularly tender or juicy. The overwhelming flavor of my gyro was just salt. I wished that they'd put more tzatziki (mispelled I know). The hot sauce was tasty - tasted a lot like sriracha.

The place was clean; service was fast; prices were fair. 

I might come back to try their falafel/fries, but for now I think I'll keep searching for a better gyro. This one didn't leave me feeling so good.
author: Andrea L.

description:
I love this place. They have this sauce that is just really awesome and it's something i've never had anywhere else before. This is my go-to place if i need something quick and delish. 

I eat a lot and their medium sized gyros with fries and a can of soda is all I need. I bit messy if you use a lot of sauce, but well worth it!
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I can smell the french fries in my office when lunch comes around.  For only $2 you get a bag full of crispy fries.  They taste good even when it's cold. ;)  Make sure you bring cash,. because they will charge you 20 cents to charge it! Boooooo

I wanted to order a gyro with beef,. but they can not do that ,. since the beef and lamb were mix together.  I ended up settling for a chicken gyros,.. and combo'd it up with fries/a bottle of water.  My combo meal cost me $9 rounded up.  

Heard the falafel balls were good,. I will try that next time! 

I will be back!
author: Chanel L.

description:
Probably my favorite lunch spot when I was working in downtown SF a while back.  Most common (& favorite) order: falafel & fries

A great mix of fresh lettuce/tomatoes/etc combined with perfectly crisped falafel balls and just enough spicy orange mystery sauce to make your tongue tingle without overtaking the flavor. But I think what truly sets them apart is the flatbread they used.  Unlike alot of places in SF, the bread has the perfect consistency, thickness, and moisture.  Not too dried out & flakey (a common problem with SF falafel sandwiches, it seems). Not too chewy. Just thinking about it makes me nostalgic for my years in SF (as I wipe up the drool from my chin).

Oh, and the fries are money. Far better than most places. Crispy outside with soft & moist inside. They are also heavily peppered or something ...Yum....

Ayola is truly an oasis in an overpriced downtown food desert, even though prices & lines have increased since the glory days.
author: Dan W.

description: Falafel and gyro lovers... converge here in San Franciso...  your taste buds will thank you!  Drag all your friends with you as even if they do not like greek foods, up and down this street are options for every palate!
author: Wayne C.

description: OK, I think I can finally forgive Ayola for the rock I got in my falafel sandwich 5 years ago.  I just had another one (another falafel sandwich, that is; not another rock) yesterday, and it was delightful.  I've had a few falafel sandwiches in this area in recent months, and this one is, in my opinion, the best.  The homemade pita contributes a lot to this.  Am looking forward to my next one...
author: Eric H.

description:
You're working downtown, and your stomach is growling.  You look at the clock - by Jove, it's actually a reasonable hour for lunch!  You grab your coat, run out of the building, reach the street, and stop.  Now you must make a decision.  You could eat at Trendy Sandwich Shop No. 1, but you're not feeling particularly ritzy.  There's Salads'R'Us, but no - you need something heartier.  Perhaps you find yourself drifting down New Montgomery as you churn these thoughts over in your mind, heading towards no goal in particular, and then it hits you.  Like, really hard.  What is that smell?!  It smells like meat-and-spice-and-warm-and-hotsauce!  With...yes!  With a hint of fry!!  Yep.  Ayola just hit you.  And it felt like a kiss.  Or the preamble to a gyro.  Or maybe both.

As all of my legions of followers know, I recently professed a somewhat inappropriate passion for Baladie in the Financial District.  If Baladie is my pool boy, Ayola is the husband to whom I return, time and time again.  Why?  No, it's not a lifetime of codependency brought on by latent psychological issues.  It's because, goshdarnit, Ayola is a really solid place to get a mouthwatering and satisfying Greek meal.

The menu is rather small, as I've found is typical of Greek and Mediterranean places, featuring all of the familiar players - gyros, falafel, shawarma, Greek salads, hummus, dolmades, etc.  But they are expanding their menu - they've recently started making baba ganoush, and I can tell you it's really quite good!  I'm pretty sure they put olives into it and, if you're into that sort of thing it makes for a really nice variation on a classic dip.

Even with a limited menu, you can trust that Ayola is going to take the classics and do them up right.  My favorite is the hortopita, and if you love eggplant like I love eggplant, it'll be your favorite, too.  The eggplant is cool, but melts in your mouth.  The toppings enhance it, without overshadowing it.  I could have probably done with more feta today, but I understand that the eggplant must remain the star of the show - and that being said, the ingredients all worked together in perfect harmony!  The pita wrapper was soft and fragrant and nice and toasty warm, and it was handed to me mere minutes after I ordered, even in the middle of the lunchtime rush!  

Special mention also goes out to the dolmades.  Those things are like candy to me, and Ayola's are beautifully soft and chewy without swimming in oil.  No, instead, you can have them swim in the tub of tzatziki you get with them.  And if you're really on a budget, get the veggie combo plate.  You can probably share it with someone, but if you don't you'll have some killer leftovers!

For extra ambiance points, see if you can get a seat and wedge yourself onto a barstool in the corner.  It's crowded and not the comfiest seating of your life, but I feel it merely adds to the experience.  And plus, it sure beats taking the food back to your desk!

So if you're ever in SOMA and you need some really reliably awesome Greek food, Ayola is your place.  It never judges, it never expects too much of you, and it will always welcome you back with open arms.  But not open hands.  Its hands are full of falafel that it's going to stuff into your open and waiting mouth.  Boo.  Yah.
author: Becca S.

description: Perhaps, my high expectations got the better of me. Was told that the fries were the best. They were good but chick fil-a does em better (not that there is one nearby). The shwarma was what I ended up with - pretty decent but once again not the amazing Mediterranean hole-in the wall experience I had expected.
author: Partha S.

description: I think I am a fan of this place. I went again and ordered the 9" Gyro, one for myself and the other for a co-worker of mine. We came here a little after 11am and it was not busy at all. I love the hot sauce that they have over here. I can't get enough of it and use it for the fries too. The Gyro had plenty of meat, veggies, and sauce; no skimming here like other places. All of the ingredients were very fresh and tasty on the warm pita bread.  Service is absolutely fast and left me very satisfied. Prices are pretty much up to par with all the other places in the FiDi.
author: Tim G.

description:
If you're looking for a healthy salad with some protein, the Spartan salad (a Greek salad with grilled chicken) is a good call at Ayola.  Including tax, it only cost a little more than $8 and the salad had fresh greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, feta, and a generous amount of chicken.  You can get olives in the salad, but why would you want to add those vile accoutrements?

They provide you with a few pieces of warm pita (thank you, Greek gods!), and another nice touch was they put the dressing on the side in a container.  I did not ask for them to do this; they just did it.  I love being able to control the amount of dressing applied to salads because normally places are way too liberal.  However, I was starved and I forgot to mention it, so I'm very pleased to see they do this anyways.
author: Brendan Jude L.

description:
Thank god, I did not miss this place. I was gonna eat at Chipotle as I was too hungry to be adventurous and try something new. This was one of the best Gyro's I have had in a long time. 
The meat was so fresh and juicy, with the soft pita bread, I was so happy I was able to molest the Gyro without being arrested :-). Bite after bite, I was taking it slow as I did not want this experience to end soon. The hot sauce was a surprise, this is one of those sauces where you can keep licking it all day ;-). I was in a hurry, so I forgot to ask them if they sell the sauce in bottles.
I just came to know from all the yelp reviews that the fries are the best here and I am sad I didn't get a chance to try it. I don't mind driving all the way to SF to get some good Gyro's like this!
author: Nirmal S.

description:
Falafel was better than most. It is brown falafel, as opposed to green.  I ordered it with light hot sauce, which I think was a good move. Only problem was that the wrap became a bit soggy all around by the end. But the flavor held up, so I'll put it in the Top 10 falafel I've had.

Fries were surprisingly excellent. If you order some, definitely get the seven-inch wrap, and order it as a combo. I didn't, and later realized it was only a quarter more for a drink.

Seating is quite limited, and a but cramped, but not unpleasant. I recommend eating at the location, for fear of the wrap getting too soggy by the time I sink into it.

Overall, quite good.
author: Derek L.

description:
Had a large gyro here today.  It was ok, nothing amazing, but not bad.  I plan on going back for the falafels as I hear they are good.  The people who work there are nice and the prices are fair.  There was just nothing really that amazing about the food.  It was pretty basic and kinda boring tatziki and the lamb was just ok.  I can't write that anything there was bad, because it wasn't, just not what I was expecting.  I will revise this review after I go back for the falafels.

Update 6/30: Had the falafel wrap here today.  It was nothing too amazing.  Didn't warrant a change in the review.  I'd recommend the lamb over the falafel
author: Brian G.

description:
Mediterenean Bretheren look no further!  At last a gyro worthy of eating.

Like an oasis in the dangerous jungle that is SoMa gyros, Ayola hit me with a 1-2 punch of tasty deliciousness.

goodbye crapppy gyro meat, hello sliced fresh off the skewer goodness, yummy tzatziki sauce and deliciously fresh pita bread!!

Seriously, it's good, great, amazing and tasteful.  I'll be back here time and time again for this out of this world (or country at least) goodness!
author: Joseph F.

description: Yummy Yummy wraps but a tad pricey and small compared to Baladie Cafe.
author: Rashmi V.

description: Ayola is pretty solid. There's so many good falafel options in the city that I'm a bit harsher than maybe I should be. I mean, they really get your food out fast and while their hot sauce isn't anything new it's nice. I think their falafel is a tad dry and maybe just a little more than it should be, but what do you expect in the Financial District?
author: Paul C.

description: This place is great.  Everything is delicious. My favorite is the Sparta Salad (basically greek salad with chicken). Their ingredients are always really fresh and their hot sauce is also amazing.  They are also SUPER fast which is great when you want to grab lunch quickly. Staff is also wonderful. Highly recommend :)
author: Ris P.

description: This is a pretty standard Mediterranean restaurant. I typically get the falafel pita, but they are really known for their fries. Those are a "must order". They are always friendly, and the line usually moves pretty fast during the lunch rush.
author: Amanda R.

description:
Another disappointing falafel in San Francisco. :(

I ordered a 7" falafel sandwich for $5.95 at lunch time. A 9" is also available for $6.95. Kitchen is open, everyone wears gloves, looked clean for a small shop. "Falafel" is printed on their awning so if they specialize in it it's gotta be somewhat ok right?

Alas. Pita is too doughy, falafel is quite flavorless and gets lost in the dough. Couldn't taste the tahini. What I thought was hot sauce on the counter turned out to more like a thin tomato/marinara type sauce. 
But I'm pretty sure I won't get food poisoning from it, so two stars.
author: Kim K.

description:
My favorite thing about this place is the gyros but also the fries.
The gyros comes in 2 different sizes, 7 in and 9 in. 7 in lasted me the whole day. And the fries are always hot and flavorful. 
The price is not too bad either! It's a great location too, for business men and women and also for students at AAU. 
What you should do when you want fries and gyros, just get the meal. It's 25 cents more for a can soda! Definitely a deal if you want to get the meal instead of just the gyros.
author: DANA L.

description:
I like this place a lot. It's fast and relatively cheap for what you get. It's a tiny place so i wouldn't say it's the most awesome place for a large group to sit down and chat. But there are a few tables to sit with a friend or two. The staff is really nice and they remember their usual suspects. The line gets rather long during lunch time but  it usually dies down pretty quick. So even in a  during the lunch rush it's not a bad choice. 

So as for the food, I am ok with their falafel wrap. It's not the greatest but it's decent. The small gyro is usually my choice and it's more than enough for me. However I do have a weakness for another item on their menu. The fries .... they be awesome. I had a pretty long discussion about the fries with some coworkers. The fries here are fresh, sprinkled with just the right amount of salt, and a little bit of what I believe is paprika which makes it like the most addictive side dish ever. Sometimes this adds a little wait to your order but it's totally worth it.

Also be courteous to others. If you have ordered already and are just waiting for them to call your number, get out of the way and let others through geez :)
author: Greg G.

description:
I can't wait to go back here! I only wish they were open all the time, I'd definitely make the trip!

The Gyro's are big and delicious! I just love finding affordable places in the city that serve great food. The place is small and the line gets long, so get there early to get the full enjoyment of your meal or get it to go. My biggest disappointment is that this place is only open for the business people. 

Great place for a refreshing Greek lunch for cheap!
author: Victoria A.

description: I've finally found my lunch break spot! This place is cheap and quick - and, the food ain't bad either. Actually, the food is up to par in my books. I got the chicken shawarma, which is full of flavor, fresh, and the chicken is oh-so-juicy. I'll be back to try the salads and other pita sandwiches.
author: Lin C.

description:
Ayola is a great lunch spot. 

The gyros are big, inexpensive, and pretty good. The only thing is you can tell the meat isn't very freshly cooked or even particularly great, but the thing that makes the place great is the sauce. They have a bunch of small containers of it to the left of the register and if you pour that all over your gyro, the meal becomes delicious. 

This is the place if you want something good, fast, and cheap. If you're looking for something mouth-watering though I would recommend someplace else.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Quality greek takeout + clean storefront + affordable

Good chicken pitas, tzatziki, fries.  A great lunch takeout spot if you work in the area.  Love their spicy red sauce, whatever it is
author: Gracie L.

description: Interesting calamari salad.
author: Kristen S.

description:
I came here for lunch with several co-workers. It impressed ALL of us.

I had the lamb and beef gyro: it definitely beats the gyros I get at school! Stuffed with the right amount of meat and veggies...yum! Everyone else loved their salads/gyros. And oh, gosh, I could go ON and ON about that SAUCE! Y'know? Y'know. The one you pick up at the counter. So amazingly delicious...like liquid crack. Almost. 

Alright. Time to go and dream about my next meal here.
author: Betty T.

description:
If it weren't for the courteous and efficient employees this place would get only one star. 

I had to check this place out considering that some of the people I work with make it a weekly (sometimes daily) thing!

I ordered the rosemary chicken shawarma. Chicken was too dry for my taste. White sauce lacked. The pita wasn't warmed up completely. The whole experience got messy as everything was falling apart and out of my shawarma. 

I really wanted to like this place since it conveniently located half a block from where I work but no luck. 

I would def come back to try the fries, which yelpers are raving about.
author: Dora S.

description:
bottom line: quick and consistent gyro option

i love coming here for the beef and lamb gyros.  it tastes the same everytime and that's a good thing.  depending on my mood and hunger level, i'll opt for the 7 or 9 inch gyros.  the combo is a $2.50 add-on that includes fries and a canned soda, but if soda isn't your thing anymore, the fries are only $2.25 so this is not that great of a combo anyways.  service is very snappy and friendly here.  make sure to get the hot sauce to drizzle on your gyros.
author: Aaron T.

description: You know the name of that thing? That ever turning, slowly roasting ménage à trois of lamb, beef, and spices.  Whatever it is called, they have one here and they use it to make sandwiches with all the care and precision as a pâtisserie.
author: David S.

description:
Okay this place is so good. Their salads ROCK!!! I've had the chicken salad, the lamb salad and some of their gyros. The meat is always so juicy. Everything I've eaten here is great, but I *HEART* the salads. So tasty.

Ya decor is corny, but who cares? Everything else rocks. My only complaint is the creepy manager/owner (?) who gawks at all the girls. His creep factor is high, but the salads are worth it!
author: Manuela F.

description:
Went here on a Saturday for lunch, no line, fresh food, great prices. What a find!

The gyro was just what you expect and want from a gyro. 

The chicken gyro's are oddly disgusting. I don't blame Ayola for that and maybe someone else will think differently about it... but its just not for us. If you want chicken there, stick with the shawarma.
author: Jasen M.

description:
I love the beef and lamb gyros!  I am not an expert on Greek cuisine, otherwise I would give this place a 5 star rating.  Expect a line out the door during the lunch hour, but they are usually quite efficient and it's definitely  worth the wait.  The fries alone are worth the trek to this place.

There isn't a lot of seating, so I usually go back to my office or sit in the park near the MOMA on a nice day.  

Great food, decent price, and a nice additional to my usual lunch spots.
author: Dora L.

description: A good enough lunch choice for gyros. No frills. They offer lamb & beef , chicken or veggie in 7 or 9 inch. Really inexpensive, fast service. Their in-house hot sauce is amazing! And they take credit cards.
author: Al G.

description: This is one of my regular lunch spots because everything tastes very fresh and homemade.  I love all the vegetarian options like hummus, tabouli, spanakopita, falafel...they are all excellent.  And the place always looks clean, has polite staff, and the line moves quick.
author: Lisa R.

description: Had a great chicken gyro here. This is just a walk-up place off New Montgomery st., no place to sit.  I'd definitely give it another try.  The order came out quick and everyone was friendly.
author: David T.

description:
Food here is good and cheap.  I've had some better, but I've definitely had plenty worse.  I really love their spicy sauce.  I don't know what's in it, maybe some yogurt and rosemary.  Anyway, it's delicious.

The staff is always friendly.  Theres one thing I think tastes super generic which is the falafel.  It tastes store bought.  But since everything here is under 10 dollars and it gets me full.  I think it's a great place to grab lunch.
author: Eddie C.

description:
This place is just great.

My friend and I had plans to meet at Chipotle, but, luckily it was SLAMMED. We cowered, and hopped next door to this spot.

I am on and off with Greek, if I like it, it has to be GOOD.

It was really quiet when we came in, and there was maybe only 7 seats (we scored the one table in the place), we got our lunch quite quickly! I am glad, people started coming in right after us.

I ordered a chicken salad with walnuts, apples, greens and a really yummy dressing. It came with warm, soft and awesome pita bread.

My friend raved about her chicken shawarma (sp?). Hers came with fries too, and I am a freak for good french fries. They came with just enough pepper on them to add a great zing.

It was not the cheapest food, but it was so good, and pretty big portions. 

I try to avoid the financial district during lunch time (and, pretty much in general!), but I def would go back.
author: Kellie P.

description: Chicken Shawarma was good..not what I expected. It was tasty, but seemed more like a chicken salad with ranch dressing in a pita than a real dark meat shawarma. Fries were perfect, thick, and yum! Can't wait to go back to try their vegetarian options!
author: Bootylicious J.

description: Looks like my lunch here a little less than a year ago was just a nasty fluke.  I came back here last week after eating a succulent Gyros at Ayola #2 and found that this place also makes a pretty damn good lamb Gyros (most of the time, anyway!)   The fries, as always, are awesome.   I got the large Gyros lunch value meal and was absolutely stuffed!   For right around $10, it totally hit the spot.   I guess I know where I'm getting my Gyros fix from now on.  W00t!
author: David O.

description:
I wasn't in the mood for any S-foods (sandwich, soup, salad) during the day at work. I asked one of my co-workers for alternatives with a good value, and he suggested "some place down on New Montgomery that sells falafel". When he mentioned falafel, I realized I hadn't had a falafel in ages, so I set out on my quest to find this eatery with supposedly no name.

Lo and behold, upon approaching the destination, I saw that I was in fact going to Ayola, which I'd seen before on Kearny as well. I had heard good things about Ayola on Kearny, but didn't get a chance to stop by that branch on days after work since it closes by 5pm. The New Montgomery location stays open until 6pm though, so that's a good thing to keep in mind the next time I'm hunting for non-typical food in the Financial District...

This shop is small, a little cramped, but cute. The menu consists of mostly pita sandwiches and salads (served with pita). The sandwiches come in two sizes, 7-inch or 9-inch. I went with the smaller size since I figured it would still fill me up. Combo platters and party trays are also available for those who need variety or have office lunch gatherings, respectively. Everything is Greek or Mediterranean on the menu with the exception of french fries, which I find a little odd to be included on the menu (it's also the only "junk" food on the mostly-healthy menu).

Service was lightning-speed fast; I took some time in making my decision on the falafel sandwich (well, I couldn't decide the size at first, and I couldn't decide if I really wanted to tack on fries with the order or not), but the cashier rang me up really quickly and the falafel was already out and ready before I could put my change back into my wallet. The workers must have thought I was a little strange for not hearing my order number at first, but I really thought they were calling out someone else's number until I looked down at my own receipt. Oops.

I was impressed with how much fresh vegetables they topped the falafel sandwich with; vegetables were the first thing I saw when I unwrapped my meal. The pita was soft and warm, and the falafel  itself was chewy and had the right amount of flavor. I requested for hot sauce, but it was only noticeable near the end of the wrap, which was slightly disappointing. Overall, though, the sandwich was still delicious.

Prices are reasonable considering it's not every day (or everywhere) I can find Greek/Mediterranean food. For a small sandwich, the cost is $5.95; for a large, it's only a dollar more. The salads range from $5.95-$7.95, depending on the complexity of the ingredients involved. I'm not entirely sure of the value of the salads since I didn't look around at other customers' meals. There are also sides ranging from $1.50 to $4.75.

I'll be heading to the Kearny Street location next to check out the consistency of the food, service, price, etc. I have to say, though, I am indeed a fan of Ayola as of this past week.
author: Helene K.

description:
Juicy gyros, just the way I like them.  The line here moves lightning fast.  I wish there were a place to eat though, because gyros are not so easy/clean to eat.  We walked over to Yerba Buena, and devoured our food, but sauces were dripping everywhere, and it was a messy endeavor.

Plus, I was hungry just a couple hours later.  I don't think the 7 inch is enough to fill you up.  Not enough meat.
author: Liz L.

description: The french fries are great and the items are reasonably priced for the area.  However, I would definitely choose Gyro King on 2nd street before Ayola for their better taste and meat quality.
author: Jordan F.

description:
honestly, i didnt even know what a schwarma was before going to ayola. could have wikipedia'ed it beforehand, but oh well. basically it's like a gyro. pita bread wrapped around chicken (or your choice of meat), some kind of sauce, lettuce, and more. 

get extra hot sauce by the door on your way out! i like eating mine with a fork, just to not spill this sauce all over you...

and the five star rating? that's for the fries. no doubt. the fries. the fries. the fries.
author: Bethany K.

description: Yummy, super fast, and the fries are seriously SO GOOD! Wish they had other options besides everything in a pita sandwich but still yum!
author: Natalie D.

description: The Macedonian chicken salad was amazing. We had it picked up so I don't know anything about the service. Hence the 4/5 stars... But otherwise: wow. That salad was gooooood! (FYI: The dressing is probably very fattening and that's partially what makes it good).
author: Maryam M.

description:
Upgrading to 5 stars because this place is amazing.

The fries are like heaven.  And fries are one of those underrated things where even poorly executed fries are ok but once you have good fries it's a life changing experience.

And the gyro's here are really excellent too.

Plus the staff is super friendly and the food is pretty quick.  What more could you want?  Besides a diet version of the items mentioned above but that's a given.
author: Evan L.

description: So I'm new to working in SOMA and happened to be craving gyros. Low and behold Ayola right across the street, takes cards, huge gyros... say no more. Pretty standard take out place to say the least. Staff was very friendly, the food came rather quickly zero complaints. Soooo as far as the gyros sandwich goes... it was ok i've defiantly have had better in the city. The gyros was kinda on the dry side, the pita it is wrapped in was kinda too crispy and cracked the wrap, spillage all over my desk.... you get the idea. All in all not a bad lunch take out place. I will go back and defiantly would suggest it to those in the area with the quick gyro needs..
author: Sean MC E.

description: Perfectly priced, greasy, yummy gyros. If you want kebab and hummus, tzatziki, pita, lamb... all those yummy Greek fairs at a great price in under 10 minutes, this is the place.
author: Zach S.

description: Solid lunch spot for gyros! The pita bread is soft, and the meat is tender. I'll be back again!
author: Jeanne C.

description:
As far as their lunch offerings, I've only had the gyros and french fries but I think Ayola also serve falafels and other Greek and Middle Eastern favorites one would expect.  The gyros are delicious, especially when you slather it in this hot sauce that is house made.  

However, the real reason I'm writing this review is because their french fries are the BEST I've had in recent memory!  They cook them in this odd looking contraption that I've never seen before but the potatoes come out exceptionally crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  To top it off, they season them with a mixture of salt and pepper that makes them even more tasty!

I generally eat pretty healthy so it's rare that I come here, but when I feel like treating myself to a big fat gyro that's dripping with hot sauce and a side of the most delicious french fries in San Francisco, Ayola is at the top of my list.  Try their fries and tell me I'm wrong, I dare you!
author: Doug V.

description:
2 kinds of gyros: beef & lamb OR chicken
comes in 2 sizes: 7" or 9"
7" is $6.52 ($5.95 plus tax)

I'm was happy they have no minimum on plastic since I never carry more than a few dollars worth of cash. It's a quick & easy lunch. I was surprised to find seating indoor, albeit little. There were a few seats at the window bar & a couple of small tables. Don't expect to do any reading here though because there is too much foot traffic coming in and out.

Yes, I gathered this during the 5 minutes I was here because I'm perceptive of things like that.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Ayola is a great lunch spot. Their falafel is excellent and service is quick and painless.
