Grab a sandwich, head over to Yerba Buena park - and you've got an awesome lunch break!
author: claire s.

description: Good but not great gyros. Satisfying but not awe inspiring. Service was amazingly fast.
author: David P.

description: This review is purely based on ordering the Chicken Shwarma wrap.... This is by far the worst attempt at chicken shwarma I have ever seen or experienced. The chicken looks and tastes like the refrigerated chicken strips you can get at Safeway that are flavorless and mushy. It's DRENCHED in tzatziki sauce, which is awful. The lettuce and tomatoes look and taste like they are from yesterday... maybe the day before yesterday? Honestly, I took two bites, opened this thing up, and looked inside... tried to pick at the chicken, tried to pick at the tomatoes and got actually SCARED of eating it. I don't think this is fresh AT ALL. The pita itself is chewy, which normally happens when it's old... I just spend 7 of my hard earned dollars on this and am so so disappointed. I am also MISERABLE because I was starving by the time I got here and back to my office to finally eat lunch... and NOW I can't even FORCE myself to eat this... I LOVE Mediterranean food and have eaten Shwarma - greek style and middle eastern style - many times and in many countries. THIS weird refrigerator "grilled" chicken drenched in sauce with stale lettuce and tomatoes is NOT shwarma by any definition. I really wish I worked closer or had the time to take this thing back and ask for my money back or to try something else... now I am hungry AND super disappointed. I decided to "cheat" on my diet and go get a shwarma after dreaming of shwarma for days... and THIS is what I get? What did I ever do to you, Oasis Grill? :(
author: Jamie O.

description:
Great take out!! I struggle to find good delivery food in the FiDi / SOMA area, but Ayola has great food that doesn't get all mushy or dried out when delivered.  They don't always have people on staff to deliver past 4pm, but you can pick it up, and they pack everything nicely so it is easy to carry.

Ayola makes it easy for those trying to order for groups (they have catering "platter" that serve 10-11 people), and the food tastes great when you go to serve it.

Highly recommended for groups and delivery!
author: Lisa W.

description:
It's hard finding good places downtown for lunch that comes with a decent price. My coworker introduced me to this place. I was hesitant because the BEST gyro place that I have tried is Oasis Grill by Embarcadero. But i tend to get lazy to walk down there from work, so I finally tried Ayola! 

I ordered a 7in Gyro wrap for $6.52 after tax. First impression was that it was served on a pita bread and wasn't as refreshing because there isn't a lot of cucumbers and the tzatziki sauce tasted like sour cream! What I did like about it is that it has TONS of gyros in it! If anything, I think that's what i liked most about it. It did lack a good sauce, but the hot sauce on the side made up for it. I found myself devouring it and any leftover gyro was dipped into hot sauce! It can get a bit messy but altogether a delicious but not to heavy lunch. 

Consumed on 7/12/10 & 7/13/10
author: Nancy T.

description: Excellent fries, so so Gyros! The gyros are nothing special, the run of the mill, factory made gyros meat that most Mediterranean places use. I honestly don't understand why so many have given the place a 4 star. I will try it one more time and may revise this review.
author: TJ T.

description: I definitely frequent this spot, and my review falls somewhere between 3-4 stars.  I'll give it the benefit of the doubt and bump it up to 4.  Nothing original getting served up here, but the gyros and shawerma are really solid.  They have a great hot sauce served up, and this place could not get any quicker.  Really nice group of people that work here (a family?).  The fries are lip smackers as well - get the lunch combo.
author: William B.

description:
Got the 7 inch Chicken Shawarma.  The chicken looked good and was juicy.  Pita was nice as well, nothing special.  Tzatziki was pretty good without overpowering everything.  Only problem is I asked for it to be spicy, but no heat whatsoever.  

It cost 7.06 after tax, which is pretty cheap by SOMA lunch standards. Service was super quick.  Not bad and nothing special but, I'd probably would go back to try the falafel.
author: Sam H.

description:
In what will no doubt be my shortest review thus far (perhaps many of you are rejoicing at this!), I have to give a shout out to the gyros at Ayola.  So my review will be as quick as one of my visits here!

That's right...the service is fast and the gyros are damn good.  The lamb is delicious, pita bread and rest of the ingredients are splendid but the star might be the sauce (which is usually key to any great gyro).

I probably get a hankering for a gyro at least once a month and this is the spot I'll hit!
author: John K.

description: Food delicious (specifically the gyro and fries). Service decent. Easy crowd during lunch. Price moderate.
author: Chris M.

description:
The Gods of New Montgomery have spoken, and their answer (what was the question?) is Ayola. Replacing a bubble tea place, Ayola serves up honest, simple and delicious Mediterranean food. We're talking serious gyros and fresh falafel, folks.

Really friendly staff make this a welcome addition to the Yelp Lunch Circuit.
author: Nish N.

description:
GYROS.  Half a block from the office.

TIP: Request HOT SAUCE!!  OMFG!!

But you know what makes me swoon?  It's those hot hot hot crisp salty french fries with the combo meal.

It feels like I have stepped back into Chicago, but cleaner, with a simpler menu, and with really awesome french fries, that double the comfort of this native comfort food on a cold day.

I just kind of wish the name of this place had a naughty connotation.
author: Danny H.

description:
Great crew working there - they always brighten my day.  One of the few places that has a great selection of CANNED beverages. (they stay cold longer, and are a better serving size) Their Tabouli is absolutely amazing.  I've had their Chicken Gyro, Regular Gyro, french fries, tabouli, Spanakopita and Falafel.  All were top notch.

If you are near mission and New Montgomery and looking for good eats - this is the place for you.
author: Ben L.

description: This place won't quite take you to Athens, but the food is great and price is right.
author: Pink L.

description:
Still the best fries in the city and still only $2.  They serve them salted and peppered, which puts them over the top, and there are 2 kinds of hot sauce available for dipping, but I wish their ketchup was better quality. 

The gyros are the best around too, and the gal who is always at the counter is incredibly sweet.  I'm raising the rating to five stars.
author: Quinn S.

description:
I love the fries.
I love the people that run this place. 
I love the gyro salad (max once a week though)
I love hummus (old Jerusalem still wins) 
I wish the salad was more tossed sometimes. I usually end up with all my feta cheese on one-side of the salad, boo.
I like the hot pita that comes with my salad.
I like the fast service.
The falafel isn't great. I would skip it. 
I was bummed out they got rid of the kerns juices bye bye guava!  

That's about it, I come here probably once a week, I sometimes would come twice a week but you hit a gyro wall when that happens. Don't do it, once a week is enough gyro meat for any normal human.
author: Michael S.

description: Today's Gyro sandwich was delicious! The key is warmth. Sometimes the sandwich is not warm enough, which makes it hard to get along with my stomach. But when it's warm and fresh, the sandwich tastes amazing.
author: George L.

description: One of the better gyro places in the Fidi.  They have the 7 and 9 inch.  Falafel is very good as well.  Trying the falafel wrap next.  Line is quick and easy and the staff is friendly.  This is much better than Sunshine Deli on First and rivals Oasis with the falafel
author: Josh L.

description:
I didn't think it was possible! You CAN get a delicious gyro in San Francisco.  

I ordered the lamb and beef gyro, and got exactly what I wanted and expected.  The wrap was warm, the meat was flavorful, the yogurt sauce and veggies were plentiful, but in just the right amount and proportion.

I'm pretty pumped that there's a new lunch spot worth going to now in my hood.

*updated, 4/30/08
Their hot sauce is so good.  Get some!
author: shaun l.

description:
You ever have one of those lunch hours where you aren't really in the mood for anything specific but you know you need to eat something so you leave any opinions or voting skills at your desk and just kinda tag along with coworkers and let them decide the fate of your tummy? Yeah? Me too and that is exactly how I ended up here.

I will say that they are grease lightening fast here. It's kinda surreal. I ordered the lamb gyro minus the onions and within 30 seconds, BAM!, there it was. Neat. We then journeyed back to the office and I ate said gyro at my desk and it was good. Not mind-blowing, but again, I left opinions at my desk, so I will say, it was a solid lunch, it was cheap and it hit the spot. So there.
author: Stephy S.

description: Big fan of this joint.  Great gyros, good pita bread, and quick service in Soma which is much needed.  Definitely get the fries and gyro for your first time, the shawarma is great too
author: Ryan H.

description:
I always laugh when I see posters of a smiling girl holding a gyro with clever, succinct slogans proclaiming "GYRO!" or something of the sort. I mean, WHO ARE THE AD WIZARDS WHO CAME UP WITH THAT ONE?

But then one fateful day, I strolled down New Montgomery at lunchtime on a Saturday (when my usual haunts are all closed up) & did something crazy. I wandered into Ayola.

When I walked in the door, I knew it was about time I finally gave it a try, but after eating my deelicious chicken gyro, I realized that I felt just like the Gyro Girl at heart. 

Where had Ayola been all my life? Could it have really been right under my nose this whole time? How did I wait this long? Is this love...that I'm feeling?

Put me on the next poster. I'll gladly lend my image towards gyro promotion.
author: Pete J.

description:
Nice gyro...

I know it's Kronos and all, but some restaurants can really screw it up.  These guys don't...

The large bottle of harissa was a nice touch...
author: Nathan W.

description: I've certainly had worse gyros.  Now, if that doesn't get you excited for Ayola... Anyway, my quick recommendation would be to go with the gyro before you go with the shwarma, and to go with the larger-size over the smaller option.  It's just that simple.
author: Laurence W.

description:
Really tough call between 3 and 4 stars for this one! Ayola is a hole in the wall with some counter space to eat and maybe one table. Serves wraps, salads and combo plates which are pretty high quality evidenced by the line at lunch time. I've seen it out the door, but lately seems to have died down a bit.
Taste: I don't know how gyro meat is "supposed" to taste, but I like ayola's more than most. Not greasy and more flavor, I would like to believe it's fresher although it could all be due to the preparation. Chicken shawarma and falafel are also quite good. Best French fries in downtown!! Super awesome hot (although right out of the bag might be too hot), still really good after the walk back to your desk.
Value: standard fare of about $10, they do offer smaller wraps for less and combo meals with a drink so I would say better than average for downtown. Going large with a combo plate will cost a bit more but i thinks it's still reasonable given the portion
Variety: well it's a Greek place so it's all Greek food. Salads, wraps and plates with some sides like French fries, etc. not great but not like it's just not item either. You get what you sign up for here
Overall: really like ayola, am a regular and always have the internal struggle over whether I should get French fries! High quality stuff and at a good value!
author: Aldo K.

description: In my opinion best gyros in the downtown area. The interior is a little small so dont plan on eating there. Not too sure about the difference in the two sizes but the smaller one usually hits the spot. The fries are good and the red sauce is great. Give this place a shot if you are working in the area. The other gyros around the corner don't come close.
author: Rich S.

description:
The cute, friendly counter girl really brings this place together for me.  I'm not trying to be sketchy, but whenever I'm in here she's always nice to me, and more to the point, she's always interacting with other regular customers as friends.  Especially since I usually go to Ayola when I want something nearby and fast, I like feeling like I'm stepping into my local corner store.  Actually, I never go to my actual corner store.  But whatever.

Cheers for people that keep you coming back.
author: Jack S.

description:
i thought long and hard about what my first review on yelp would be once i could actually write reviews.. and I feel pretty good about my selection.

Over the year that I worked down the street from Ayola, I have probably consumed enough hummus and babaganoush to fill a barrel. 

My usual fix is the combo platter. It's around 8 bucks and comes with Greek salad, hummus, babaganoush. falafel, dolmas, and fresh warm pita bread.  Even though I eat like a whale, this monstrosity lasts me for 2 meals. And its so so so delicious. 
I've had the chicken shwearma and the salad with the apples before as well and  both were awesome.. but i stick to the combo platter because i am a hummus whore.

Bottom line is this. There are plenty of places where you can get greek food in the area. Ayola is quick, reasonably priced, and the most well seasoned and prepared out of all of the other options I tried. There is barely any room to sit inside, so plan on going to the park or back to the office if you pick food up from them.

i'll miss you ayola.... :(
author: Helen N.

description: Great lunch spot! Ayola has excellent gyros, their platters have generous portions, and the line moves really fast. Perfect for a quick on-the-go lunch.
author: Neil R.

description: I try the salads here just to start off Monday with a healthy lunch. The Gyros platter was filled with gyros meat (lamb & beef), hummus, tzatziki and a nice portion of their Greek salad. The meat was OK, but was better with the pita bread and tzatziki made it more edible. Salad greens were fresh with cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, feta cheese and olives with house dressing. Very nice people with fast service. Good fresh selections of pita sandwiches and salads, nothing over $10.
author: Wolfy W.

description: Lamb gyro w/ the special hot sauce... SO DELICIOUS. this tiny hole in the wall spot is a gem of a joint situated right in the heart of the financial district. It's a cozy spot; no chain/corporate feel. I study at Kaplan New Montgomery down the street; randomly walked in one day, and have been addicted ever since. A time or two, however, I've found the lamb dry. They recently added lentil soup to the menu... It's full of flavor & comes with pita bread- perrfect for a rainy day (like today.)
author: Jennifer G.

description:
I wholeheartedly vouch for the Combo Mediterranean Plate, it's a whole lotta food for a not bad price and for the ladies, you will have some attractive leftovers for an afternoon snack in the office before you hit the gym. I also heart the Chicken Shawarma, with a heary dollop of hot sauce.

The fries tend to be on the soggy side once they travel back to the office, but have the delicious tastiness of being possibly fried in animal fat, it's a working theory, but yeah, they have that special extra somethin flavor going on, that in my book is, well, really delish.
author: Jennifer O.

description: They make the best chicken gyro I've had in SF. I always get the combo with Gyro, french fries and a drink. All for a great price - perfect lunch imo.
author: Peter H.

description:
The 9 inch falafel pita sandwich ($6.50) with lettuce, tomatoes, and red onions was only $1 more than the 7 inch sandwich ($5.50) so I ordered it, thinking I would eat half now and eat the other half later. Not possible. One bite of the falafel and I wolfed it down so fast that my tummy now aches from being too full. I wish they put more hummus in the sandwich though. Also, I didn't care too much for the pita bread, which was just standard and not spectacular. Next time, I think I'll get falafel (4 pieces for $3.50) and hummus (1/2 pint served with pita for $3.50).

UPDATE 7/13/06: I am changing my review from 3 stars to 4 stars. The reason is I have since tried their sparta (greek salad with grilled chicken and pita bread) and it is fucking fantabulous. Yes, it so freakin' good. One of the best salads I have ever had in my life. And usually, I skip the dressing because I am very picky about it. My god! I wanted to drink the salad dressing. Delicious! Get your booty down here and try it. With tax, it is a little expensive at $7.54 but it tastes so good that I think it's worth it once or twice a week. If you're vegetarian, it's $6.46 (inclusive of tax) for just the greek salad and pita.
author: Wendy L.

description:
I just came back from lunch with a co-worker at Ayola and it was great!! I haven't had gyros from too many places but this was probably the best one I've ever had.  It's inexpensive and super fast.  My co-worker wasn't even done signing off for his credit card charge and his order was ready.

I ordered a 9 inch beef gyro with fries and it was plenty of food.  The actual place isn't much to rave about but I've never really cared if the food's good.  There's very limited seating inside and I'm guessing it gets packed around the beginning of the lunch hour.

We decided to take our lunches outside on a rare sunny and WARM San Francisco day and ate at one of the outdoor tables outside of Chipotle.  It was really a great spot to try out when you can't think of where else to go for lunch while at work.  I would have never thought to go inside if it wasn't for Yelp.  Definitely coming back!
author: Chris C.

description:
I'm overrating this place on purpose. And here's why: When Chipotle, Working Girl Cafe, and Cafe Madeline have lines warping around the block Ayola has absolutely NO line. Plus they got the assembly line thing locked down. I think I've never spent more than 4 minutes in that place.

The only thing I get is the Beef or Lamb Gyro. It's not the tastiest thing in the world but it is sufficient to kill hunger. One time I got adventruous and got the Chicken Schwarma and I was disappointed. I think the chicken was too dry.

This place really deserves 3 stars, but just because of the lightning service I'll give it the 4 spot. Plus the cashiers always seem to be in a good mood. They're always smiling and I appreciate that.
author: Poincare's Conjecture N.

description: Ahh the simple joys of working in downtown SF - paying $9 for gyro, but you still won't hear a single complaint from me.  The fries are lightly seasoned with salt + pepper, perfectly complimenting the gyros.  Your workspace will reek of french fries and your co-workers will grovel with envy.
author: Alan N.

description: I pass this place all the time so decided to give it a try for lunch on a weekday. The wait was short and the staff was pleasant.  I got a gyros platter with lamb and beef, which i liked. The tzatziki was good but the hummus was a bit lacking.  My companion got a sparta salad, which was a bit bland and he would not order again.  We also got the chicken shawerma which was pretty good.  Sadly i did not get to try the fries that everyone seems to be raving about.  We'll have to give it another try. Overall it's a decent place around SOMA to get some quick gyros.
author: Janet Z.

description:
I don't know how I didn't discover this place earlier. I guess it's kind of easy to pass it by without another glance, but I'm so happy I've finally discovered its greatness.

The service is friendly, the chicken shawarma is tasty (I keep the hot sauce off because it's a little too spicy for me), and the fries are crisp. 

Funny thing today - I was walking down Mission and passed the corner of New Montgomery, and if I'm not mistaken, I think the whole street smelled like Ayola.
author: Ava S.

description: Not the best gyros Ive had, but the aren't bad. Pita was a little cold and hard. I like gyros with the meat sliced thin and these ones were chunky. Not the freshest, but best price for ur money if you get the 9inch gyro. I loved the hot sauce, its a must try.
author: Skye J.

description: This is my go-to Gyro place in the SOMA/FiDi area. Delicious Gyros, unparalleled hot sauce, and lightening fast service. I eat here at least once a week, love Ayola!
author: Alex K.

description:
Best Gyros in the FiDi, for sure!  I come from Chicago where the Gyros are way better than anything I've ever tasted in California, and Ayola's Gyros come closest to being the real thing!  Anyone who has given less than 5 stars to Ayola's Gyros either has never tasted any other Gyros in the Bay Area, or has bad taste!

If I were rating Ayola against the best Chicago Gyros I've had, I'd have to give it 2 stars, maybe 3 on a good day, but compared to every other Gyros I've sampled in California, Ayola gets 6 or 7 stars.

Also, real Gyros do not have lettuce, so ask them to hold the lettuce!
author: John H.

description: This place is awesome!  The Macedonian Chicken Salad is the best salad I've ever had!  Love the staff too!
author: Andrew O.

description:
It may seem as though I am being too generous with my 5-star ratings lately - but the truth is, I end up yelping the places I like the most, so most of my reviews are 4 or 5 stars.

Anyway, hands down the best gyro I've had in the city - just get their lamb gyro, don't waste your time mulling over anything else on their menu. 7-inch if you're an average eater, 9-inch if you're really hungry.

Soft fluffy pita that doesn't fall apart, generous portion of flavorful meat, refreshing yogurt sauce topped with tomatoes & lettuce.  

They do a good job packing everything in so the gyro stays together to the last bite and you're not wrestling with a mess while you're eating, no sauce dripping down your hands. Great SOMA lunch option.
author: Kathy Y.

description:
Chicken Schwarma is fun to say

schwarma

Today, I discoved it is equally fun to eat. I ordered it with humus and extra hot sauce. Yowza, it was so hot that I was panting, but yet I kept eating. 
I normally get the falafel and have been happy with it every time.  This place serves consistant food and at a  good price.  Great for a quick lunch.
author: Kim S.

description: Secret awesomeness? Lentil soup. Sure, they have decent salads and wraps but for that occasional cold rainy day in SF... lentil soup. With hot sauce to dip your warm pita into...mmm...
author: Kiely H.

description: Acceptable lunch spot. The lamb gyro is by far my favorite on the menu. A quick tip would be to get some hot sauce on your way out for your fries!
author: Vivien S.

description:
delicious gyros from a Greek perspective.
not a place to dine in, better to take out.
best chicken, beef & lamb gyros in SF.
author: TVAT T.

description: What an incredible gyro!  Great pickled carrots/celery/pepper mix to go with it, too.
author: Maxwell R.

description: Dam this place is good!  The gyros and fries comprise the perfect workday lunch!
author: Jeff M.

description:
Its been awhile since I visited the Mediterranean, and since I love the cuisine I always try to find some good Greek restaurants.  While Ayola isn't the most authentic restaurant, it is a decent lunch option in SOMA that has quick service and a small staple menu.  It won't knock your socks off, but it will definitely fill the tummy well.

Their fries are probably the best thing, seasoned and cooked just right; they don't even need any ketchup or other sauces (I know I know, French fries aren't Greek but hey, they're good here).  Their Lamb and Beef gyro is good, and is full meal for a good price.  One thing that does disappoint is their Chicken Schwarma.  It just seems like another chopped chicken sandwich and doesn't have that Greek feel.

I do go here every so often though, and it adds variety to the Mission SOMA office corridor.
author: Lemar H.

description:
While I definitely have an appreciation for a smaller ethnic joint trying to make it amongst the designer salad crowd in the FiDi area, the whole place just sorta reeked of the Sysco food service delivery truck.  Isn't the appeal of the mom and pop joint supposed to be a sense of heartful home-made type goodness? More effort plz.

Oh, and my dolma was so gross and mushy that I could barely get half of one down.  Apparently, I've been dolma spoiled in the past. Bummer.
author: jessica s.

description:
Oh the FRIES. Who cares about everything else! Their fries are bomb. They're seasoned with salt & pepper and almost taste a lil bit buttery sometimes. Amazing. They're a must!

The Chicken Shawarma is good too. Nice warm, fluffy pita, tender chicken, veggies, and ooeygooey sauce. Make sure to ask them to make it with the spicy sauce, which really isn't very spicy at all so grab some extra sauce by the door to go.
author: Felicia C.

description:
Their falafel is fresh and decent. You can choose either a 7 inch or 9 inch falafel (or other sandwich) depending on how big a size queen you are. If you want a falafel wrap (rather than falafel in a pita) you need to give them a heads up when you order because they default to pita. 

Their fries are seriously awesome. They salt them and pepper them (why don't more people do this!?!?). I didn't actually order fries, but ended up eating half of my friend Kenny's. Lucky for me, he is a size queen and got the 9-incher, thus leaving not much room in his belly for all those fries. 

Prices are fair and they offer a lunch combo with fries and a drink for around $8.
author: Angie R.

description:
The food wasn't bad honestly.  I had the eggplant sandwich.  It wasn't the most flavorful thing I've ever eaten, but wasn't bad at all.  I do love Mediterranean and this is right in the work 'hood, so I had high hopes.

However, minus 3 stars for the seriously bad things it did to my gut.  I'll leave it at that.  You don't want to hear the details...trust me.
author: Carmen R.

description:
One day I woke up and said, "I've had it with middle-of-the-road, mall-quality gyros!"  My new mission was to not only learn how to make them myself, but to find good examples of gyros out there in restaurant land.

Lucky for me that I found Ayola (thanks to Yelp).  I can't profess to know a traditional or old world gyro, but I know fresh food and quality ingredients when I taste them.  Ayola's gyros are worth a bike ride across town.  The pita is soft, the meat itself perfectly seasoned, with heaps of tomatoes, onion, and romaine lettuce (I think it's romaine; in any case, it tasted like it was plucked from a field and chopped five minutes before I bit into it).

Most pleasing is the quality of the tzatziki.  Made with greek yogurt (denser and more concentrated than the liquid-y yogurts you find mixed with fruit), it smears onto the gyro like soft cream cheese instead of running through it like cream.

As others have written, their french fries are terrific.  They surprised me with their flavor and crispiness.

Awesome stuff for a little hole in the wall surrounded by tons of lunchtime competition.  You keep your Chipotle; I'll take Ayola.
author: Andrew L.

description: Too bad they were out of the chicken shawarma or else I would've ordered the "Sparta Salad" which is a greek salad with roasted chicken (all white meat too).  I ended up getting a side of falafels and hummos. I especially liked how the hummos was served with warm pita bread like it just came out of the oven! The falafels were decent too.
author: Helen Y.

description: It's all about their pita bread. Soft and squishy and yum. There are a handful of places to get falafel or gyro sandwiches downtown. This is my favorite. Minus 1 star for cafeteria ambiance and the absence of meat roasting on a spike.
author: Aaron M.

description: Quick, affordable Greek food. Tasty hummus, gyro meat, and falafels. Tons of food for the price as well. Will come back regularly!
author: Timothy L.

description: For the price and neighborhood, you really get the falafel you seek. Chipotle (next door) is a better bet unless you're willing to travel for good food, which I suspect you aren't if you're evening considering Ayola. Good luck.
author: K S.

description:
Tasty food, reasonable price, and fast. The combo plate is good. There is not a ton of room to eat there so if you go think about a take out option but there are some spots if you want to sit. Falafel, gyros, all sorts of tasty food, and the combo plate lets you try them with great humus

enjoy!
author: Andrew W.

description: Tasty, quick, loved the spicy sauce, and a good deal at $6 for a 7'' falafel. I'll be back.
author: Lara M.

description: They are always really fast even in the lunch rush, and, as a vegetarian, the falafel wrap is a really great lunch!  They are also very nice and friendly.
author: Amy M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place - and I've tried - I've been here a few times now. But I keep finding that the wraps are boring and bland. Oh well, I guess Truly Med has spoiled me. 

PS: Ayola, please stop using that generic gyro meat - get some real rotisserie spindle action going... and maybe some more seating too.
author: Neil K.

description: The chicken gyro is what I had for lunch today. It was a good gyro. The pita was soft. The tzatziki was good. The chicken was a bit dry, but still had good flavor. You don't want the chicken to be super moist anyway. I'll try their regular gyro next time. I also got the hummus and pita bread, and the hummus was excellent. They give you a large serving too so I can take it home and continue to eat it with other stuff. Like this place for lunch!
author: Martina M.

description:
I stopped by last week for lunch because I've always seen it when I've gone to Chipotle and thought I would give it a try.  I was torn between the falafel and the gyro (because I really love both) but deciding on the falafel because I hadn't had it in a while and it just sounded good.

The service was friendly and super quick and the store was clean.  The falafel was really really good.  Cooked perfectly so it was still had that crunchy outside but was soft and perfect in the inside.  There was also a nice spicy sauce that went will with it.  The fries were really good too (not necessarily the nirvana some of the reviews claim) but they were crisp and well seasoned with a nice texture.  

Overall, a great lunch spot.  I can't wait to try their gyro next time.
author: Philip D.

description: I used to LOVE this place.  It was by my old office and I could eat this every week.  I changed jobs and don't work close by but I met some old co-workers for lunch and was super excited to hit up a chicken shawarma.  I was disappointed to find out they changed their hot sauce!!!  That was a huge reason why I loved their food so much- def not as good anymore :(
author: Jessica C.

description: catered their food for an office event and it was delicious.  Super reasonably priced and they arrived on time.  We ordered the gyro platter and app. platter I believe.  recommend.
author: Gina I.

description:
Yes, the fries are awesome - if this review was solely for the fries, it'd be 5 stars all the way. Don't leave Ayola without 'em -- you'll be seriously missing out on some piping hot, french-fried goodness. 

My standard lunch choice is the Greek salad wrap, and I've also had the schwarma, both of which are yum. I've had the spanikopita a couple of times; it was definitely good but the second time was served a bit cold. 

Service is fast and friendly, just the way I like it.  Minus one star because I am not a fan of the hummus. I'm not sure what they're doing wrong, but I love hummus, and I literally could not swallow more than two pita-dipped bites of Ayola's. No worries, though, because I'm more than satisfied with my wrap and fries.
author: Marisa F.

description:
Indeed yummy!!!

I had the small gyro combo that comes with a 7in. gyro, fries, and a can of soda for under $9.  I've just waddled back to my office stuffed with that yumminess.  

They serve amazingly quick for the busy lunch crowd.

Not giving them 5 stars because there's VERY limited seating available.  And in SF, it's too cold to squat somewhere outside...
author: Janet L.

description:
YOU MUST TRY THE SAUCE!!!

Gyros, fries (and sauce) are all excellent and reasonably priced for SoMA.

TRY THE SAUCE!!!

Try it. Srsly.
author: Brian D.

description:
This is great, fast Greek at a fantastic price point!  I have tried several different things on the menu, and all have been scrumptious!

I highly recommend the Greek Salad wrap. And I am still fantasizing about their tzatziki too!

YUM!!!
author: alli h.

description:
I heart you, Ayola! Definitely a SOMA lunchtime staple...

I'm gonna try and be as "useful" as possible here: Ayola is a small joint and just PACKED at lunch (it also gets super hot in derrr), so I recommend trying to avoid peak lunch hour. If you must go around noon have no fear - they're pretty quick, it's just kind of a clusterfuck. (Can u say the f word on Yelp? I forget.) The platters are delish, the falafel is... disappointing. The chicken shwarma is my favorite and i find it hard to get anything else most of the time. The smaller size (7") is definitely big enough, especially if you get fries, which you must. Sweet jesus, the fries are incredible. They taste like meat. Meat fries. Finally, condiments are key: 1 part ketchup 1 part Sriracha. You got it, kids.
author: Stephanie P.

description: A nice quick choice for lunch in SoMa. Definitely the standout is their fries. I have no idea how they do it, but they have the best fries out of my lunch standbys. A 7" gyros and fries is about $8, which is a little on the steep side when you figure that it's competing with a $5 meal from Mehfil for my lunch dollars, but Ayola is super-fast. And, oh gods, those fries. Nom nom!
author: James B.

description: A cute little store.. their gyros and falafels are delicious! So flavorful. Not too expensive considering the portion size. A solid place to eat, something different and unique. Next time, I'll come and try their fries...
author: Tammy K.

description:
This place has solid falafel that is crispy and salty, decent creamy hummus, yummy dolmas, good eggplant mushy stuff (name?)*I thought this wasn't the same as babaghanoush, but apparently it is*, good tabouli and really delicious fries (as everyone and their dog has mentioned). 

To top that all that off, they're nice to veggie peeps. Every time I've asked whether something is vegan, they've been nice and easily able to answer my questions. Furthermore, I was a total tardface today when I ordered the falafel platter instead of my usual falafel wrap and forgot to ask if it came with any dairy besides the yogurt stuff (which they were replacing with extra hummus). It came with cheese sprinkled all over the salad and eggplant. I asked the girl behind the counter if she could replace it, and she was very nice and got me a new one sans cheese very quickly. That is good customer service! I think they deserve an extra half star for being so nice to me, even though I should have asked in the first place. Oh, and I almost forgot, their hot sauce is awesome!
author: Jeani H.

description: On first bite the chicken shawarma brought back memories of the long-forgotten (to me) taco-bell gordita. Granted, the chicken was recognizable as such, and the lettuce was in good shape, but it was a struggle to get through this late lunch even with the [mediocre] hot sauce taking front-row.
author: Gregory S.

description:
Had a gyro craving.  Went here today to try it out because I've walked by it so many times in the past.  The folks here were real nice and friendly and they got me my order real quick (maybe also because I beat the lunch rush by, oh, five minutes?)  The gyro was a good size with fresh veggies and dressing, not too sour but still I have had better.  It filled me up, though, which was nice.  The fries were good too, and my combo meal came with a can of soda for a decent $8 and change.  I want to go back and try their falafel.  Maybe I'll add a star to my review if I like it!

This is a good workday lunch place to hit up if you're near the area.
author: Eileen P.

description:
So far, best gyros I've found in San Francisco! It's a little place, and if you're looking to sit down there, you'd best visit during off hours. From 11:00am until 1:00 pm, there is a line of business types trying to order. 

The fries are always a little too hot, but they are fabulous! And I don't use the -f- word in vain. 

This is real traditional Greek food, dolmas and everything, although I'm sure the folks running it are not Greek. They are not American either, so as a few other reviewers have said, the guys are a little forward, but that is how it is everywhere not American.
author: Peter W.

description: I love Greek food! The lamb gyros is unbeatable here at Ayola, especially with their special red spicy sauce. After a lamb gyro and fries I pretty much roll myself back to my office because it is so big and filling. I think I spent about $8 or $9 on this lunch, and it is worth every penny!
author: Casi C.

description: Gyro was just really meh. Fries were good though and the wait is quick, even during lunch hour.
author: Nicole C.

description: This place is a great spot to grab a gyro or falafel in a hurry. Literally a hole in the wall type restaurant, the food is amazing and the staff is nice. The prices are a little up there, but the quality of the food and the proportions you get are decent.
author: Jason H.

description: Gyros Combo Deal (includes Kronos gyro, soda, and fries): Maybe I just can't taste the differences between gyros, but this just tasted regular to me. The fries weren't that great either. It was definitely over-hyped.
author: Vera W.

description: Great lunch spot in SOMA: reasonably priced, quick, and they take credit card. I've been a gyro customer here for a while, but it was the falafel today that inspired me to write a review.
author: Adam D.

description: This place is a great mid afternoon find for the lunch crowd. The people are nice and the service is fast, although you do have to jockey for position int he line as the numbers and gyros fly over the counter. But all in all, its great, and the price? Its the only place in the financial district you can get 9 inches of anything for 9 dollars.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description: Greek combo platter is awesome. It is only $8.71 and you can sample a little hummus, some salad, those grape leaf things...olives...are you catching on I am not Greek? Either way it is a tasty and different solution to lunch. Service is fast even with people spilling out of the front door. I have yet to try any of their other lunch options but I can only imagine they are just as tasty. Good news - they take credit cards - unlike most places I frequent these days.
author: Jessica P.

description:
I just tried the 9" falafel (say that 10 times fast) and was quite satisfied indeed.  I was glad I went for the 9" over the 7" for the extra buck, as that by itself was the perfect size lunch.

As people have said, it's an efficient operation, so it's fast and convenient when you're looking for that fix.
author: Brad P.

description:
You like-ah the juice, eh?

Tasty gyros, shawarmas and fries. Decent prices and close to the office. And seriously spicy hot sauce. Everything is better with hot sauce.

I get you more juice.
author: Aaron V.

description:
Since I now work near this other location of the famed Ayola, I had to try it on my lunch break the other day.

I came a little after 1:30, so there was no lunch crush as there usually is earlier in the day. Decided to order the 7 in. Chicken Shwarma this time instead of the usual gyro, still cheap and only cost $5.95. Came filled w/juicy chicken, tadziki, and the Ayola "secret" hot sauce. Yum yum gimmie some! Inhaled it all within minutes b/c I was so hungry and it was delicious too! If you noticed that I ordered it w/o all the "distractions" aka veggies b/c it allows them to add filler and cut back on the meat experience. If you want satisfaction, then follow my lead when coming to this place.

Like Gen. MacArthur once said; "I shall return"!
author: Gary T.

description:
You know those days when all you've eaten for breakfast was a bowl of non-filling cereal, which you've fooled yourself into thinking was a great and healthy breakfast?  That was me on Friday.  I left my house feeling fine, only to feel the dragging, pangs of hunger pains a mere three hours later.  Luckily Ayola is very close to my school library and I could run in and hastily tell the cashier "One value meal please. (Before my stomach discovers there's edible organs right next to it and starts devouring them...please...)"  Of course, that last part was under my breath, I want FOOD not quizzical stares.  

So I got my gyro, my fries and my sunkist, I sat down, tried and fry and oh, oh, OH.  They're very good, yet, they were hot, and I burned the roof of my mouth repeatedly, but they were the perfect fry consistancy, crunchy on the outside, soft on on the inside, and piping hot.  The gyro was good too, but I kept going back to the fries.  Unfortunately I (naturally), in my overexuberance to fill my belly, overate, so I left mentally clutching my stomach (no need for quizzical stares out here too) and took a nice long walk to digest it.  very nice experience, will come back again.
author: Asha H.

description: Tried the falafel sandwich - although the falafel was very fresh and crisp, the sandwich wasn't all that great. Even though there was a long line, their service was pretty fast. Not the best mediterranean place I have been to, but not bad at all.
author: Tangerinegate A.

description: Great chicken gyros! Super speedy food, nice service and cheap to boot. A great take-out lunch spot!
author: Cristina P.

description:
The average score for this place is pretty accurate, I think.  3.5...but I'm gonna round up because I frequent this place...well, frequently lol.  

I've had the gyro, the shawarma, and the falafel.  They've all been pretty solid meals.  Plenty of meat, served hot, and they give you an option of 7" or 9" for the days you're feeling a little more hungry.  I'm not a falafel expert, but their falafel is tasty.  

What I don't understand is the girls at the counter will ask if you want it spicy, and everytime I say "hell yahhh I want it spicy!".....but....I find myself having to add hot sauce from their condiment bar because it's hardly spicy at all!  Weird....whatever, I don't mind adding my own spiciness, as long as they keep that condiment counter stacked.  

Great Mediterrenean for the area, and for the price.
author: Winst D.

description:
My first experience was at their Union Square location, and this shop is equally good. Very fast service and decent prices for what you get. A big honking gyro dripping with goodness. Love love love the fries!

So far my best option for lunch if I want something better than pizza or a sub sandwich.
author: Jamila C.

description: I go there at least twice a week since my classes are on that street, the food is fast, tasty, perfect place to go when I don't have time to eat, the gyro is the best!
author: Shan L.

description:
Ayola is a fantastic SOMA/FiDi lunch spot.  While I haven't been too adventurous with the menu, I can say with confidence that their Chicken Shawarma is easily a weekly meal.  The chickens are remarkably tender - I don't understand how they get it *that* good *that* consistently.  I'm also a little confused how it's shawarma because it's basically in cubes, and I thought shawarma got shaved off a skewer.  But I digress...

Their tzatziki is also fantastic - thicker than some places, but really delicious and well balanced.  Good pita bread too.
author: Oliver N.

description:
Hands down, best Gyro I've ever had. Food is served fast, fresh, and hot. Meat is tasty, veggies are crisp, and bread is soft and heated in a tortilla steamer. 

I go to this place once a week now for lunch. I love it. Highly recommend.
author: Cyrus A.

description:
I made the mistake of ordering the Chicken Shawarma. It was really bland, and I don't think it was real shawarma. It looked like cubed chicken breast.

Whataver, their lamb and chicken gyros are good, and the service is fast. I just won't order the shawarma again!
author: Dave M.

description:
I pop in here every once and a while, mostly out of convenience than anything else.  It's a bit on the pricey side, usually spend a little over 8 bucks for a Gyro, they jack up the beverage prices, but overall it hits the spot.

The kind of sexy, exotic lady at the counter, is always friendly, but the best part about this place is the hot sauce they make in the ketchup bottle, don't leave without grabbing a side of that full-flavored goodness!
author: Tyler D.

description:
Great for a quick but different lunch. The greek salads are awesome. Even better if you get a falafel on it.

The greek salad in a wrap with falafel is amazing, albeit not the most caloric-friendly option. (See above for a kind of light lunch.)

Hummus is yummy and the pita is just right.

I love this place.
author: stacy o.

description: Delicious, fresh, and fast.  A perfect weekly lunch break meal at an affordable price.  I recommend the Chicken Gyro.
author: Kerry Z.

description:
UPDATE: I tried their fries the other day, and mmmmmmm. The automatically salt AND pepper them -- yum!

I was looking for a little something extra to spice up my salad, and just went out walking to see if anything struck my fancy. I wanted something a little carb-y, but not necessarily a whole damn sandwich. Oooooh, falafel... perfect.

Though small, the interior is bright and colorful, and not so shady-looking as Flames a few blocks over. I got a side order of falafel (4 balls and yogurt sauce) and pita, and it was EXACTLY what I needed. The falafel was super delicious -- crispy and firm on the outside, but not too dry on the inside. And the pita.... ohhhhhhhhhhh. Warm, soft, fluffy... obviously no comparison to store-bought pita, but REALLY -- NO comparison with store-bought pita.

Looking forward to trying a gyro or chicken schwarma in the future...

P.S. Side of falafel and pita cost me $4.50 including tax, which was a pretty decent "extra" to my regular lunch, since I couldn't finish it all anyway. And who knew re-heated falafel smells so much like fried chicken?
author: J C.

description:
I like to think of myself as a connaisseur of the sauce...condiments...you know.  I like 'em.  Ayola has a great hot sauce...it's not hot, per se...more "smokey"...yum.  Super yummy gyros and fries to die for.  The pita for the gyros is FAT and FLUFFY.  

Be prepared to wait...it's always crowded around lunch time...and its always hot as a heatwave in there, so ladies, bring the blot paper.  

Other than that...great place for lunch!
author: Susan L.

description: I was unfair before, and I apologize, dear sweet Ayola. just grabbed a super late lunch on a really stressful day and everyone was so nice, and the tabuleh salad is perfection. +1 star, and I'll never doubt you again my love.
author: Lauren G W.

description:
My coworkers and I visit Ayola once a week, which is in itself a testimony to how good the food is.  The place itself is a bit small, so be prepared to take your food to go on most occasions.

As for the food, they have an awesome chicken shawarma, and the fries are the BEST in town.  Oh yeah, and the gyros are good too.  I'll give their falafels a try next.

After all this time, I never knew I liked Greek food until now.  :)
author: Marlon E.

description: Great quick lunch spot. Go early if you want to eat there though because there are only about six chairs. I always get the Falafel Pita Sandwich, 9 inch. Definitely enough for a filling meal. If you want fries too, you should probably stick with the 7 inch sandwich, which they have as a combo meal with a drink. Very quick, friendly service! Try the hot sauce too!
author: Kimberly K.

description: What a great find!   Seating inside is scarce is tough to come by , but the food is outstanding!
author: Randy k.

description: Solid.  Excellent gyros, greek salad, and falafel.
author: Melinda C.

description:
Tasty and hot lamb gyro. I ordered the eggplant side dish. It was cold and so not-to-tasty. It could work  as a warm dish, or a cold dish but with spicier ingredients -- as it is, the flavor doesn't come through.
 They also have several salads, hummus, you get the idea. Price: $10.50 for gyro and the eggplant side dish.

I'll come back for the gyros and the salads.

Service was helpful and quick. There's little seating, so come here for lunch time takeout.

Update: I've now tried the falafel (dry and overdone) and the chicken schwarma gyro (good). The gyros have been consistently tasty and hot.
author: Pat T.

description:
Not too shabby. 

Four stars for the fries, three stars for the falafel, which was not fresh and moist enough for my taste. 

I got spoiled working next to Mamoun's in Greenwich Village. No one on the West Coast comes close.
author: Whit P.

description: Love their gyros but you can skip the fries.  The large gyro is really filling unless you pack on the handles.  The fries on the other hand were great but not spectacular. I love their salt and pepper seasoning that goes along with their fries but what goes best on that deliciously large gyro is their spicy sauce.  Gotta love Greek food!! =)
author: Alexander H.

description: Have had the gyro and fries here a few times.  Price is very reasonable, gyro was good, and the fries weren't bad, although too salty.  Not my favorite gyro place, but it's pretty easy to park which is a plus for me - just be quick, so you don't get ticketed.
author: T.J. H.

description: Not only is the food good, but they're so willing to taylor it to your likes too! I rarely get excited before food, but here it almost feels like christmas!
author: Victor-Antonio T.

description: I used to work a block away, and I miss it so much!  The falafel in Hayes Valley just does not compare.  Ayola's wraps are perfectly constructed, the falafel is crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside, just the right amount of spice, not drenched in tahini, but not bone dry.  And the fries--oh, the fries!  Yum yum yum.  Everything is cheap and delicious, even the baklava.
author: sara b.

description: We stopped in today for a quick lunch.  Both of our chicken gyros were ready in lightning fast speed which we appreciated since we were in a rush.  Flavorful and inexpensive-will definitely re visit again!
author: Lizete S.

description: For a quick, tasty bite you can never go wrong at Ayola.  While I've only had the lamb gyro, the veges, french fries and flat bread that accompany it really make this place one of my favorite spots to eat during lunch.  The service is always quick, the prices reasonable and most importantly, will always leave you satisfied
author: Natan O.

description: Great place for lunch.  I usually get the Sparta salad: lots of oven fresh chicken, ripe tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and balsamic dressing.  Be sure to pick up some of their cayenne spicy sauce to dip the chicken in.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
really really good chicken schwarma and really really good hummus.  

but the real reason i'm yelping about ayola is because they have the 2nd best french fries in san francisco.  yes, the 2nd best (please see photo)!!  these fries are GREAT. who would have guessed a greek place having great french fries??? i do not know.  and i'm definitely a FRY person.  they are jam packed full of potato and fried til they are golden brown... not too crispy, definitely not "soft" and whatever kind of oil they are cooked up in isn't too bland nor greasy tasting... it is PERFECT and they season them lightly with a little salt and pepper.  MMMM!!! yummy french fries... please go try them!!!
author: KL S.

description:
I didn't even know this place had a name till right now typing in gyro and soma,wow !

I grubbed on this noise yesterday on my way to Muni. The service is slow as molasses, but well worth the wait.

I try not to eat meat much anymore but I pass this place every week and it always smells so good, so I decided to get my gyro on.

Got the combo that comes with fries and a drink,it was on the pricey side(like almost 9 bucks) but can we just talk about these fries? I am not a fry fan by any means, i actually am borderline frightened by those greasy fuckers, but these fries were seasoned amazing chunky potato goodness. I would marry them if they asked,sincerely. The gyro was tasty ,standard gyro slabby meaty tzatziki yum yums.

this place is the jam for the most part.
author: Lauren V.

description:
I would give it the full 5 if there was more seating but this place is awesome. The fries, the falafel, tahini, greek salad, pita, and the fries. I think they must sprinkle the fries with crack or something because I seriously could eat those delectable fried taters all freakin day. 

The combo platter, chicken schwarma, and value meals are always a safe bet. This place is efficient, fast, and delish. The only complaint I have is that the schwarma is rather messy despite the wrapping and requires multiple napkins. However, the value meal makes it so worth it and it's so tasty! I grab food here a few times a week.
author: Kristen R.

description: Had my first falafel here so I don't know if it was good/bad by comparison but it was delicious. I was stuffed by that 1 falafel order and couldn't even finish it. It's, for the most part, a sort of upgraded-fastfood. You're in and out, not really a restaurant. Nothing wrong with that, I just wanted to point it out. Nonetheless, it is good, cheap, and healthier than McDonalds (I'm assuming). The only thing is when I got home I ended up throwing it all up and felt queasy.. Granted this could be because I may have already been sick, I overate but it could also be from tainted food. Who knows, all I know is my taste buds were satisfied... well, atleast while the falafels were going down -not up.
author: Trisha L.

description: This place is mediocre.  Chicken shawarma was not grilled, the tahini was runny, the hot sauce was weak and the pita was not toasted or warm.  People that like this place do not know what Greek food should be.
author: John R.

description: I thought this was going to be just a crappy hole-in-the-wall greek place but to this day it is still my favorite greek restaurant. yaay!
author: Bam H.

description: Stopped in on three occasions to take out a sandwich, first two were chicken shawarma and third time was chicken gyro.  Second sandwich tasted good but was lucky enough not to bite down too hard on a sharp piece of chicken bone lodged inside the chicken.  The piece of bone was a good half inch long with a sharp point, not something that you would want to swallow, luckily I didn't.  On my third visit, about half way into my chicken gyro, I noticed a small brown bug moving across the top of the pita bread.  Looked like one of those very tiny bugs that can be found on cutting boards; not sure where it might have come from but was extremely tiny and clearly visible moving over the white pita and under the fluorescent lighting above my desk.  I decided not to wait for a third strike and won't be returning.
author: Andy V.

description:
After hearing all the wonderful things written about this place, below, I figured I could not go wrong. I figured if nothing else, it was next door to where I work. 

Boy was I wrong, the Chicken Shawarma was okay at best. And the Bakalava was BAD!! 

Only good thing was that I got my food in 3 minutes or less.
author: Simmy S.

description: YUM YUM YUM! this is one of my favorite lunch spots when I'm craving something other than asian food or a sandwich. Everything I've had here has been delicious (combo platter, gyros platter, chicken gyros). The service is also very very quick!
author: Krystel M.

description: I always get the Gyro combo here. The gyro is not the tastiest one I have ever eaten but it gets the job done. The fries here are to DIE for. Last but not least, they are FAST. Get in, get out quick. VERY limited seating inside.
author: Eric P.

description: Ayola has great prices, decent portions, and the staff there is very friendly!  I'm no Greek/Mediterranean food expert but I love the food here and would recommend this place to anyone!  It would be nice if there was more seating but that's not really that big of an issue in my opinion.
author: Tracy N.

description:
This is my go-to lunch spot when I don't have anything else in mind.  I would say I eat here at least once a week.  The combo platter is excellent and big.  It comes with hummus, pita, 2 falafels, 2 domas, a greek salad, an eggplant salad, and a yogurt sauce.  It's very filling and tasty!

Other days I get the falafel wrap and fries.  Ayola's fries are AMAZING.  Every fry is perfectly seasoned with pepper.  Delish!

My only critique is the falafel.  It's good most days, and great sometimes.  It's just inconsistent--some days it's too dry.
author: Daren D.

description:
The standard by which takeout greek lunch food should be measured. 

Their Troy Salad (gyro meat on a greek salad with olives and amazing dressing) is to die for, and the gyros rock too. Super speedy, friendly, and though it's not the cheapest lunch, it's worth every penny.

Way high on the "places I'm missing since moving from 2nd near Market to 2nd near the ballpark" list.
author: Gilman T.

description:
Ok, the food here is very de-lish!! Hands down, the fries kick ass, the gyros kicks double ass.
For those who say cop-out stuff like, "The food here isn't bad but I won't tell you what I put in my gut"...ugh newsflash! If you have a GUT, it's not going to be because of this place!

Fine, this eatery isn't a place for those who are trying to be supermodels. But hey, I work out 4-5x a week so this is a great and tasteful treat for me like 1 or 2x a month. So if you have problems about the "grease" or lack of "health-consciousness"... stick with making your own salads and concocting your own dressing to tighten up on the calories. Just don't eat out, and then you won't have problems with your "gut"
author: K K.

description: I really liked the falafel, I'm surprised to see others did not. I wasn't as impressed with the chicken gyro. No matter what you get, make sure to get the delicious hot sauce.
author: Adam B.

description: Extremely disappointing experience given Yelp hype! It could be my mistake, but take note: do not order the chicken shawarma and ask for mild! It was flavorless. As a crowning insult, it wasn't even filling!
author: Angela X.

description: How did I go 23 years of life without eating a gyro? I'm not sure, I'm a little ashamed. Anywho, so I work on 2nd and Mission and was feenin' for something new to eat and yelped some stuff and stumbled upon Ayola. So I head over, reminding myself to remember to say gyro correctly (i didn't want them to know i was a rookie) and ordered the gyro value meal i think it was called? i got the large btw. so it was a large gyro, and fries and a drink. it was AWESOME! it was a little pricey, around 8 or 9 bucks but it was definitely worth it, i will be back!
author: Sandi V.

description:
I stopped in this place on my way back from the passport office.  I love falafel and thought I'd give it a try.  WOW!  The falafel sandwich was nice and warm, filled with fresh, crisp romaine lettuce (not the god-awful iceberg crap that many places use),  red ripe tomatoes, great tahini and falafel that was cooked and seasoned to perfection.

The sandwich was messy- and that's a sign of a great falafel sandwich.  The pita was soft and fresh and they provided a very tasty hot sauce which I added more of from the counter.  I have eaten many falafel sandwiches in my time and this is definitely the best one I can remember eating.  I live in Oakland but if I'm hungry enough and craving falafel, I can see myself BARTing over from time to time to satisfy my craving.

Great, great job guys!

-cj
author: Christopher J.

description: MY favorite is the beef gyro. This is probably the best gyro I've had in the Bay actually. You have to have it with the red sauce on the side :) It's better to get the food to-go because it's a really small place and there are only two or three tables.
author: Zeenat U.

description: This place is terrible. I have never had such bland Greek food. The chicken tastes like it comes out of a can.
author: Terse T.

description:
Ayola served up one of the best chicken shawarmas I've ever had. I wasn't that hungry, so the two size options (I went small) was much appreciated. But it seemed far from small - tons of chicken, heaps of lettuce and tomatoes, and in a nice gesture, hummus offered as an alternative when I asked for no yogurt sauce.

Very filling, very reasonably priced, very friendly service, and most importantly, very delicious.
author: Jason B.

description: The chicken shawerma was good enough. Five inches of good enoughness. Kind of like a chicken taco, except it's a pita. And they're pretty [bleep]ing quick.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I don't get why people seem to be raving about this place?

I work a hop, skip, and a jump away from this restaurant, so I come here every so often for lunch and generally have one of the Greek sandwiches (gyros or schawarma). They're fine and all, though the schawarma sandwiches are drenched in a watery sauce that will spill on you if you're not careful (and will also leak through your bag if you're getting take out). At $7-ish for a large sandwich, this place isn't an amazing value either. 

I also don't understand the raving about the french fries. The salt and pepper is nice, but they don't always consistently turn out as perfectly as some of these reviews claim.

If you happen to be working or walking by the Academy of Art, you have a lot of lunch choices, and while it's not bad, it's not amazing either. I'll stop by there every once in a while for a change of pace, but that New Montgomery corridor alone has a Chipotle, a cafe that serves sandwiches, Lee's (which has sandwiches and a Chinese food buffet and salad bar), Jamba Juice, and The Sentinel sandwiches just up the street.
author: A P.

description:
Good deal.   The pita bread is hot and soft, the hommos thick and flavorful.  The gyro meat is a mite suspect, in all honesty, but you cannot -- CANNOT -- go wrong with the Sparta salad.  Ab-fab.  Sometimes, at night, I dream about it.  

If you must go between 12-1, it can get a little crowded, but the line goes very quickly.
author: Samantha R.

description: Great food, speedy and good service. Perfect for a quick take out. Prices are reasonable too.
author: Mouncef B.

description: Archie R. and I were downtown today, at lunch time, at the Yelp office to pick up our Elite t-shirts!  So If you have been down there you are well aware that the meters on Mission are 30mins MAX!  So our dilemma was, were could we get something good to eat in less then 30 mins??  Then answer my friend was blowing in the wind...no it wasn't but just like a blind squirrel finds a nut every now and then, Archie and I stumbled on to "Ayola"!  This place is so small, it's not even a hole in the wall place...It's more like a hole in a closet place!  To our surprise the food was grub'n and every inexpensive.  So if you like Greek/Mediterranean food and need it quick, this is the place for you!!  Yummy....is that Greek??
author: Art S.

description: After meeting some cool Yelp people (and the deceptively spicy Jess T) we decided to have lunch here.  Since I am watching my "girlish" figure I went with a chicken salad.  Good stuff.  Not a lot of room to sit and eat but hey, it's the city.  The hummus...pretty darn good.
author: Archie R.

description: Love this place! Quick and so tasty! My favorite is the Sparta Salad. I only have a 30 min lunch so I like to come here for lunch. Always fresh and the way the chicken is prepared is amazing! Addicted!
author: Virginia H.

description: This is the best gyro that I've found in San Francisco.  The pita bread is warm and soft.  The meat is of good quality and the tzaziki(sp?) sauce is good and they give you plenty of it.  On a nice day you can walk around the corner and eat one in Yerba Buena.
author: matt c.

description:
After wandering around (it seemed like) half of San Francisco looking for something to peak my interest I spotted a picture of kebab meat and I was drawn in instantly. i am forever in search of something to rival the kebab's you get after the pubs close in England and today I came close.

Would have liked to see the spittle cooking the meat, but I couldn't and reading here I don't think they have one. The pita was okay and the chilli garlic sauce in the bottle made the thing come together a little more. the meat was sliced way to thick to be truly enjoyable but an all round half decent effort. What ever the peppery salt places like this use on fries I like it a lot - that nearly gave them an extra star.

By the way I saw a specail on how they make kebab's in england, the stuff they but in is actually decent meat and not the scary stuff you'd expect - not sure what the 'ingredients are over here.

I'll continue the search for a decent after the pub kebab......
author: rob T.

description: Fast, cheap and good gyros. Get the 7" gyro special w fries, it's like $8. They put pepper on the fries. Mmmm.
author: Geoff G.

description: I saw Brad P. across the conference table munching on a juicy lookin' shwarma and he told me it came from Ayola just up the street.  Never one to pass on a shwarma (or any mediterranean food for that matter), I went in search of my own.  Much to my sadness, I noticed that they didn't have lamb shwarma (Brad had gotten chicken) on the menu, and when I asked, the confused looking woman behind the counter said "Um...we have lamb gyro...same thing."  False.  And not a good sign.  I ordered it anyway and it was perfectly serviceable, but didn't blow me away by any means.  A pretty good, cheap lunch option in the neighborhood, but here's hoping there's better shwarma around.
author: Sam P.

description: This is a good lunch spot since they have delicious frys. They use an AutoFry machine which makes each fry just right. http://www.autofry.com/
author: Tim M.

description: I was hungry for lunch and had 10 minutes, so I walked a block to Ayola and ordered the (chicken) Gyro Platter- which includes chicken, a greek salad, pita bread, hummus and yogurt sauce for $8 something. The food was fresh (salad was good as was the tender chicken), hummus was too oily for my taste. If you want a quick, authentic greek meal and you happen to be on New Montgomery and Mission for lunch, I recommend this place. I also really liked the hot sauce that you can pump into little sauce containers- it made my lunch.
author: Sonia S.

description: Good tasting food, but pricey and in small portions. The fries are the star of the show here.
author: Tim R.

description: It's close to my office not overly expensive and pretty quick.  However, I think they could improve their Shawarma by grilling it.  It would be worth a few extra minutes wait.  Perhaps they should consider this an option and charge for it?
author: Scott P.

description: A decent chicken shawerma.  I like the pita bread, nice and soft, just like you'd get in NY.  Meat was just scooped out of a bin, not reheated on a skillet or something.  Didn't see the Spit-O-Meat in the front either, so I couldn't see how the meat was prepared.   I would give it 4 stars, but it was $6.50+tax for the shawerma....  that's almost the same price as truly med, so by that standard, I can't.  Will be going back to try out the Gyros and such, and will update later.
author: Fong L.

description:
Fantastic, fast, delicious Greek(ish) food, almost certainly to go. I say Greekish because it's a fast food restaurant, so it's as Greek as Chipotle is Mexican. But a delicious hint of a foreign land I highly recommend. 

The food is hot and fresh, and wait time is maximum 5 minutes, even at lunch rush. After eating there half a dozen times, I decided to try the calamari salad (I was a little wary of eating squid from a small cafe), and was not disappointed. The squid is fresh and well seasoned, so just imagine how good the more popular foods are.

Gyros are top notch, and remind me of the delicious donairs of Canada. The meat is juicy, not tough, and not overly salty. When I leave my office for lunch, this is the first thing I smell, and most of the time I don't make it past their doors. 

Like a lot of eateries in downtown San Francisco, this place is packed during lunch time, with seating for maybe 10 people, while about another 20 wait in line or for their food. Not a place to expect to sit and enjoy peaceful lunches. 

A couple negatives: If you get something with a salad as a side, you get two olives in it (every time, two olives). More olives would be nice. On occasion, the pita triangles are a bit stale around the edges, I think they might give the day-olds as complementary additions to meals to get rid of them. It's also a little pricey, considering the quantity of food you can get for less money right next door at Chipotle or Lee's. You'll be spending a dollar extra.
author: Paul H.

description: Best fries in San Francisco.  Haven't tried anything else but the fries are unbelievably delicious.
author: Mack D.

description: Quite busy at lunchtime, and not that much seating, but still quite a prompt turnaround to get your food. The windows facing the street are fully of pretty people, or pretty interesting people. The gyros ain't half bad, neither. And the fries, well, I didn't even know the Greeks could make 'em like this. All around, not a bad lunch choice at all.
author: Orin Z.

description: Great little spot with excellent falafel and gyros.  Friendly staff and fast service make this a regular spot for me.
author: Justin S.

description:
uh, phenomenal. sadly, but gladly, i eat here 3-4 times a week at lunch. perfect meat-to-sauce ratio.

7" gyro + vitamin water = $8.41
author: peter m.

description: Love the FOB fries here. And by FOB fries, I mean the thick crunchy fries that only FOBs can perfect. :-) Yummy mediterranean grub. The shawarmas are pretty good, if a little on the bland side. Make sure you get the hot sauce with it, its not that hot but it punches up the taste. We order their catering for work and when it's all laid out, it's perfect in combination with everything else.
author: Hanan H.

description: A solid lunch spot. The fries are perhaps the best in the area (They come salt & peppered) . Their gyros are only decent. The smaller one usually has a better bread. I also like this spot for the special hot sauce that they have :)
author: Phong D.

description:
Ahhh, yumm... Gyros!

This place can be sooooo good! I love everything here, and its not a bad price for downtown/fidi. 

So why 3 stars? Consistency. Sometimes they hit a home run, sometimes...its just boring. 

They would have 4 stars from me for good food at a decent price, and fast service. But they lost a star for a lack of consistency.
author: Josh M.

description: I guess I haven't had enough gyros before, but shouldn't a chicken gyro have pieces of chicken in it, not slices of strange meat that looks nothing like chicken? They were out of the chicken shwarma so the guy suggested that I get the gyro. I think I should have stuck with something familiar like the falafel sandwich. Although the ingredients are fresh, I can't help but wonder what this mystery meat I'm biting into is while I eat. The staff was certainly friendly, but the decor needed some help. It looked like they kidnapped the Q-cup staff one day and decided to post up. Same fixtures, same paint, even the same bamboo plant in a Q-cup drink cup in the corner next to the bottles of Sriracha hot sauce (which we also noticed they used in the Med sandwiches?!?!). Props for the Yelp advertising though (which was also sitting next to the Sriracha).
author: Connie C.

description: I went here for lunch today, ordered the Gyro meal, which includes Gyro, fries and a canned soda. The food was served to me very quickly, but when I got back to the office, I noticed they gave me the wrong meal. I was bummed about that, but on the good side, the chicken gyro they gave me was pretty tasty. If it wasnt for the wrong order, I would give this place a 4 out of 5 stars. I'll go back again because I am pretty sure this error wont happen again.
author: Jason B.

description: Was not a big fan after going a few years ago. Have returned recently and the food seems to be drastically more delicious. It's now on my once-a-week lunch places.
author: Derek B.

description: If you're fiending for a great lunch spot to hit that won't break the bank I highly suggest this place.  Theres not much space to sit and lounge but they're cheap, quick, and YUM-O!  My personal fav. is the lamb gyro with fries which are simply delish....all of which seem to always put me straight to sleep once I get back to my desk.  I'm at home sick today but would almost rather be at work 'cuz who wants to spend a free day with the flu, right? And Ayola would definately beat my current diet of Ibuprofen, Emergen-c and tomato soup any day.
author: laura q.

description: What a pleasant surprise to find this little hole in the wall eatery. My falafel sandwich was perfect. The greens were fresh, the falafel was crisp on the outside and the pita was nice and soft. Will definitely come back.
author: Robert C.

description: I had an awesome chicken shwarma here.  The fries were awesome too.  I'm still finding new places to eat around Yelp HQ, and seeing as how this is on Nish's list I guess I am correct in giving it a good rating.    Very convenient, you can get in and out in under 5 mins with your order from the time you hit the door to the time you leave.  No real seating inside so its kind of a to-go place, so its awesome if you are looking for something to eat back at your desk.
author: Todd F.

description: I get incredibly elated when I know I'm going to Ayola's for lunch.  When I manage to get a day off, I make it a point to be near downtown so I can meet my friend for lunch here.  He knows this too (right, D?).  Anyway, this place has fantastic gyros.  The meat is tender, juicy, and flavorful and they don't hold back on the tzatziki sauce.  The result is bliss sandwiched in the softest pita bread I've ever had.  It's messy, but well worth it!
author: Christine S.

description: I actually work upstairs from this place . . . thus everytime I go out for lunch I have to successfully escape from tastiness emanating from this place.  I pretty much stick with their shawerma or falafel and both are more than decent.  Their 7-inchers are a little more than 5 bucks, and are usually the perfect amount of food for me.  If I'm super hungry, I usually head down to Baladie though . . . more mass, better prices, and at least comparable quality.  But alas, I'm a lazy ass and often walk out my front door, take two steps, turn right and end up at Ayola somehow.
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
Good for quick take-out, don't expect to eat there since there are only a few tables.  The lamb gyro is delicious - fresh lettuce (no iceberg)/tomatoes and good yogurt sauce.  This will definitely go into my lunch rotation.

Update - Falafel is pretty good - add some hot sauce.  Although, the lamb gyro is much better.
author: AngelaS F.

description:
hmm...kathy, you should probably broaden your horizons.  the shawerma there is off the freakin charts...most of the time, which is why it only gets four stars.

i also got a way kick ass salad from this place with like uh, some house kinda vinagrette dressing, bunch of walnuts, chicken, apple and feta cheese.  delicious.

great little place to grab lunch and go to yerba buena, the people that work there are nice, and the service is usually pretty fast, unless you managed to time your trip to coincide with the lunchtime rush they always get.

if you ever find yourself looking back and forth between this place and chipotle, you should probably be slapped around a little bit.  chipotle has nothing on this joint.
author: Coe S.

description: What a wonderful welcoming staff! Wish they had more places to sit otherwise I would have ate there. oh well, my falafel is just as damn good right in front of this here computer
author: Richard T.

description: Best gyros I've had by far. Tender succulent lamb, warm & soft pita bread, and garlicky yogurt sauce. Plus, inexpensive and quick. I usually get my order within a few minutes of ordering.
author: Richard Z.

description: This place was ok. I was excited to get some authentic gyro meat in SF. The chicken for the pita sandwich was just ok, kind of dry, though the tzaziki sauce was good and made up for it. I was underwhelmed by the entire experience. I probably won't return.
author: Camille H.

description: I'm so glad I vetoed Chipotle and Working Girls to check this place out. The small Chicken Shawarma sandwich is now my new lunch favorite.  It's slightly on the messy side, but for $7, it's worth it.  The hot sauce might make your next meeting slightly uncomfortable, but that's worth it too.  ;-)
author: Maulie D.

description: Good, generous salads at a decent price. i usually get the Greek salad with chicken. The line moves quickly and efficiently so don't let that deter you. The perfect lunch to eat at Yerba Buena on a nice day!
author: J L.

description: Oh those fries! Really they are the stuff that dreams are made of. Occasionally I find my self spacing out at work around 11am and suddenly craving the fries and falafel here. There is a reason this place gets so crowded at lunch time. The staff here is friendly and they work really quickly to make sure that everyone gets their lunch in a timely manner. Do yourself a favor and make sure to order the fries with whatever you order. Mmmmm, fries......(drool).
author: Dana H.

description: This place is amazing - the gyros and schwarma of course are great.  But be sure to get their fries - seasoned to perfection.  One of my favorite things to get for a snack is their homemade hummus.  It comes with their fresh, warm pita which is to die for!  Then I save the hummus for a week's worth of snacks.  You must go to this place!
author: Emma S.

description: This place is a total hole in the wall. I came here for lunch with Derek B. and wasn't all that impressed. $7ish for a gyro full of strangely textured chicken covered in messy sauce? Not so much. Didn't get the fries but I stole a few of his and they were damn good. Everything else? Overwhelmingly eh.
author: Lindsey S.
