description: This place is alright.  The Macedonian salad is pretty good and the gyros are quite adequate.  At the same time if it wasn't near my office I wouldn't make an attempt to go here.  The prices seem a little high as well, but it is a SF lunch place, that is par for the course.
author: Jared W.

description: Looked it up, hooked it up, and it was excellent!  It's a little hole in the wall place that serves great gyros.
author: Richard L.

description: I've never had a gyro before and was pleasantly surprised how good it was here. I noticed there were several places on this street offering gyros, but for some reason I just walked into this one. 7" was the right amount for me. I had their 4 pieces of falafel on the side which I never had either. They need to put their hot sauce in a bottle and sell that stuff. I would be a nice alternative to Tapatio.
author: Clodel G.

description: I don't know why it's taken me a year to roll into Ayola.  I guess I was subconsciously taking out my disappointment that the boba shop closed on this place (where else can i get boba in the New Montgomery corridor?).  Such foolishness only meant I missed the chance to have great mediterranean lunches in 2006.  But no more.  A new year, a new lease on lunch.  I had the combo plate today.  I got two lunches - one at 12:30, and one at 4 -  outta their delicious platter of salad, super fresh baba ghannouj, dolma, tzatziki, hummus, and falafel.  This platter was a good value at $8.50, but it was a little outsized for a single lunch, which is what I want most days.  I'd rather pay $5-6 for the right size.  Overall, great addition to the 'hood.
author: Laura T.

description: Oddly enough, they do actually have very tasty fries here...lunch was about $10 for a regular gyro, fries, and a bottled juice.  I must say service was quick and I did have a pretty satisfying lunch meal...
author: Jeff H.

description: First time and I am definitely a fan!  The place is small, the menu is small, and it's definitely an excellent quick stop for some fresh gyros.  My buddy said to get some fry's and good thing I listened to him this time.  I cleaned up my plate.  Great spot to know about.
author: Willie R.

description: Still the best. Hot lamb gyro strips with just the right amount of yogurt tomato and cucumber sauce in a fluffy pita wrap. Expertly wrapped in paper for take out back to the office and it never disappoints. Lately though they have skimped on the yogur -tahini sauce. More sauce!
author: Nan L.

description: I've only had the fries with the red sauce thats near the door and its the best combination ever! Wow. Love those fries.
author: S D.

description: If you love a good gyro that's not dripping in fat, this is the place.  Flavorful and delicious.  Quick too.
author: workingstiff f.

description: Sometimes things are about trade-offs. Ayola is FAST, friendly and serves up good food. There may be better lunch spots but if you need to satisfy your craving for med fare quickly and reasonable Ayola is the place for you. The hummus is decent and for a side it's only $3.99 and served with two pitas! Plenty to snack and if you are in the mood for something larger go for a Gyro or Falafel wrap for around $6.
author: Theresa T.

description: Tasty, fast, and always hits the spot. The hot sauce is pretty fab too. Small place, good for take out.
author: jennifer t.

description: YUMMY!!! Reminds me of the Gyros I use to get back in NY. Finally a decent Gyro place in SF. YEAH!!!
author: She R. A.

description: my office moved down to soma a month ago, and i'm still trying to explore all the lunch places... saw this place on yelp and decided to give it a try... first of all, it is a perfect place for quick lunch! I have to agree their fries is one of the best in town! I also had a falafel wrap, and I think the pita bread is great! With this price and the quick service... I'll have to give them a 4 stars!
author: Bee T.

description: So yummy!  I can't wait to go back and have a chicken gyro and fries!  I miss working downtown just so I could have lunch there everyday!  Also, their Troy Salad is super yummy!
author: Chiara M.

description: Satiating gyros at FiDi speed in SOMA. Residing somewhere between fast food and a hearty Greek meal, Ayola will stuff you, please you, and have you on your way in no time with seemingly little effort. The fries look good, the 7-inch is delightful, and the servers are friendly. Prices and portions are reasonable. Plan on taking out, though, since there's hardly any seating and it's too crowded to have a peaceful lunch break.
author: G. J.

description: Quick, tasty, and close to work, I imagine I will be grabbing some grub here pretty often. Not the best falafel, but in the top 20% I would say. It's hard being from the Detroit area, and moving to a relatively falafel-sparse area like SF. But this is pretty good.
author: Eric G.

description:
dear ayola,

you are my new favorite lunch spot when i work in the city. granted, i have yet to stray from your trusty falafel, but, really, why should i? it's delectable. and my friend tells me the lamb & beef gyro that i brought him for lunch today is also very good. if i ever give up this whole vegetarian facade, perhaps i'll test out your gyros, but i'm content for now. 

-d.

p.s. i love the woman with light hair at the registers; her sweetness makes up for all the pretentious hipsters i have to pass when i walk in front of the academy of art. so, treat her well.
author: D L.

description: I had the small gyro meal which was $8.20. Which was kind of expensive I thought. You get a canned soda and a bunch of fries. The Gyro was pretty good I thought but I'm not Greek. The fries came right out of the fryer and I burned my tongue on them. The meal was filling and I'll probably go again and try something different.
author: Christopher U.

description: Although this place is small, it makes up for it with fantastic fries, yummy chicken shawarma, and friendly service =) Got there 15 minutes before closing, but they were nice enough to let me and my friends sit and eat our food inside while they closed up shop (maybe they were being so kind because one of my friends is a regular and they know his face, but I like to think they really are that nice). I ordered the chicken shawarma meal - which left me with a full belly and a smile. Sadly I had to leave some of my fries uneaten - they really are as good as everyone says!
author: Rachelle A.

description: I'm hooked on their 7" lamb gyro for a quick and tasty lunch!  I haven't tried the fries because this gyro a la carte is  perfectly-sized for lunch.  The counter staff are always friendly, too!
author: Scott S.

description: Awesome for the price. I love the chicken schwarma sandwiches. It's definitely a go-to lunch spot for everyone in my office.
author: Sydney L.

description: So yelp just totally let me down- for the first time. I just went here for lunch and grabbed a chicken shwarma. It was meh. The chicken was pretty flavorless. My girlfriend had the falafel wrap, it was meh too. Both have nothing on Truly Mediterranean in the mission. My hunt for a decent mediterranean lunch in soma will continue. 2 stars because the food came out instantly.
author: lance b.

description: After my initial excitement that a new lunch place had opened up near the office had died down, I realized that Ayola is completely mediocre and not worth patronizing. The lamb gyros is dry, the chicken gyros is completely over processed, and the falafel is drier than the lamb gyros. Also, what's up with the sandwiches not being in the pita pocket? They're made of a dry (anyone notice a trend?) piece of pita wrapped around your choice of filling, plus some lettuce and some bad tzatziki. I'd rather eat across the street at Cafe Madeleine for the millionth time than have lunch from here.
author: Jon L.

description: Someone mentioned Greek food this morning and for the rest of the morning I was completely distracted by my craving for chicken shawarma. I finally gave in and ran up to Ayola to cure my craving. Warm, soft bread, tender chicken and their magical combination of sauce and veggies. Delish! Somehow, even with a lunch crowd, they are speedy-fast and always smiling.
author: jen m.

description: The combination platter here is AWESOME. The dolmas melt in your mouth (and, dare I say, better than any dolmas I had in Athens). Basically no space to eat, but walk to the public lobby on the corner of Mission and 2nd to eat your pita to your heart's content.
author: Nick A.

description: Pretty good for vegetarians. The falafel sandwich is good, comes in a pita like you'd get in NYC (except $6 rather than $3). I got the 7" and it's just falafel, lettuce, hummus and sauce, no tomato even, but still hearty. This is unlike say Saffron and Truly Med where they use lavash and create a giant wrap packed with veggies, french fries, etc to rival a burrito. Not sure if that's more what the 9" version is like here? Also on the pros side their red sauce and fries are awesome. Service was incredibly fast, and friendly. I'd eat here again.
author: Dave M.

description:
Delicious. I usually get sick of things if I eat them all the time but I honestly think I could eat their chicken gyro, every day, for the rest of my life. Every ingredient has unbelievable flavor, especially the tzatziki (yogurt sauce). Not to mention their spanikopita and AMAZING falafel. And yes, even though I tend to avoid fries, they really are perfection. Service is great.. this is much more of a takeout place as there is limited seating.  

It's possible that I go here 4 times a week.  My coworkers definitely think I am OCD about this place.
author: Rachel M.

description: Falafels from here are OK, but quality has definitely deteriorated in the last few months. They also have given me stomach upsets on a few occasions.
author: Sam A.

description: Good food, Good price. Great Fast Service with a smile.   A little far from my office to walk here regularly, but when ive got some time to spare I'll be here again!!
author: Joey R.

description: Yum. I tried this today when I walked down to get a burrito from chipolte and the line wrapped around the entire store. So, two doors down I tried this place. Very good. I had the falafel, and a root beer, A&W (not crappy mug or dad's - blech), I'll be here again!
author: C D.

description: I love the gyro/schawarma and the hummus!  There are not a lot of Middle Eastern restaurants in downtown/SOMA area so I'm happy there's one nearby!  Definitely try the Gyro/Schawarma for lunch! You won't regret it!
author: JenJen W.

description: For $9 I got a pretty decent gyro, a pretty AMAZING set of fries, and a can of soda. At first I was a little wary of dropping almost $10 on my lunch break but I am so glad that I did. The fries make the entire meal worth it. Will definitely be coming back to get more of those, try the menu options, get fast service, and smile at the cute counter girl.
author: Taylor M.

description: Great lunch spot.  Perfect portions, fresh tasting veggies, $7 for a large gyro. I will definitely be going back.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Love the Macedonian salad that has chicken, feta, apples and walnuts, served with the most delicious warm bread. I like to get a small side of hummus to go with mine as well. DELICIOUS!!

Just went there three times in a row this week. Try the Hortopita wrap, which is a vegetarian wrap with eggplant, tomatoes, feta and lettuce. It's the best! I also ordered a side of falafels and they were super nice and gave me fries for free.
author: Lucie T.

description:
I wasn't terribly impressed with the gyro from here... The flavors were almost there, but it just felt to much like fast food to me.

This was quite a bit thinner than a mission burrito, and almost twice as much... I wouldn't go back in a hurry, but I'd eat it again in a pinch.


Then again, I can't help but to compare it to the amazing gyro's that I get in NYC.
author: jacobe ..

description:
yum! 
i am sooo full right now. ugh. i both love and hate that. love the journey it took to get there, hate the bloated sluggish feeling afterwards. 
anyways, back to ayola:
so the fries really are that good. i'm always on a search for amazing fries. there's something about the perfectly fried potato that makes even the crappiest of days better. now i have one more place to add to my mental list of french fry havens. 
and the gyro i had was both tasty and fresh. which, considering this is SOMA and it is the lunch hour and alot of "fast" food kinds of places are greasy, chain, and completely unhealthy ya know?
author: rachel b.

description: i'm torn between 2 and 3 stars. i'll give them the benefit of the doubt since they were, indeed, nicely speedy at lunch time. but the food was just "eh". i got the chicken shwarma.
author: Raoul D.

description: super awesome greek gyros and falafel goodness.  the fries here are to die for and their secret spicy sauce is the best.
author: Tara H.

description: They make the best falafel in the bay area. Their sauces are unlimited and taste great. The service is great too. Not much seating place.
author: Manoj J.

description: Good lunch spot. I've had all menu items and have never been dissapointed. Very limited seating, so don't plan to eat there during lunch hour. Good prices.
author: Joe C.

description:
in the words of a fellow cube filler in my office, ayola is "super good' mediterranean cuisine.

it's not out of the ball park mediterranean cuisine, but it does reach the upper limits of "good."  in a neighborhood brimming with sandwich and salad options (omg, i'm so tired of sandwiches and salads) and mediocre mexican (ditto), a visit to ayola is like a vacation to the beautiful beaches of the middle east that i'm unlikely to ever take -- mostly because i don't ever get to take a vacation.

ps why is the ayola's customer base such a sausage fest?
author: Eric L.

description:
yum.


falafel sandwich in three minutes? and it's actually good? 
it's true. i swear.

and it's actually better than good. the falafel is crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.. and the pita is fresh and soft.

even better with hot sauce (make sure to ask for it).


only downside is it's $6.50, which to me seems steep for a falafel sandwich.. but maybe that's because i'm not completely acclimated to the unaffordability of san francisco.
author: natalie c.

description: delicious falafel sandwich - spicy please! $7 is the norm for this area.
author: Janine L.

description: seriously, the best fries!  i have totally gone in just to buy a bag of fries...so worth the $2 something.  i also really like their gyro combo platter.  it comes with a greek salad, hummus, tzatziki, and gyro meat!
author: Marjie T.

description: Love their Troy (gyro) salad! Huge and delicious.
author: ria l.

description: i go here for their troy salad (mediterranean salad with lamb) and for their lamb gyros... it's quick and fast for lunch... the dining atmosphere at their new montgomery consists of 2 tables and some bar seating... the seating is usually all taken up around lunch time which means most people brown paper bag it... their kearny restaurant has more seating for dining in purposes, and they also have a 2nd level for dining in... h-100...
author: Herb F.

description: gyro, hot sauce, french fries. i could eat you forever
author: Lia A.

description: I dropped by here for lunch last week and took my food to go, as the store is really tiny. I ordered the Chicken Shawarma and it was very tasty! Only thing that sucked was I didn't realize there was a delicious sauce they had put on it until the very last couple bites, as all the sauce had run to the bottom. Next time I'll try one of the gyro's and also the fries that everyone seems to rave about! Overall, a good place for a quick and tasty meal.
author: Jon W.

description: Not bad for take out.  I got the gyro plate which included a greek salad with feta & olives, hummus, yogurt sauce,  gyro meat and 1 warm pita.  The pita was warm and very soft they should give you more than 1 with the combo plate though.  The salad was refershing and a nice mix of flavors.  The hummous was tasy and the right consistency.  The gyro meat was a little dry but when eaten with the yogurt sauce was quite good.  Overall a pretty big portion and tasty
author: Melanie -.

description: great lamb gyro. the pita bread is the best i've had at a lunch-time spot downtown. the sandwich is overly drenched in sauce, tho. i didn't like the macedonian chicken salad, however. the dressing was really acidic, the chicken was pretty dry, and there wasn't enough feta on there for my liking. so go there for the gyros and prepare to make a mess. if you want a salad, go elsewhere.
author: AJ C.
